author: {'steamid': '76561198221321216', 'num_games_owned': 1652, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 142, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1712273592}
review:
[quote]Just saying, but I do have a curator page. If you somehow like my remarks about games, you can find more of them here: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44130985-TDP%27s-Gaming-Escapades [/quote]

[b]Disclaimer: I have finished the EX Turbo version on the casual and veteran difficulties, and went through a single level (not beaten) in hardcore hell difficulty to measure stuff. As for the original game, I have finished it on normal mode.[/b]
Super Galaxy Squadron is a shmup game published by the very unlikely fellows at New Blood Interactive. And I mean it in a good way, as New Blood is not widely known as a publisher that releases shmups and you would think them releasing one would be an out of season April Fools joke.
One thing that most people often fail to mention is that by buying this game, you get two games: "Super Galaxy Squadron" which is the original game, and "Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo" which is the remake. You can select either of the games upon startup, and I'm going to look at both of them.

[h2]The Original[/h2]
This is the very first version of the game, released in 2015.  It gives you the option to try an endless experience, or play through the normal arcade experience on two difficulty modes: Normal mode which gives you an admittedly generous health system to work with, allowing you to heal using health pickups and also by grazing enemy bullets, and Hardcore mode which is literally the 1 hit death mode, where 1 mistake throws you back to the beginning of the level.
The initial impressions of the game are quite positive. The controls are responsive, the audiovisual presentation is solid, the explosions are punchy and feel good, there are quite a lot of playable ships to choose...  But the game gets repetitive and dull after a while, because of how the gameplay feels as a whole.

The thing is, the difficulty scales in an uneven manner throughout the game, due to enemy patterns not having a cohesive design and planning to them and feeling like they just appear randomly to make the game easier or harder. If you have played a decent number of shmups, you won't have much trouble disposing of normal enemy waves on any difficulty setting. However, there are times that the game suddenly increases the difficulty by bringing in multiple enemies that have complex bullet patterns, then goes back to its normal behavior after you dispose of them.
And this applies to the bosses as well. Bosses always have a significant difficulty increase compared to the enemies that came before them. They hit very hard as not only their bullet patterns are much faster and arrive in larger numbers compared to normal enemies, but also the brief invulnerability frames sometimes cannot keep you safe from the barrage of bullets, allowing you to get hit multiple times in advance. 

Another aspect of the gameplay that I absolutely hate in shmup games (and even talked about it in my Drainus review), is the weapons powering down after getting hit. When hit by enemy projectiles, your primary and secondary weapons lose some of their collected level ups, with them appearing in the level as floating items, giving you a chance to collect them and get your firepower back. There are two problems with this.
First, the powerups usually cannot be collected as either the barrage of incoming bullets prevents you from doing so, or you'll find them getting thrown towards the enemies/bosses. Second, you can lose up to 3 level ups on each hit, meaning you can lose a whole lot of them if you are not careful or have trouble reading the playing area with how much shit is getting thrown around. This is such a harsh punishment for lesser experienced players and casuals in my opinion as it lengthens the already punishing bosses.

Then we have the issue of the game suddenly losing its charm at half-way point. After Stage 3, you have seen everything the game has to offer. From this point onwards, no new enemy will be introduced (aside from the bosses) and the music for levels 4 and 5 will be repeats from levels 1 and 2 respectively. This makes for repetitiveness and dullness, soon to be replaced with misery as you approach the final boss.
Final Weapon is probably one of the most infuriating final bosses I had to face in a shmup game. This boss, contrary to all of the other bosses in the game, does not have any HP bar; so you'll never know how close you were to victory. The visual clutter shows its worst form in this boss fight as well, which forced me to stop following the boss around and divert my focus to a small area at the bottom of the screen and try to survive the encounter. Overall, it's not a fun boss to end the game with.

As I ended my 1cc playthrough in normal mode, the game managed to give me one final "fuck you" alongside one mini heart attack in the form of a fatal error. Thanks, I guess.
Now, it's time to get to the remake. Oh, and not the EX version as it's unavailable right now and therefore I know nothing about it. We're going straight to EX Turbo.

[h2]EX Turbo Super Ultra Championship Arcade Edition +R: Type [nu-bld] & Knuckles[/h2]
Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo is the remake of the original game in a new Game Maker engine version which enhances a lot of stuff and adds a whole bunch of new features.
As obvious from the screenshots on the store page, the game has gotten a major overhaul in the presentation department. Graphically, the game looks much more high quality and cleaner. The redesigned user interface now makes use of the sides of the screen (which are completely empty in the original) and transfers all of the necessary information there in an easily identifiable manner. It even reacts to specific gameplay situations, providing visual cues whenever the overdrive mode gets activated or if the health is critically low, which is a much welcome addition for the player. The game now also shows each ship's attack style as well, which was a very good decision from the developers to make. Although it doesn't give you any visual information about their hyper attacks.
Storytelling has also been revamped. All story intermissions from the original game are now replaced with fully voice acted and animated cutscenes that have really good quality. Although there are no subtitles available. There are a bunch of gameplay additions as well. EX Turbo adds new difficulty options, a new boss rush mode, increases the score multiplier cap from 5 to 10, adds the new Overdrive and Focus (bullet time) abilities, adds a new boss (Harrier Ray), allows for ship switching at the beginning of every level, and nerfs the final boss to make it more tolerable while also giving them a HP bar.

Despite all these changes however, the core gameplay remains largely untouched. Enemy patterns still feel aimless, the difficulty spikes up and down occasionally in the manner explained before, there's no new music tracks or enemies, and the game still misses some crucial settings such as key rebinding. The only significant changes are the modifications to the final boss that make it somewhat more tolerable, and the addition of focus ability which gives you the power to slow down the bullets and dodge more efficiently.
But this ability is not without issues either. Upon using the new focus ability, the game turns into a jittery mess, because the game slows the frame rate down as well. The moment you press the focus button, the game goes from smooth 60 fps to jittery 30 fps, instead of just slowing down the gameplay speed.

[h2]TL;DR[/h2]
Definitely not for everyone, and especially hardcore players, as the gameplay doesn't have much to write home about and feels very repetitive after a while. There are better alternatives to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123529790', 'num_games_owned': 1019, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 116, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1711282565}
review: 这是一款硬核的弹幕射击游戏，拥有17种机型，普通难度设计友好，有子弹时间技能（键盘x），有保命大招（键盘c），灵活使用两个技能，通关难度不大，但是最后一关还是需要一定的背板，不然弹幕量超大，当然更硬核的玩家可以体验更高级的难度，甚至是地狱模式，游戏画风非常亮眼，音乐带感，玩起来可以说是一种享受，通关后，还有无尽模式和boss战模式，可以让你射到爆，喜欢此类画风和游戏类型的玩家，不要错过~只可惜F12截图不太好使，有几个场景还是很美的，没截图比较遗憾~

author: {'steamid': '76561198057473202', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1710431492}
review:
So this game has some pretty harsh reviews from shmup veterans and, while the criticism is warranted, I don't think the negative reviews are. The reputation this game has for being an easy shmup is true. It's pretty easy compared to most genre classics. That being said, there are tons of difficulty settings and you CAN make this game brutally hard if you actually use them. Does arcade - hell - hardcore ring a bell?

I think it's one of the best games to start playing shmups. It has so many options to gently ease new players into the genre. While easy, it's never mindless like some easy shmups are. It DOES succeed in teaching you skills that will help you master the genre. All that, plus the amount of characters and modes? And it's even affordable!

Noobs, this is a fine game for you to start with. It's a really fun game with a lot of variety and tons of options for you to decide how hard you want the game to be. For those seeking the next TOP TIER shmup that makes you lose your mind: this probably isn't it, but it's certainly a very fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141466938', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1709369665}
review:
[h3]Um shmup divertido com uma dificuldade bem equilibrada.[/h3]

O modo Arcade apresenta três níveis de dificuldade (Casual, Veterano e Hell), acompanhados por dois modos de jogo: o modo [u]Normal[/u] , que proporciona a queda de itens de cura e conta com checkpoints perfeitos para iniciantes; e o modo [u]Hardcore[/u] , no qual não há disponibilidade de itens de cura nem checkpoints, tornando-o mais divertido e desafiador.

Além disso, o jogo apresenta dois modos extras: [u]Endless[/u] , que funciona com um esquema de waves, tornando-se mais difícil conforme você sobrevive por mais tempo, e o modo [u]Boss Rush[/u] .

Quanto às naves, são 17 ao todo, cada uma com seus próprios status, estilo de tiro e habilidade [b]hyper[/b] diferente. Há opções para todos os gostos.

A pixelart é bonita e colorida, e a música é competente, com algumas faixas bastante empolgantes. No geral, é um ótimo jogo, super recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199214475420', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1709317113}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961851560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1708746259}
review:
Amazing game, especially for $1. The music is awesome, although somewhat repetitive. There are a ton of ships to choose from which would make the replay-ability above average. I completed my first play-through in under an hour, the 8 bosses were very enjoyable and the bullet patterns where challenging and very fun. The weapon leveling system is somewhat linear, but the hyper charge mechanic was alot of fun. The only major drawback is Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo is only single player, but with how well choreographed the bullet patterns are it would be way to much to handle.

TLDR: for $1, I give this a 10/10
for full price, I have this a 8/10

https://youtu.be/lNt7i0LbU8Q?si=i3WbJjkZv1CNl0X_

author: {'steamid': '76561198853518022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1708972325}
review:
really dull level design, enemies seemingly placed at random with no thought of synergising their pattenrs or placing them in an enviroment, they just visibly teleport ontop of the level and float in slowly
lack of creativity in the asthetics, the game is comprised of static jpgs with no animations besides sprite rotating

having 17 playable ships is completely unnecessary and is a waste of resources

music is generic chiptune with no identifiable melodies just randomly going up and down on the scale
stages are identical enemy spam for 2 mins before a boring boss fight

focus mechanic deliberately makes the framerate choppy when you could of just slowed the game speed down???

if this was someones introduction to shmups and bullet hell games then it wouldnt make them a fan

it feels like new blood was like "hey wouldnt it be funny if we made a bullet hell shooter" and then they did the bare minimum to acomplish that goal because they dont really care about making one thats any good, they just want to say that they did it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032664419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1708870811}
review:
Exceptionally boring and difficulty is all over the place.

Stages are all the exact same, there is no feeling like you are moving to somewhere or anything to keep your attention, only a mindless spawn of the same exact enemy types over and over, going on for far too long.

Meanwhile bosses are way more lethal, bordering on bullshit (especially TFB), but also have rather uninspired attacks (repeated circle pattern hello).

Go play ZeroRanger or Crimzon Clover instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006503378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1708858547}
review: theres a lot of valid criticism here from other people who know a lot more than i do (i.e. bad balancing, ugly bullet time, no brake, etc), but my main issue with the game is the terrible player hitbox communication. while a tiny hitbox is really nice for newer shmup players like me, its nigh impossible to gauge more precise timings because i have no idea where the hitbox is exactly, and theres no option to show it anywhere (like in some kind of practice mode). my biggest issue with this is that there isnt a second, larger hitbox for collecting items, meaning i consistently miss upgrades and beneficial health pickups in the barrage of bullets im trying to weave through at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992476962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1708683635}
review:
東方プレイヤーであれば、ほぼ初見撃破レベルの低難度のSTG。

音楽は方向性としては好みだが素人っぽく、若干へっぽこ感があって、テンション上がりきらない。

アイテムジャラジャラ感とか打って壊す感じは気持ち良い。

セールで120円とかだったのでまあいいかと言う感じだが、
脳汁とか、やりがいとか、緻密さとか、芸術性とか、そういうのはまったくない。

STGを本当にやったことがない人が、雰囲気をちょろっと味合うには良い作品だと思う。
値段的にも。

author: {'steamid': '76561198005439390', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1708652141}
review:
+ + + + + Pros: + + + + +

+ Gameplay: Solid

+ Art: Solid

+ Music: Solid

+ Sound Design: Solid




- - - - - Cons: - - - - -

- No waifus.

- Music is way too loud compared to voice acting, & they don't have separate volume sliders.

- I cant see any reason why I wouldn't have the fire button held down all the time. That being the case,
it probably shouldn't require a button press, & just fire on it's own without input. That would save me having to use third party software to save myself from thumb cramp.

- The story could be interpreted as implying that human supremacy is somehow a bad thing.

- Has the same 'Strong angry brown woman with side-shave' that every game has to have now. I wouldn't mind, but when the same character is in literally everything, it's starts to get irritating. They certainly don't get any points for originality or thinking outside the box.




Notes:
I paid less than a quid for this on sale, & for that price, it's OK.
Not sure I would want to pay more than that, as this really isn't anything special.

author: {'steamid': '76561199524534232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1708245679}
review:
Very fun bullet-hell/Shoot em up game. Nostalgic music and graphic.
You can chose between many ships with different speed and ammo type.
Not very hard, but properly challenging on normal difficulty. I beat it in 3.2 hours(not in one sitting).
It is worth getting it for full asking price!

author: {'steamid': '76561199085653777', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1704116441}
review:
Squadron - это одно большое уныние.
В игре нет абсолютно ничего интересного. Игра больше походит на очередную мобильную дрочильню, которая добралась до стима. И то на телефоне это игралось бы лучше. 
Различия в кораблях как такого нет, они все как скинчки идут. Геймплей соответственно почти никогда не меняется - просто уворачивай свой корабль от снарядов. Надоедает за 20 минут. Игра ещё, как я понял, просто клон слордакса от ид. Ещё игра даже не даёт в шифт таб зайти.

0/10. Не вижу ни одной причины покупать этот мусор.

author: {'steamid': '76561199389353560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1696970449}
review:
A nice distraction, with great variety of characters to choose from and an awsome soundtrack.
On the easy side as far as shmups go (except for the final boss, which got nerfed but is still quite a challenge).

author: {'steamid': '76561198138613098', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1711651247}
review: Das Spiel is ziemlich schnell eines meiner liebsten modernen Shoot em ups geworden. Die Musik hat Wumms, die Waffen haben Wumms, es ist flashy, ein Noob wie ich kann was reißen. Macht von vorn bis hinten einfach Spaß. Und dass so viele verschiedene Schiffe verfügbar sind, erhöht den Wiederspielwert ungemein. Uneingeschränkte Empfehlung von mir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025417342', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1701995124}
review: Got this because I love all of New Blood's other games - This game is awesome, 90s shmup greatness - huge bosses, tons of ships to choose from, crazy bullet patterns, a fun scoring system, and lots of replay-ability, with a boss rush and endless mode. If you like shmups or bullet hell games I highly recommend you check this out

author: {'steamid': '76561198027793687', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1701106855}

author: {'steamid': '76561199251623197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1709521687}
review: This is one of the most fun games I have ever played, and that's coming from someone who doesn't really play SHMUPs all that often. While some ships do feel better than others, most ships are genuinely very fun to use. Two of my favorite ships are Black and Chrome, but there are other that I also like quite a bit. So, if you have like ten bucks, then I highly recommend getting this game if you are interested.

review:
No se porque, pero me trajo muchísimos recuerdos principalmente a I Wanna Be The Guy, quizás porque ese juego estaba basado en los juegos que este esta basado.
Te hace sentirte poderoso, y la temática "lluvia de balas", se puede resumir en una palabra, CAÓTICO, y eso me encanta en un juego de tiros y explosiones.
Quizás no a todos les llame la atención un juego de este estilo de arcades, pero hay que probar primero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076262202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1697730661}
review: Flashy almost to the point of being obnoxious, which is no doubt exactly what the devs intended. The playable ships have surprisingly varied kits, and the well-balanced difficulty curve makes this a great game to continually come back to. Really great game to pick up in intermittent hour-ish bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137825457', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1696477909}
review: Um Bullet Hell indie de alta qualidade, durante as promoções da Steam o preço é baixíssimo. Gráficos coloridos e muito bonitos, trilha sonora oldschool que casa perfeitamente com o jogo. Sistema de armas com dois tipos de tiros simultâneos que poder ter upgrade até 5 níveis, mais uma arma especial no lugar da bomba que precisa ser carregada, barra de energia única ao invés de naves extras. No geral é um jogo difícil, mesmo sendo veterano nos shmups precisei de três tentativas para termina-lo no modo normal. Contras: Não encontrei opções dentro do jogo para troca de resoluções e modo Tate, quem sabe elas existam em algum arquivo de configuração ou via parâmetro. Enfim, no geral, recomendadíssimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035445488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1695964025}
review:
So before I start to review this, a few things to get out of the way first:

- Total Grade 6/10
- If you are new to shmups, this can be a serviceable start (more dumb fun than anything, it won't last long in your shmup journey), but I still don't generally recommend it (I give better options at the bottom).
- Not recommended to anyone who has played practically any other shmups.
- If you want to support New Blood, I'd recommend picking up the other titles first.

Pros:
- The game has good game feel. Explosions are punchy, score items are large and dumb, ship attacks are extravagant.
- Bullet patterns are fine for beginners, more on the side of traditional shmup attacks with different leading and spread volleys combos.
- Good selection of modes, and multiple difficulties to spend time improving at.
- (Too) Many pilots. Not a lot of balance but there is a type for everyone.

Cons:
- The stages are terrible. The balance between enemies and bosses is non-existent. You'll die from boredom before you die from hits during the leadups to the bosses. Consequently,
- Bosses are not tuned properly. Most of the boss fights aren't memorable, and several of them have atleast one wave of highly condensed purple ring projectiles that move exceptionally fast. This is guaranteed to be where you take most of your hits. Generally, you''ll go from tons of fodder enemies that exist long enough to shoot like 6 slow moving projectiles at you to a boss that fires a static mesh of bullets at an incredibly fast speed (with even faster leading shots mixed in as well). 
- Even after the repass, the TFB is still badly designed, which hasd kinda confirmed for me that this game has had its difficulty built around the slow motion technique (which looks laughably bad in action). Also, the fact that this update came out right at the same time as a steam sale dedicated to shmups makes me think in hindsight it was quickly pushed out to capitalize on new sales. The balancing was focused on lowering the health and lessening the bullets a little bit for each wave, but the real problem is that the TFB is a trash fight with bull**** patterns that aren't fun to learn. 
- The biggest negative? The game has had repass after repass, been updated several times now - and it is still unfun to play. There is no soul to any of the patterns, the music is low-effort outside of like the final 2 songs (God the standard boss tune sounds like some demented hoe-down music whenever it starts), level difficulty doesn't ever match up with boss difficulty, and I feel no interest in attempting a true 1cc now that I've actually played shmups made from people who care about the genre.

TLDR - Before you consider buying this game, please look at 

Mushihimesama
Gunvein
Demonizer
JamesTown+
Blue Revolver
ZeroRanger
Crimzon Clover


Generally any one of those titles are on sale often, and any of them would be a more worthwhile shmup over this, for new or old players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383366135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1712188835}
review:
With the updates to the this game, especially on the final boss, I am completely re-writing my review.

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up with 16-bit aesthetic and a be aggressive or welcome the bullet hell simple game play I greatly enjoy.

The controls for Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo are right in that sweet spot for me.  As I prefer a simpler STG setup.  You have your primary fire that can be powered up via pick-ups along with a secondary weapon that fires along with the primary weapon with its own power up meter and different pick ups.  From there, the player as a Focus, which slows the game down allowing for some tricky micro-dodging.  As well as a Hyper attack.  Which pretty much everything based on the selected pilot/ship.

And Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo features a large roster of pilots/ships to pick from.  Each with their own power, armor and speed.  In addition to their own primary, secondary and hyper attacks.  Me, I prefer a powerful slower ship and liked the cut of the Amber pilot/ship's gib.  This pilot primary weapon is a wide forward shot with a lighter spread shot with a sort of short-ranged forward depth charge type secondary attack with really fed by aggressive, point-blank as much as possible play style.  Even Amber's hyper was decent being a defensive forward shield that lasted for a few seconds, which both can get me out trapped corner or point-blank a boss with all weapons.

The game play rewards aggressive play.  I found myself sticking to the upper half of the screen during more of the non-boss fights.  However, the game also features enemies that come in from the sides to prevent me from residing at the top less I get attacked from behind.  

The speed at which game plays is just about perfect.  Not overly fast as to make it tough to dodge, but also not so slow (without using the Focus slow-down ability) allow a player to easily micro-dodge bullet patterns.  Even though I don't think the slow-down mechanic has changed, I found myself actually making better use of it after these major patches. Still not so often as to drain the meter, but just enough to weave through something I really shouldn't at full speed.

The graphics are exactly the kind I like in my shoot 'em ups.  That colorful 90's video game style.  Though, I will admit the enemy bullet coloration could be a tad better at times.  But even that, really wasn't a hindrance, so much as it was just getting used to it.  The music and sound is decent.  Nothing I'm rushing out to get the OST, but also nothing I'm going to mute.  

Now for the big update that completely turned me around on this game.  Previously, the final boss was a major difficult spike.  Not impossible by any means, but the change in difficult was very stark.  Up until the final boss, I'd say over all Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo was on the easier side of STGs.  Not a pushover by any means, but seasoned shmup player could easily make it to the end in a couple of hours regardless of which ship/pilot they ultimately selected.  

But the final boss before the patch ramped-up the challenge that I might have beaten with the best pilot (i.e. the one that did it the fastest), with maxed out primary/secondary weapons and a full Hyper meter.  Goodness knows I came really close with Amber and a drained Hyper meter.  The game has save checkpoints that resets the player if they fail.  But the lack of a health bar and greatly increased bullet speed made my attempts a lot more about luck and my reflexes holding out long enough to whittle the boss down.  I'm sure I got close a few times, but never did beat the game in that state.  And I didn't really want to try, as the spike just left a bad taste in mouth and really ruined the entire experience before it.  Now the boss is still tough, but it is just toned down enough that it feels more inline with the casual or veteran difficulty of the rest of the game.  I'm sure it's still a beast on the harder difficulties than that for the player really seeking a test of skills.

When I bought this game, it really didn't seem like the developer was going to fix that.  Despite their insistence they would in the discussion here on Steam.  But they were true to their word.  Hence, I am completely rewriting my review from a negative to a positive.    Because even before the patch, the game was a lot of fun.  It was just ruined with a extra-hard turd boss at the end that felt completely out place with the rest of the game's challenge.  Now that it's been fixed, I highly recommend Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo.  Particularly to newer shmup players as this game still has a bite to it, but it won't kick you between the legs at every opportunity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096501573', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1688406479}
review:
Excelente, barato e tem conteúdo bem massa pra replay caso queira. Jogatina padrão de 30 minutos com som que lembra músicas de 8 e 16 bits, bem divertido no geral.

Existem naves que podem ser questionáveis na campanha porém não fique preso a isso, algumas naves são melhores em certos modos de jogo que outras, como Boss Rush e Endless, e felizmente o jogo te dá 3 naves bem roubadas pra fazer tudo sem tanta preocupação.

Então Super Galaxy Squadron é um jogo que entrega até mais do que o que foi pago pelo jogo, com direito a dois "jogos" sendo a sua versão clássica ou a EX com uso de Focus.

Se gosta de shmups ou tem interesse em aprender nem que seja brevemente sobre bullet hell, não tem motivo pra deixar passar. Felizmente o jogo conta com 3 dificuldades e duas modalidades dentro delas. A "moderna" com saves e recuperação de HP no meio das fases com itens e a hardcore que lembra a experiência de fliperama, de uma única ficha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026607318', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1682833887}
review: I'm not sure I've ever played a decent shmup before, and it's fun! There's just something satisfying about zipping in between impossible bullet patterns while making the screen incomprehensible to anyone watching with your wave of bullets. This one has a nice range of options too, so you can play it as a sensible person would, or you can be a crazy person if you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076810393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1678559435}
review: I was looking for a classic vertical shooter game, but modern, and this one seemed to be it. The soundtrack and art work is really good. The scale of the last boss however, is really frustrating even on casual. Everything else was easy and then the final boss was weird. Also, there wasn't even a health bar, so you have no idea if you're doing any sort of damage. It lets you change ships on the levels preceding the boss, but not during the boss fight itself. There is no save feature as well, so you're stuck with the ship you picked... and no way to go back. Unless you just restart the entire game again. I honestly don't know how I'm able to dodge certain instances, but then I don't. It feels really random, its like, 'oh sh*t I don't know how I dodged that, but this one hit me?!' If you want to kill some time though, its only $10 bucks, and you could get for cheaper when on sale, and you just shoot a bunch of stuff. So not much to lose here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973336114', 'num_games_owned': 2672, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1677479773}
review:
I really liked this game.  I have some gripes about the last boss, which I'll get in to.  But anyway, let the bullet points roll.

Pros
- AMAZING music.
- 17 pilots/ships, so tons of variety.
- Some real unique and interesting mechanics for some of the ships.
- Has a slomo meter to make things a tad easier for newcomers or less skilled players (the meter still needs to be slowly built-up, so you cannot just spam it).
- A decent story.  It's no Sine Mora, but what shmup - or any game - is?
- Besides the slomo, I'd say it's still fairly accessible.  It's not QUITE at true bullet hell level (remember kids, something like Cuphead is NOT a bullet hell.  "Bullet hell" is so misused these days, RIP genre names), but is faster and more saturated than say the 1940 series or Jamestown.

Cons
- No invincible frames after hit can cause for some big cascading damage on you in later stages/bosses.  Especially if you're hunting down your lost upgrades from getting hit.
- Despite the amazing variety of ships, not all are balanced equally.
- Last boss is...something.  YMMV depending on your pilot/ship.  I decided to start over my entire save w/ a different ship just to beat the last boss.  However, may be possible to beat w/ any ship w/ certain cheese.  Last boss I'd say IS 100% a bullet hell boss, tho.  But it incentivizes you to play a certain way that seems a bit counter-intuitive.
- Endless Mode (and maybe Boss Rush?) does not save your points records history.  I know I got 25,000,000 pts on Endless once.  But...just no way to show or prove it.

Neutral
- I am not sure if no invinc frames is genre standard or not.  I want to say it sticks out to me because I'm used to invinc frames?  Either way, no invinc frames, fwiw.  The snowballing damage is still a con, though, since it seems almost inevitable at times.

Anyway, a solid shmup/bullet hell w/ some real interesting mechanics and great music.  I'm okay at shmups and beat this in less than 6 hrs total, which includes 2 runs to last boss and probably ~2 hrs doing Endless Mode w/ all ships.  The replayability is in ship variety and self-imposed challenges.  I do recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012025930', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1677523834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127321391', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1675294094}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo é um shmup muito legal, o jogo com rolamento automático na vertical tem como grande diferencial a disponibilidade de inúmeras naves para você escolher.

Há três modos de jogo: arcade, endless e boss rush. Durante um bom tempo tentei terminar o game no modo arcade na dificuldade hardcore, mas não obtive sucesso, então joguei na dificuldade normal, ainda assim a tarefa foi complicada.

A diferença entre as dificuldades é que no normal há itens de reposição de energia e checkpoint. Para quem for se aventurar a terminar sem continue, o chekpoint é inútil, a não ser para treinar o estágio ou chefe onde você morreu. Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo trabalha com barra de energia e não há vidas extras.

Em Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo sua nave possui tiro rápido, não sei se todas as naves possuem o ataque carregado, para isso basta não atirar e depois que um círculo ao redor de sua nave for completado, ao apertar o botão de tiro, o ataque é disparado. 

Há uma movimentação lenta temporária, chamada Focus, onde tudo que há na tela fica em câmera lenta e permite que o jogador se movimente com maior precisão para desviar dos disparos inimigos, no hud ela é representada por uma barra mais fina de cor amarelada ao lado da barra Hyper.

Existe um ataque especial chamado Hyper, cada nave possui um movimento próprio. Para abastecer o Hyper e o Focus, basta coletar os itens azuis que são liberados pelos inimigos destruídos. Esses itens são atraídos para sua nave automaticamente a curta distância.

Sobre as naves, eu optei por jogar com a Black, ela possui uma excelente arma secundária. As armas primárias e secundárias de todas as naves podem ser evoluídas até o quinto nível. O Hyper de Black funciona como escudo e também maximiza seus ataques. 

Toda vez que você toma dano, além da perda de energia, você pode perder poder de fogo das armas primárias e secundárias. Após o dano, durante certo período, os itens ficam flutuando na tela, sendo assim é possível você recuperar o poder de fogo, com sorte, totalmente.

Sobre a pontuação, o game trabalha com sistema de combo que maximiza sua pontuação, pelo que entendi o ideal é você jogar mais na ofensiva, destruindo seus inimigos o mais perto possível, e tentar manter o multiplicador alto. Além disto, há outras bonificações no jogo, como itens secretos que podem ser obtidos ao posicionar sua nave sobre os círculos semitransparentes até fazer o item aparecer.

Graficamente Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo é muito bem feito, não encontrei defeito algum, gostei do design das naves, inimigos, hud, a escolha da paleta de cores, uma arte pixelada de excelente bom gosto.

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo possui uma trilha sonora muito cativante, inclusive há uma música cantada. Há dublagem nas cutscenes entre os estágios e os efeitos sonoros são bem decentes.

Encontrei pequenos e poucos problemas na parte sonora, é possível ouvir o som do seu tiro enquanto a fase não começa e quando se morre o alarme não para de tocar até o jogo recomeçar do check point.

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo só parece curto, além de tentar fechar sem continue, há uma conquista que pra mim foi bem complicada de obter, Mariner, foram inúmeras tentativas até consegui-la. 

Em relação ao jogo em si, o último chefe possui ataques complicados para desviar, eu fiquei com uma baita dor na região da nuca após finalizar o game devido a enorme tensão. 

Eu achei Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo muito divertido, é bonito, possui uma boa trilha sonora e um desafio cativante que obriga o jogador testar todas as naves para encontrar a que melhor se adapte ao seu estilo. Uma vez escolhida a nave, é hora de traçar estratégias para a conclusão dos desafios que não são nada fáceis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297366407', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1676853659}
review:
Just a Heads Up: There is an achievement called Mariner that is almost f'ing impossible. After 3-4 hrs, I finally got the max bonus on the boss. You will likely need to cap your Max Frames to 20 FPS in the Nvidia Settings b/c for 50 secs you can gnarly miss a shot. I almost did it uncapped but gave up after 2hrs. More details in the Discussion Pages. I'll post up a vid.

Concerning final boss complaints, I have to wonder how one would nerf the final boss on Normal Mode. I've been playing a decent amount of shooters lately, and I have to say that this Final Boss is the easiest of the lot. In fact, I can not think of any easier final boss that I have played on a shooter game going back to the NES. Like I usually need a handful of bombs, full lives, a pack of smokes, a hand grenade, and maybe a continue or three to beat most final shmup bosses. This guy. He hit me 2 times. I used some prism special pilot. Most of the pattern is sitting at the middle'ish part of the screen and when a targeted bullet comes your way then you do a light tap into the next column of the patterned bullets, and you just keep doing that tap if need be until the 75% edge of the screen, then slo-mo back to center and repeat, or if the wave changes directions then just tap back from where you came.

Everything seemed escape-able. And I didn't have to make much use of the slowdown mechanic. Using the slow down makes this game quite the cakewalk, but also, fun so I used it a bit. Bullets are easy to see. Bullets are large. Bullets are fairly slow. Patterns are cliche. For ppl complaining about the final boss, this is unfortunately a case where a person will need to put in some work in this genre to attain Victory. Other shooters & their bosses that could help are Danmaku Unlimited 3, RefRain, Steredeen. All those shooters' bosses have very symmetrical patterns. They're not super easy, but mix it up a bit, work on those patterns for a few hours, come back here, and you will have a good chance at trouncing this boss, too.

I wish I would have put the game in Hardcore mode my first run through b/c I might have 1CC'd as I think I only got hit like 6 times total for a normal casual playthru, maybe it was 5 times lol. All I know is that this is way easier than the shmups I have picked up lately, notably old school Raiden games & Danmaku Unlimited 3. 

Also, thanks for doing voice acting on this thing. I am a sucker for voice acting, and I can appreciate the little extra time put into this shmup by adding some story. For two-fifty, this game is a steal!

::Extra Thoughts::

Okay, 1CC'd on Hardcore Mode on my 2nd playthrough. If I hadn't made a strong cup of coffee beforehand then I would have beat him 1st try, but I was getting all jittery and sweaty from an espresso followed by coffee. Okay, so Hardcore Mode is legit easy. Your life refills after every level. LMAO. You wanna be a 1CC Shmup'ER, dudes & dudettes, This Is Your GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198825715879', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1666556047}
review:
The only reason this is a not recommend is the final boss in the Turbo version.

I really liked the game and the inclusion of the classic version was wonderful!
The game is beginner friendly (mostly) and has a lot of neat ships, fully voice acted cut-scenes and amazing music. For the most part it is fine in terms of gameplay and difficulty UNTIL the final boss.
While there are so many great aspects and some meh or mediocre ones the thing that really sticks out is the Final Weapon in the turbo version.
This boss is absolute BS in every sense and completely unfair compared to the rest of the game AND compared to the classic version. Too many projectiles, not enough space to dodge them, boss is a bullet sponge, too much damage, etc. I spent more time on the final boss than getting to the final boss.

This problem was not present on the Classic version of the game as there was more room to dodge and sprites were smaller.
I really wish there was a a meh option on steam somewhere between recommended and not recommended, because I still think this is a good game when on sale AND you get the classic which feels more balanced overall.

Get it on sale for the classic, and get ready to spend 20 minutes hoping the RNG throws you some health.
Wish the Devs still worked on the game :c
developer_response: THE BOSS HAS BEEN NERFED AND IMPROVED! GET BACK IN THERE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198981462228', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1704263424}
review:
funny game
*some spoilers for the game by the way*
right now ive played on hell difficulty for ex turbo (normal mode though) even though it was my first time playing, gonna check out classic later and update this review as my opinions change and/or i have something more to add

first off, with the positives, this game finally let me live out my dreams of playing as marisa with homing lasers, god bless teal
i like the fast pace, and dodging the fast as hell bullets gives a sense of thrill when you manage to survive
the boss designs look cool
i didnt really give that much a thought on the story though, i skipped all of the cutscenes and got straight to the gameplay

now for a few gripes i have with the game... the difficulty, atleast on hell mode, is weird. most of the game is actually pretty easy even on hell mode, which is supposed to be the hardest, and the only times i died early on were because i was still getting used to the controls
i forgot the name of the final boss, was it final weapon or machine? i dunno, but it was a SERIOUS difficulty spike to be honest. most of the game is easy then it hits you with a ton of incredibly fast bullets, as if expecting you have focus on the entire time... the only way i really got past it was cheesing the second phase (which is the hardest) by just staying above it and destroying its minions, hoping i get enough hp and upgrades to then deal a decent amount of damage then going back up again
i would also like a normal lives system rather than the only options being checkpoints or none at all, though that is just my opinion

despite my gripes it is still pretty fun and i would recommend it, and it is very cheap as well

author: {'steamid': '76561198035130011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1672399603}
review:
[h1] Entry level SHUMP	[/h1]
First and foremost I want to say that they should have used the song from the credit in their trailer to sell the game. Now for 2 euros you get a basic SHMUP with 1 attack and one special but also a huge 17 different ships roster to get your ROI. The gameplay is much about avoiding bullets patterns and it is very well done on that aspect there are easy to see and memorize and I can distinguish easily what is to be avoided and what is to be caught, the bullets are big and their speed is not too fast, most bullets are about the speed of your ship and there are no suprise bullet hitting you from nowhere. Also, there is a gauge that recharges itself to slow down the game when I am in difficulty and another one to go into overdrive mode when I am having a really good time on the combo system. It is relatively easy for a shmup and it is welcome if you ask me, a casual shmuper,  I completed the game on normal difficulty and without the hardcore mode on (each difficulty has a hardcore mode) in a little less than an hour with a few continues yes but much less continues than it would taken me with any other shmup I have played. Super Galaxy Squadron Ex Turbo looks wonderful, sounds good. 7.5/10. Great Stuff on Handeld device.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963660521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1662826379}
review:
A for effort, a good try at a shmup. Wanted to like it, but it just wasn't fun. 

The main problem, that other reviews have already pointed out, is the poor level design. It's just the same enemies with the same attack patterns for all 6 levels. The backgrounds are also really boring and don't interact with the gameplay at all. 

Bosses are also boring, and only have a couple of attack patterns. Playing on veteran mode the game felt super easy, until you get to the last boss. The last boss just sucks, it brings the difficulty from 0 to 1000, and it's attack patterns aren't even fun, they just feel cheap and dodging them basically forces you to use the slow down ability (which I didn't use at all up to the final boss). 

I also really didn't like the forced chiptunes soundtrack. It was way too heavy, didn't fit the levels, and sounded too much like a  poor imitation of the band Anamanaguchi 

On the plus side, the production values are top notch. The pixel graphics are great, the sound effects and punchy and satisfying, and the UI looks retro but functional. Controls are super tight, and felt on par with classic Japanese shmups.

This game feels like it was made by a very talented development team, and even if I consider it a miss, I'd be excited to check out this teams next project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106145203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1662165451}
review: Are you a noob at bullet hell and wanna learn SHMUPs? I do too, which is why I booted this up b/c at some point it entered my steam library, presumably from a bundle. It whips ass - great intro to the genre with a ton of variety between the selectable ships. The music slaps and the action is blood pumping. Scaling difficulty options let you make this one as hard as you want to - Casual w/ life bar was easy enough for me (a noob) to beat while still having a blast throughout and Hardcore is the kind of stuff I watch others do on youtube in complete disbelief and amazement. Lots of distinct play variety between the ships and you have the option to select a different ship for every level if you want while still keeping your accrued upgrades which I thought was a very cool feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024820628', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1656857600}
review:
I played this game, i enjoyed it on casual, but the Final Weapon is just totally out of place. I managed to beat it on casual somehow though. 

So i played veteran. I am not really new to shmups, so the 6 stages were actually not really difficult at all.... and then came the Final Weapon. Its an unfair joke. An absolutely insane - totally unbalanced bossfight compared to the whole game. 

So i came to the game's forums, if others felt the same - turned out, the reviews and forum posts are full of that complaint - then i saw the developers "trolling" responses to those totally valid criticisms - even after years he is just joking around with that "we will fix this hahahaa" attitude - that never happened.

A good shmup is the one, where the difficulty is consistent. It can - and should - feature difficult bossfights, but the stages should prepare you for that, and there should be some fairness, and balance in the game. (or keep that kind of unreal insanity for Hell difficulty or something).

The attitude of the dev on the forums is my only reason, that i will refund this game, becouse its clear , there is no intention here to fix an unbalanced gameplay element. 

They complaining here since years. Its 2022. Fix will never come. Enjoy only casual guys, or waste half of your life on "normal" difficulty to end this.

Really, i have never seen such a straight up lying for YEARS to your costumers, by a dev. Its just strange to me seeing this attitude. It would be even better to just say: i want this game to be unbeatable, unfair, and i will keep it this way. At least people would know, they dont have to pay a penny for this and the dev would be an honest man.

I won't recomment this developer at all, won't buy any other game from him, just go to the forums, read his responses... incredible

author: {'steamid': '76561198339390190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1709351609}
review:
SGS is a pretty alright shmup with a few glaring issues. The variety in playable ships is great, and they all have unique mechanics that change the way they play, so definitely try all of them out to find your favorite. The hyper attack mechanic is a bit simple but a nice inclusion, and the focus/slowdown ability is a great way to make the massive amounts of bullets feel manageable in later stages. The soundtrack is INCREDIBLE, especially the credits theme (thanks for adding lyrics to it, very cool), and most of the boss fights are really engaging and well designed.

But the issues come in some of the difficulty balancing, stage variety, and the overall amount of content. The final boss is a HUGE difficulty spike, and while I had a somewhat fun time figuring out how to beat it, it definitely needs some rebalancing. The levels feel really bland, and there's no clear patterns to when enemies show up, so it just feels like they show up randomly, which makes all the levels feel really similar to each other. Lastly, once you beat arcade mode, that's most of the game's content already finished. The achievements are nice but don't add much replay value, and while messing around with all the ships in endless mode is fun for a little while, that also stops feeling satisfying.

Overall, SGS isn't a bad game, but its definitely very "arcade style" as opposed to most PC/Console shmups that have a bit more structure and extra content to them. At full price its a bit too expensive considering the content included, but if it sounds like your thing, give it a shot!

review: One of my favourite neo Bullet Hell Shooters. Extremely fun on the Steam Deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309882298', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1696092679}
review:
Just like what others said: game is fun, until you meet the real final boss (final weapon).
The difficulty spike is ridiculous, because the final boss can spam bullet swarm. The slo-mo feature is really useful here because of this alone.This might was result of trying to please a wider audience (newcomers like me and veterans), that they forgot to balance the last part.

I really love this game, it's hard, but I have beaten it like 3 times. I feel satisfied playing it.
All ships have their own quirks, controls are perfect (on controller), AND THE MUSIC IS A BANGER, INCLUDING THE SINGER. I definitely gonna buy the soundtrack.

Those are what made the game feels like gaming on arcade machine.

Final verdict:
Should you buy this full price? Maybe no, since the last boss

88% i hate final weapon. IDK what I did wrong, but seems like the dev really hates me too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302059642', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1666378239}

author: {'steamid': '76561198920054352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1703977139}
review:
Scanlines option would be friggin awesome........Please, Devs - pleaaaaseee add scanlines!

One of the best and most addictive shmups I've played on Steam. Can be played "fast and loose", as they say. The level of control you have over your ship is insane. Very small hitbox. Taking damage never feels cheap. It's like: "yup flew right into that one, I deserved that"  - Just like a good shmup should be. 

Large variety of ships to choose from, each with their strengths and weaknesses. Some sacrifice power for speed and vice versa. Some are balanced.

Time slow mechanic and power shot/bomb mechanics work beautifully.  *If more shmups had time slow mechanics, the world would be a better place ;)

Highly recommended for both veterans and beginners alike.

Three thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085550132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1644113749}
review:
This game claims to have a 'a challenging but merciful difficulty curve'.

The truth is that the game is ridiculously easy and then the final boss is an absolute wall.  Playing on Veteran/Regular I was able to clear the rest of the game with only a handful of deaths, in less than an hour.  At this point I was really quite enjoying the game and would have given it a recommend.  Then I spent literal hours trying to take down the final boss and simply wasn't able to do it.

If this sounds like a fair but challenging difficulty curve to you, then this game might be for you.  If you're anything like me, this will only come across as a cheap tactic and/or bad game design.

To the devs: Keep my $2 and take an online course to learn what a 'difficulty curve' actually is before you use the term again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847536417', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1643790742}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062646623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1691347813}
review:
+++
Color scheme
ULTRA FUN
REPLAYABLE
Loads of ship and hyper
Overdrive is f**** awesome
The most fun and enjoyable endless mode/ I was suprise that some ship are arcade able and some are endless able I like that; as if there is a meta...
Game play : this game has been made by a bullet hell lover
Old school graphics

---
Lack of enemy and bullet pattern
Lack of different/variation bullet colors scheme pattern according to the shooting pattern as in it feels that the colors scheme was chosen randomly. A color or shape should be associated with an enemy so we know what is coming and in what direction.
Boss are meh Idk why... it lacks somethings. There is a voice over but enemies don't talk.
Lacks flow
The combo system could be better. Combo counter should not drop if we keep hitting an ennemy (for big one).
Flow wise (again) we should be able to keep the combo until the boss fight and keep it to score bigger. 
It would challenge best player to keep a continous x9.9 combo without hitting the OP overdrive.

#################

I hate DLCs but I would totally buy one with alternative ship/Hyper
Customisable hyper/Ship
More levels and enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561198071428977', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1642359553}
review:
无尽模式我坚持了20分钟，去排行榜一看世界第一分数是我的十几倍……ORZ
============================
本作是一部难度适中，但十分炫酷的小清新STG。相较游戏自带的远古版，高清EX版增设了boss存档点、自机新装配的子弹时间技能、更多的难度配置、精致的画面和剧情的配音演出，同时版面也更加连贯，让敌人分配合理。游戏的亮点主要在boss战和后半段关卡，道中可能显得比较枯燥漫长，但多达17种不同风格的自机肯定能让你爽个痛快。注意！最终boss的难度明显高于前面所有的敌人，考验底力的时刻到了！

author: {'steamid': '76561199209300703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1641748066}
review:
Absolutely worth getting for both new and veteran players of the genre. Clever design, minimal but meaningful controls, looks cool, sounds great, and plays so smooth it's like if jazz and zen made out on the magic school bus and you get to just ride the vibe.

All the modes are fun and offer that quick and exhilarating arcade-esque dopamine drip at varying levels of length and progression, but always feel nice to switch between. Even the arcade mode is nice enough to save your progress before stages and bosses. 

There's lots of characters to choose from that actually feel unique and not just different color pewpew machines that helps make getting into a playstyle quick and easy easy to experiment with.

This game is also great if you wanna listen to something else and peacefully zone out to the patterns in a chaotic flow state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225623628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1639071612}
review:
헬난이도 하드코어 기준

-난이도

필드는 너무 쉽고 보스전은 너무 어렵네. 특히 마지막 스테이지 보스와 진보스가 비정상적으로 어려워서 좀 골때림. 
근데 필드가 짧은 것도 아니고 엄청 김. 매 스테이지마다 거의 3~4분을 감

그런데 프랙티스 기능이 있는것도 아님 아ㅋㅋㅋ

그래서 맨날 필드전 꾸벅꾸벅 졸면서 보스전 언제오냐 하염없이 기다리고, 그렇게 30분 지루한걸 꾸역꾸역 참아서 한번 보스전 연습하고 그걸 깰때까지 반복ㅋㅋㅋㅋ

진짜 딱 3트인가 4트밖에 안했는데도 진짜 지루해서 미쳐버리는 줄 알았다


처음부터 헬난이도 하드코어로 안하고 헬난이도 노말로 체크포인트를 박아서 보스전을 따로 연습할 수 있다고 치면 또 모르겠다. 애초에 노말은 손도 안대서.


-가시성
그래픽은 확실히 화려하다. 근데 화려한 만큼 가시성이 박살났다.
탄이 제대로 안보여 ㅅㅂ 그래픽이 화려하면 뭐해 탄이 제대로 안보이는데
진짜 탄은 안보이고 그래픽은 진짜 개쓸데없이 화려해서 눈만 존나 아픔. 근데 그걸 30분 내내? ㅋㅋ......


그나마 필드전 난이도가 너무너무 쉬워서 대충대충해도 피하는데 문제가 없어서 망정이지, 보스전에서도 이랬으면 쌍욕나왔을 것 같다.




-체력 시스템

게다가 미스날 때 있는 무적 딜레이가 거의 없고, 그렇다고 해서 피탄 당했을 때 주변 탄막 소거 같은 것도 없음. 진짜 재수없으면 순식간에 연속 3~4미스로 게임이 터져버릴 수 잇음. 근데 그렇다고 봄이 있는 것도 아님.
1미스면 그러려니 하겠는데 연속 2미스 이상나면 좀 기분이 안좋음


-기체
기체 종류는 많은데, 기체 성능과 하늘과 땅차이임

어떤 기체는 하이퍼 샷이 그냥 공격력 찔끔 강화되는건데, 어떤 기체는 기체 앞 전방위 탄 소거에 공격력 강화임. 거의 유사 봄 수준
근데 전방위 탄 소거 기체가 그렇지 않는 기체보다 공격력이 부족하다던가 그런 것도 없음. 심지어 내구도도 엄청 높다

이게 진짜 같은 기체라고 만들어 놓은거냐?

각 기체마다 성능 차이는 있을 수 있다고는 생각하는데, 이겜은 너무 극심함.




그냥 할인하는 기념 겸사겸사 해서 망정이지, 아니였으면 안했을 듯

솔직히 말해서 도트 그래픽만 괜찮고 나머지는 다 별로

author: {'steamid': '76561198023092381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1400, 'last_played': 1705181938}
review:
I should have wrote a review for this game sooner... anyway, this is a very simple but also very enjoyable old school shooter where most of the fun is trying out and playing with the many different ships you can choose, each with it's own set of armaments and some even featuring unique mechanics of their own.

The best way I can describe this game is "Sonic Wings in space" (minus the "cutscenes", here you only have generic ones and not character specific), which is kinda ironic considering [spoiler]the final boss reminded me a bit of two final bosses from the Sonic Wings series: LAR (for the looks) and Balbi (for the mechanics)[/spoiler].

The only "issue" is the relatively "easy" difficulty even on higher levels (unless you're going for the "Mariner" achievement, which as of me writing this, is still broken... doable but broken) so if you're looking for some "modern" Touhou style shooter, this ain't it, otherwise it's a fun little experience to have (and come back to every now and then).

author: {'steamid': '76561197987600149', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1629048960}
review:
[i]Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo[/i] is a simple, well-working schmup. It's fun, but on the normal mode it wasn't particularly challenging all the way up to the final boss, where it went from around a 4 in difficulty to 13 for no real reason. The game features a 'hyper' system, where killing enemies fills a special bar that differs depending on which of the ships you pick, as well as a 'slo-mo' bar that allows you to briefly slow down time for everyone except yourself.

I was lucky enough to choose one of the bullet-clearing specials, which made the game significantly easier. It took me about three hours to beat the main storyline, though over and hour of that was spent purely on the last boss, who had one too many panic stages for my liking.

Despite this, I think veteran schmup players will find SGQET a relaxing, more casual experience. Annoyingly, despite clearing several achievement conditions none of them unlocked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086229928', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1627822616}
review:
Its mindless, boring, and repetitive

The music is grating and sounds the same it just blurs together

There are only 6 stages

Game is about an hour long, + the time it takes for you to beat the final boss

The final boss is a huge difficulty spike, especially because i was switching ships every stage to test what they feel like, and the one i was using when the game autosaved before the final boss was the donut. It creates a big pink and magenta cloud of bullets in front of itself, which happens to be the exact colours the projectiles the final boss shoots. Meaning, I COULD NOT SEE THE BOSS' BULLETS, BECAUSE OF MY OWN BULLETS! What asinine design is that?

Its a pretty game but it doesnt understand what visual clarity is, for the entirety of the game, all the effects explosions and bullets just blended in together, the only reason it wasnt an issue before the final boss is because the rest of the game is peashit easy even on veteran. 

All the ships play the same. They have different stats attacks and abilities, but in reality its completely mindless and just shoot at whatever moves. 

If you complete the game you get a whole of ZERO [0] achievements, because all of them are locked behind the 0.1% perfect everything rating

There's no discernible pattern or difference between the waves of enemies, their attacks, and their patterns. It feels just random. 

No rebinding controls. No mouse controls. No video options, fullscreen, windowed, borderless, resolution options, nothing.

I payed 2€'s for this, which is a decent deal. Definitely not worth full price.
developer_response: WORKING ON ALL THESE THINGS FOR THE FINAL FINAL FINAL VERSION

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2934, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1625637297}
review:
超银河战队EX Turbo！！这名字好中二~哈哈~游戏也好中二！
[h1]
游戏有2个版本（高清版和远古版）而且自带OST~
但我其实没买OST的DLC···
就两个exe文件+OST文件夹！
神了，多年没见到这种形式的游戏！！
[/h1]

纵版射击弹幕游戏，玩起来感觉很小清新！前期弹幕简单，后期没法玩！
不过飞机有血条，所以比其他游戏还要稍微easy点！
但我发现高清版游戏生命条的地址居然是静态的！！[spoiler] .exe+59D33C [/spoiler]
[b]于是我比两条命的高达Boss和不显示血条的最终Boss还要无耻地开了CE！[/b]
[h1]游戏一共6关，最终Boss还是个黑黑的球！！
剧情模式可以F12截图，但其他模式和剧情CG下却没法截图！[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2539693765
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2539694009

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2539693490
~毕竟是弹幕游戏~能Clear爽爽就好~

author: {'steamid': '76561198139779484', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1681859119}
review:
Here's the thing, I just needed to give New Blood some money and Gloomwood is not out yet. Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo was the only game missing from my collection and I was like "heh, why not."

I haven't played that type of SHMUP since junior high and I got to say that I find it really refreshing and the gameplay highly addictive.

Reminded me those pre-internet days when I used to play MAME32 on my PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048054765', 'num_games_owned': 3029, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1624726506}
review:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2527650904

author: {'steamid': '76561198040923434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1624694554}
review:
I'm pretty bad at shmups, I am half alseep right now, and I managed to reach level 6 without losing a life, although that concept is a bit tricky in this one.
The game is cute. But its levels are way too long, the enemies behave all the same, the same evade pattern applies all the time.
The threat is so low on Veteran that I sometimes was forgetting to press the shot button, as I was - literally - dozing off.

The game is disserviced by a really bad soundtrack and very poor arrangements, as well as lackluster voice overs read by some friends I gather. Some of them were unskippable. Ugh.

Were it a prototype, I would have been much more in the mood to forgive the many issues I experienced in my short time spent with the game. As a game being sold, I don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063115118', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1624673385}
review:
I don't know if this was the developer's first dive into STG's but it sort of feels like it and I'm giving the benefit of the doubt that's the case here. I don't find this one to be very competently made. It works. It isn't buggy. It looks like an STG, but it's design feels stunted.

Every ship plays the same and every level tediously overstays it's welcome. There's not much in the way of themes or unique pressure until quite literally the final few seconds of the final level. All enemies are various flying machines cheaply popping in at the top of the screen that slooowly move down and slooowly fire their generic, aimless volleys of bullets. They're poorly contextualized so nothing really seems to serve much of a purpose other than to be shot at. Which is a problem when you're trying to throw DoDonPachi-esque scoring mechanics like combo chains and meter building. In fact, one of the mechanics, overdrive, didn't even happen for me until the literal last level where I thought it was just the game trying to force in a cool climactic moment. 

Enemies don't pop in with any concise, deliberate formations you can route for optimized scoring or that put you in pressure situations...or just look cool. They just appear one by one or in random configurations like someone flicked water droplets onto paper. There isn't any synergy to their patterns like a more elite title such as Ketsui or Natsuki Chronicles. 

Hyper isn't even what that name entails. It's just a linear thinking bomb to destroy things in the rare moments you somehow find yourself in a pinch. It's not an interesting special mode that needs to be worked for to use as often as it's earned. It doesn't make enemies more aggressive in exchange for higher score. It doesn't extend your combo multiplier before decay for strategic decision making. It's not even really necessary as a bomb because the game, at it's "hardest" never needs it and it doesn't screen clear anyway. You throw it, kill things somewhat faster, and that's the extent of it. It compliments nothing.

Bosses almost have more to them than the stages. Their patterns come out faster and they do have secondary patterns that accentuate the primary fire to move you about the screen. But they're all really easy and don't get much harder each stage. One of them just stays put in the center top of the screen. 

It's an overall dull experience with no focus, cluttered visuals, and very very grating music, something the genre usually excels at. There's better STG's on Steam. Blue Revolver, Danmaku Unlimited 3, and DoDonPachi Resurrection far exceed what this offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118861600', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1613817677}
review: Soy una persona que disfruta mucho de ver y aprender sobre el genero del shmup, pero no he jugado muchos a lo largo de mi vida la verdad (y me faltan algunos clásicos como Touhou), pero este Super Galaxy Squadron me tiene actuando extraño en el buen sentido, tiene un huevo de personajes, la jugabilidad y mecánicas del título, varias dificultades, una cantidad de bosses bastante grande para lo corto que se puede hacer el juego (siendo el boss final un hijo de perra), junto con un apartado visual, musical y sonoro perfectos... La verdad es que por el precio es muy recomendado, si eres fan del genero le vas a meter horas asegurado y si eres nuevo pues primero vas en fácil y poco a poco a pillar práctica la verdad, poco más tengo que decir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103217124', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1696146689}
review:
Classic Bullet Hell Action

Voiced cutscenes and a wide variety of playable ships

Each ship has its own style and pilot lore, so it's clear that in design, sound, and writing this was a labor of love...

But the enemies eventually get even more repetitive than one would expect for this genre of game.

The bosses are mostly fine until you get to the very last one, and then the "hell" part of this genre applies.  With a game like Arknights there is a decent amount of player feedback and related strategies that have been set up.  For this game...  The forums complain about this last boss being imbalanced but the developers seem way too busy to address it.  Hopefully they haven't given up yet.

The music has that cool chiptune style...  But unlike a lot of games there are only a handful of really memorable tunes.  Most video games have amazing music these days, but it's also true that this game has been out for several years now so it might be unfair to critique the music's "memorability" when the final boss' balancing and the repetitive enemies and, the one thing that bothers me most:

This game is called "Super Galaxy Squadron," but usually it's throwing one ship out there to face the entire enemy fleet all by itself.  Oh sure you can swap out the ship for another one at the very beginning of the stage, but that still applies.  I get how in Touhou and other games you don't get to swap, but with this many playable characters with the same plot for each...  This game should call itself "Super Galaxy Fighter" because I'm not seeing any wing or squadron mates anywhere near me in single player.

The game brings a lot of awesome arcade action.......  But I'd be lying if I said I'd be giving it a recommended rating without a ton of caveats

UPDATE:  Apparently, they didn't forget, and claim to have updated the boss!  I'll see how it went when I can

author: {'steamid': '76561198202252286', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1616161349}
review:
大概兩年多年前已經全破一次
想說替這討論串單薄的陣容多加點份量再重玩一次
結果一發不可收拾


當年進入遊戲的機體選單後瞬間高潮
突然了解為什麼要叫超銀河戰隊
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2455414332
就像金剛戰士(power rangers)有紅色戰士 黃色戰士....等顏色戰隊
遊戲也以17種顏色用來標註
總共17台都配有駕駛員大頭照的機體
這種規格還沒玩就先80分起跳惹


17台機體除了用攻 防 速三個參數 
外加攻擊方式跟各別的必殺技
來作出區別
系統上沒有無敵爆彈而是以子彈時間來取代

個人認為這遊戲實在有點難度
主要建立在BOSS刁鑽的彈幕
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2455419197
以及沒有無敵爆彈的設計
讓玩家真的沒啥僥倖的空間
只能硬著頭皮接招
尤其最終BOSS瞬間爆升的難度
玩到差點崩潰
但神奇的是
這遊戲的彈幕有種奇妙的吸引力
彷彿有個聽不見的旋律在引導我往子彈的狹縫裡鑽
根本越玩越上癮
不全破根完全不下手把啊!!!!!!!!!
我全破gameplay:
https://youtu.be/JCxOf1cgwXQ


此外遊戲的重玩度相當高
因為每一台機體對最終boss的難易度都不太一樣
有可能這台死個二十幾次才全破但換別台就一機通關
(個人錄gameplay的親身經歷=_=)
很像在玩格鬥遊戲
每一台機體的遊玩體驗都不同
而遊戲也有收錄boss rush模式
可以直接體驗遊戲最精隨的地方


值得一提的遊戲其實是包含兩個:
Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo(本作)
Super Galaxy Squadron classic (懷舊風格)
一個遊戲兩種視覺享受
cp值真的高


硬要說缺點的話
bgm的表現就沒那麼強勢了
有重複使用的不說
更慘的是boss戰都同一首
實在有點虛


結論:
喜歡有挑戰性的stg玩家
本作真的強力推薦
(因為有入包過 大概想玩的都已經入手了)
當作彈幕訓練器真的不錯
(錄完影片後信心爆棚
感覺技術有提升那麼一點點)
而嫌不夠難的高手玩家
也可以挑戰沒有回血道具跟紀錄點的硬派模式
相信可以從其中得到極大的滿足感

author: {'steamid': '76561198010245969', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1706495623}
review: Super Galaxy Squadron is a very well designed vertical shooter with consistently colored enemy projectiles in the warmer end of the color spectrum, oranges and reds, and pick-ups in the cooler side of the color spectrum, blues and greens, making the fast-paced bullet storms easier to navigate. The importance of these starkly contrasting colors cannot be overstated as many shooters missed this aspect of proper game design, making the frantic hail of bullet tough to discern and the much needed pick-ups get lost in the mess. Not in this game. Very well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993703914', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1614431191}
review:
A lot of style and too little substance, Super Galaxy Squadron Ex Turbo boasts full screen cutscenes with voiced dialogue, vibrant and clean art, and an absurd number of playable ships. Those leave a good initial impression, but after playing through several stages it quickly becomes evident there's not much to the game. 

Stages are extremely long and dull, consisting of an endless stream of cannon fodder enemies that seem to enter in the same patterns. I initially thought playing through these stages that they were procedurally generated due to the repetition, but they are crafted this way. You can spend a huge amount of time in your first blind playthrough just sitting near the top of the screen spawn camping enemies before they can fire a shot. 

Bosses are equally dull affairs, with extreme amounts of health, yet little variation in attack patterns. Those few attack patterns they have are also incredibly boring; most bosses use similar attack patterns to the fodder enemies. The vast majority of bullets also travel at a snail's pace, even though the density never gets that high. 

Mechanically it's simple, with a slowdown function that trivialises an already excessively easy game, and a superweapon for each ship that is able to be spammed with abandon. 

It's not a broken game. It doesn't seem to have any bugs and it looks nice enough. It works. It's just so very boring to play. There's so many great alternatives that I can't imagine any scenario where I could recommend this to anyone. If you're looking for something similar, I would recommend Blue Revolver, Crimzon Clover, or Danmaku Unlimited 2 & 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392488333', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1700207273}
review: This would have been Thumbs up if not for the idiotic decision to force the player into having the focus (bullet time) from the 2nd to last boss going into the final boss. If you happen to have no focus going into the final boss, you are screwed at higher difficulty as there is basically no chance without being able to slow the bullets. Total game ruining, souring, oversight. Mostly breezed through Veteran mode only to hit brick wall. And since the game auto saves, you are doomed to get your butt kicked over and over until you give up and start a new run.
