author: {'steamid': '76561197998873734', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1642670153}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
It's ok, but not great. Simple and pretty fun, but compared to some arcade favourites it's lacking. Worth on a sale.

[h1]Review[/h1]
This is a vertical space-shooter with a funny name that just begs for having Reloaded Definitive Edition: The Revenge added at the end. You probably played games like this so I'll just concentrate on some features specific to this one.

- HP - you don't die in one hit, instead you have a health bar and unlimited continues. Each time you are hit, you lose some of your upgrades.
- Hitbox - your hitbox is just a small point on your ship, not the entire thing. It's similar to games like Touhou in that respect, but you can see that hitbox at all times for easier maneuvering around enemy bullets.
- Upgrades - you have primary and secondary weapons, which are fired both at the same time always. When you kill enemies sometimes an upgrade for one of those weapons will appear, which you can collect. Weapons are tied to ship you selected and cannot be changed (unless you change the entire ship, which is possible at the start of the level).
- Slow-motion - as you kill things you will charge up your slow-motion ability. At a press of a button you can enter slo-mo which makes dodging bullets easier, but drains your slow-motion resource as long as you keep the button pressed. Once you exit this mode by releasing the button, there's a short cooldown before you can enter it again.
- Hyper-attack - hyper charges the same way as slow-motion and can be unleashed once fully charged to deal a lot of damage for a few seconds and make your ship invurnelable (sometimes, I don't really know how it works).

This game takes about 20-30 minutes to finish one playthrough, which is comparable with many other arcade-style space shooters. Replayability is mostly in different difficulty levels and ship selection. There's also a boss rush and an endless mode with randomized levels. There's no ship customization save for linear upgrades described above.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]+ A lot of ships[/b]
[b]+ Feels good[/b]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]- Underwhelming bosses[/b]
[b]- Difficulty[/b]

More about pros and cons below.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]+ A lot of ships[/b]
You get 17 ships to choose from, each has different visual effects and sort-of unique firing pattern. Obviously with this many ships you will notice some of them having similar feel, but it's not enough to take away from how fun it's to try all of them out. Some of them have very unique mechanics like having secondary weapons you can manually aim around, or secondaries that are automated drones.

[b]+ Feels good[/b]
Blowing things up is chunky and satisfying, the visuals are great and both music and sound effects are nice. Controls are simple snappy and responsive.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]- Underwhelming bosses[/b]
I was always a fan of multi-staged bosses with huge sprites that take multiple screens of space. All of the bosses here have different stages, but rarely change appearence and all fit on the top of your screen.

[b]- Difficulty[/b]
For the most part, assuming you are using your slow motion and your hyper in tough situations - the game's difficulty is very balanced. It's not very hard, comparing to other games in the genre, but also isn't easy either. This goes out the window in the last boss fight, who rarely lets you charge your slo-mo and hyper, but has some bullet patterns that are simply too quick to dodge. This is the only boss fight, which requires you to learn the patterns and make your moves by memory, because if you rely on your sight and reaction time - you will get hit. I don't think even Touhou games have this kind of quick bullet pattern that's this hard to dodge by reflexes.

[h1]Lowdown[/h1]
As stated before - this game is allright, but only allright. It's fun and rewarding in short bursts that it's designed to be played at, but has some unfortunate design choices that make the whole thing a bit less than great.
I'd give Boom-boom Shooty-shooty Reloaded Definitive Edition: The Revenge a
[h1]6/10[/h1]
Fun, kinda flawed, worth some money, but not full price.
Seriously though, wtf happened with this name...

author: {'steamid': '76561198888757994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1642970824}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034115248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1610367586}
review:
It's like DoDonPachi without the bee-collecting bullshit. It's easier, more compact, and makes you feel like less of a useless piece of shit who will never be loved. It is less complex of a game, but that works in its favor. It is easier to get into, especially for someone like me.

When you wake up in the morning, you see the ceiling. You see your bed. You see the inside of your bedsheets. You see the phone that you paid for with money from a job that you hate. The dimly-lit room stares back at you as you stare out at it -- a spoiled child who never amounted to anything even in college. Even despite the inconveniences of your daily life, you are in many regards spoiled. Yet, you are miserable and you make others miserable.

You didn't have to credit-feed and load state repeatedly, practicing endlessly for 30-50 hours just to get to 2-1 because your appetite for memorizing bee locations is even less than your appetite for bitter vegetables to get to this point. But, you spent middle school doing it anyway in some ill-conceived notion that it would make you a better person or that you would be well-liked for doing something well in a video game that few people knew about and even fewer cared for achievements concerning.

Go play Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo. It's on sale almost all the time for $2.49 nowadays if you're a hyper-budgeting sort of person. I think the stage designs are a bit bland, but the game looks crunchy enough and I like the shot designs that I enjoy it. Even if they're kind of unbalanced (White is my favorite so far), I get the dopamine hit from the pew pew pew and the sega genesis music and the space noises, and that's all I need.

It temporarily eases off the impending doom of the void and allows you to procrastinate thinking about what will happen when you eventually, suddenly shuffle off of this mortal coil. I got some joy out of it in a couple veteran clears. It wasn't perfect, but I had fun. Is it Crimson Clover? Is it Mushihimesama? Is it Battle Garegga? Is it Touhou? Is it Devil Ignition? No. It's fucking Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo, and don't you forget it. It's cheaper than alcohol and lasts several times as long -- a win-win in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043766243', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1604696767}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo is the kind of game that would not have felt out of place in an arcade in the 90s. Its channels all the right elements.

- Simple Controls
- Great Music
- Interesting Planes(Ships)
- Varied Enemy Types
- Linear/Adjustable Difficulty Curve
- Challenging Bosses

If I was building an arcade I would want to have a Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo cabinets. 

My one complaint is that the title is more than a mouthful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063494506', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1696089006}
review:
This game is the perfect iteration of its genre for me. If I had the resources and skills that this guys have, this is the exact game I'd want to make.

The game is actually accessible in case you haven't played many bullet hells before, but it can get very challenging if you want it to.
The retro visuals are top Notch, all the character designs, their weapons and their abilities are all super cool and you'll have fun trying them out until you figure which one suits you best.
The music is really, really good, something I can't praise enough. 
The story is really simple and not that fleshed out, but good enough for the arcade's sense of immersion.

I really love this game, I can't say enough. I like the Touhou series too but I usually rather come back and play this game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1597327933}
review:
This is a 2D retro pixel vertical scrolling bullet hell shmup with a loose Japanese arcade/sci-fi theme.

Starting with the good... While this might seem like a low hurdle, the game works properly and is playable, even in full screen.  You may or may not be surprised how many indie games don't manage to clear that little obstacle.

The developer worked very hard to implement a retro theme, but the year is 2017, pixel graphics are long obsolete and need to die.   There's a lot of flaws here.  The display doesn't take full benefit of 16:9 resolution, and before you say "But it's supposed to look like a 3:4 arcade machine", you can see why there's a big problem trying to cram one of those onto a 16:9 2160p PC gaming monitor.   Just because you could, doesn't mean you should.    Retro pixel "art" is an ugly substitute for talent.  In this case the developer was too invested with the retro look that they didn't consider how background contrast, which was carefully managed in those old shmups, impacts the game.  It's simply too noisy at some points to avoid the bullets because the developer flubbed the graphics.  Resolution is fixed and can't be changed, another minimum requirement that isn't met by this game.

Finally, we have a $14.50 price tag for a vertical shmup that tries to be a ripoff of the original shmups of the 1990s but does a worse job of it.  You can play those for free in an emulator, so why would I recommend someone pays the same price as serious AAA games like Alien: Isolation and Frostpunk for this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198076046500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1595077657}
review: Cette version turbo redonne un sacré coup de fouet à tous les niveaux: le gameplay, le level design et la difficulté sont revus à la hausse, et le jeu est agrémenté de visuels beaucoup plus sympa avec des cut scene et de sprites plus détaillés. Une belle surprise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971027784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1627081927}
review: A great Shmup, my only complaint is the lack of options. I generally like to turn the SFX down in shmups so i can crank up the music and get into the rhythm of the game. This one you can't it's all or nothing. If they can fix that issue, it would be a solid title IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012407568', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1594994702}
review: I had a very fun time playing this game, right up until the final boss. He is complete BULLSPIT. He is easily 20 times harder than anything else in the game. I like a challenge, but fighting him was simply not fun, and the game is worse for it.Shame..

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1594357357}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron is hard, although inconsistently so. That is the thing about it that sticks out the most. Described as a vertical shooter for "human beings" with a "challenging but merciful" difficulty curve, and I have to disagree with that discription. I was able to breeze through most of the game on its middling difficulty, but by contrast, could not defeat the final boss and even on its lowest difficulty setting, said boss killed me multiple times. Thank goodness for checkpoint systems!

The game's stronger feature by far is a surprisingly wide variety of playable ships with varying weapons and super attacks, and the ability to switch which one you're using at the start of a new stage. It is also aesthetically pleasing, with quality pixel art, an intense soundtrack and vivid color palette. Also, as a Tyrian 2000 fan and one of the two people mentioned on the store page who'd want a story in a vertical shmup, I appreciate the token effort towards that end in the small cutscenes and pilot bios. I wanted to know a little more about the game's setting, in fact.

All told, SGS is highly accessible by the standards of the "bullet hell" genre, and on that basis I can recommend it. However, there are both other shmups and New Blood-published titles that I greatly prefer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 558, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1594272490}
review:
Good for average players, not for veterans.

The presentation, sounds, graphics, hype, sprites are great. I love the sounds and the visual feedback. Excellent and clear menus. Input works beautifully with no delays or oddities. The layering of the explosions, medals, ship shots, enemy shots, etc is PERFECT and that is something that most shoot-em-ups get wrong. It's really clear where you need to dodge, and where you need to collect. I like the bullet patterns which are, in my opinion, somewhere in the medium-difficulty range. That could be good, could be bad depending on your skill. I have 1CC'ed DoDonPachi so I find this game a little less challenging or grueling than I'd like.

I'm not very sold on the enemy wave patterns... they feel extremely predictable and simple to dispatch. The bosses are a little too easy (for me). There's too many ships to choose from and many are complete trash, while others are very OP. I guess this could be a good thing for those that want to find their own way to challenge themselves, but I disagree fundamentally with this design decision - all good games are carefully balanced between pros/cons but that's missing here.

I paid around $2 on sale and I feel it was worth that but not much more TBH. If you're just getting into the genre, I feel this game will reward you over multiple plays. I'm not a "hardcore" shmupper like some, but pretty darn good when I get serious, and thus I don't think this game will draw me back for multiple replays. It feels just bland enough in the area of enemy waves/bullets that I'm not compelled for that "one more try" which should be a feeling that appropriately-tuned games give a player.

It's a good game. If you're a hardcore shmupper take a hard pass. If you've ever 1CC'ed a popular shmup, hard pass. If you've 2CC'ed a popular shmup, hard pass. Casual players, go for it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999640811', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1594486475}
review:
An incredibly authentic shmup, including the most loved features of the greatest games of the genre, such as:
- Five hundred different modes and you're not sure which to play
- Obscure scoring systems no one really understands
- Fun gimmicky ships that you love but never use because giant wave of bullets is king
- Bomb 
- Final boss difficulty spike is roughly ten kilometers high
- Massive framerate drops with a twist (you have a dedicated framerate drop button)

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo also includes:
- 17 ships
- Dramatic guitar solos and MIDI riffs that will rock your socks off
- An endless mode! This is a New Blood game after all

Just get it already, it's pretty damn good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341956238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1677542323}

author: {'steamid': '76561198150183370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1679347271}
review:
" " " 
[i]A nice little bullet hell game you would have fun with when more remarkable titles like Crimzon Clover or ZeroRanger are already finished. The main feature is 14-15 different ships, their hyper modes, and amount or armor/lives. In hyper mode some just deal more damage, others come more useful by clearing screen of bullets or shielding your ship. Ability to swap ships between stages in neat too. Killy Teal for the beginning, tanky Black for the ending.

The weak side are the rest of stats with spread and DPS which, with exception of Teal and White ships, don't introduce much difference. The only important one is the armor, but it's poorly balanced and Black is particularly OP
 
Difficulty is mostly forgiving, it took me less than a week to achieve 1cc (hardcore route) on veteran (medium) difficulty, although I was lucky during the battle with the final boss too. And it's the only impressive challenge. Seriously, it's much harder than the rest of the entire game

Conclusion? It's worth your money. May be not for the full price, but definitely for a discount [/i] 
" " " 

Ok, that was my old review. Revisiting the game now rly made me feel like all small enemies just randomly spawn at the top of the screen with no structure or pattern. It's not like the points from the text of the old review have changed, but now the game simply makes me disappointed and disoriented/bored with all the chaos

author: {'steamid': '76561197970550187', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1669328916}
review: Absolutely top-notch ShMUp. Challenging with responsive controls and a booming soundtrack. A steal at its price. Well-done!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983552514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1608525902}
review:
Just finished my first run.

Very fun Shmup i recommend it especially at that price.

Looks good, music is great the bullet patterns are good, many many varied ships like 10 or something, Lots of stages 6-7 i think

Few things i don't like is that i play usually pretty high in the screen but a lot of enemies come from the low side of the screen and cheap shot you i will have to adapt to that and play more at the bottom. One run is over 30 minutes i like shorter shumps . Some of the bullets especially the final boss are so fast without focus mode they are a pain to avoid you really need to learn the pattern cause they just zip on you i didn't have time to see them they were so fast. Not a fan of health system's usually i'm more 3 life type but i believe there a classic or hardcore more or something without it. And so much blue sh** exp on the screen when you kill enemies sometimes you get confused when you are concentrating on the bullets. 

Not trying to be negative just felt like saying the things i liked less.

So yeah i'll play more for sure it's very fun.

Really good for newcomers i finished the game on my first run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982221433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1593153211}
review:
Definitely worth it for the sale price right now! I dunno about normally as it isn't the most polished SHUMP out there.
It also uses the shoulder buttons when it doesn't even have to, so the problem with that is it means you will probably not be using an arcade stick for it controller or keyboard only unless you have a unique key arrangement. You can't change the controls.

That out of the way, it's very approachable for anyone, with scaling difficulty options and good sprite work. It's a solid game for sure, but it's nothing ground breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037736883', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1585542739}
review:
This game, for its sale price ($1-2) is a pretty fun game to mess around with for a little bit. I know that's not exactly a glaring recommendation, but the things that bothered me about the game didn't make this worth a downvote.

I bought this game after playing through Dusk, which is one of, if not *the* best first person shooters I've ever played. Buy that game if you haven't, I'm serious. Anyway, I looked into the publisher, New Blood Interactive, to find that they had quite a few favorably reviewed games, and I picked this one up because it was cheap and I didn't have too many SHMUPs in my collection.

In this game you play through 6 bullet/explosion-filled levels with one of 17 ships, taking down the boss at the end of it. You have a score multiplier, a 'hyper' attack, and a 'focus' meter, which works like bullet time. 

Pros: quick and easy to pick up and play, there's a lot of variety in the ships (17 to choose from, each with a different archetype you may be familiar with from other SHUMPs), a boss rush and endless level mode if you prefer either the bosses or levels to the main arcade mode, and quite a few difficulties to the main arcade mode to choose from. The game is extremely colorful and flashy, and the music is pretty solid (aside from the weeb chorus during the end credits. That made me cringe a little bit internally, as I have an ear for whether or not a yellow man or greater aryan is singing in moon runes).

Cons: I feel that there is such a thing as too much variety in ship selection. Sometimes less really is more. You'll find yourself not wanting to stick with just one ship since the playstyles are so different, which will encourage you to cycle through all 17 ships when you can, making it so it's hard to develop one single strategy. This problem bleeds into the main arcade game, where you *can* switch out your ship at the start of each new level, which is nice, but not after you die to a boss. This means you'll have to play through the main game, like, 3 times to have a chance to play each ship once, and the game isn't *so* good to warrant that. This bleeds into the next problem I had where I was locked into the final boss with just one ship.

Now, the final boss is complete horse sh*t. I'm no SHMUP expert BY FAR, but this was ridiculous. If you peak into the forum for this game, even the dev is well aware of this fact. I was playing on veteran mode, normal difficulty, and I coasted through the first 5 levels, 5 bosses, and final level, only dying maybe once to the 3rd or 4th level boss. A difficulty spike for a final boss is expected, but this is damn near impossible. The achievement I got for beating the boss, only 7% of the people who own this game have, and I only have it because after the 9th death, the game inexplicably began glitching out and causing infinite 'focus' (slowdown).

One last minor complaint would be the story, which looking around the comments and reviews, no one else cared for either. This normally wouldn't be a problem, but the devs put a lot of effort into it, which makes me feel bad for the animators, writers, and voice actors. It reminds me of a more incoherent, less interesting Ace Combat story line. On the second play through, I just skipped the cutscenes.

So, in the end what you have is a pretty fun (but not massively fun) SHMUP game for an extremely cheap and reasonable price. It'll keep you entertained for 3-7 hours, would be my guess, which isn't bad for $1-2. My recommendation is to play through the game on Veteran/Normal, get to the end boss, rage quit, then play on the more laid back/superior Endless mode while you mess around with the different ships.

Only buy this game if all those caveats sound okay to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142050992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1631664462}
review: Loved Raiden II as a kid and this scratched that arcade shooter itch GOOOD. I loved the animation, the creative options, the variety of bosses, and the soundtrack is amazing. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a 'lil nostalgia. The home base commander voice acting could use a bit of work, but everything else feels polished and cohesive. Love the casual option, love the health bar, it's everything raiden was and better. Kudos!

review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo, which also includes Super Galaxy Squadron Classic is a game developed by Synset and published by New Blood Interactive

The game offers some really nice graphics and a nice yet simplistic aesthetic which is pleasant all the same and has some amazing attention to detail even though it is a little rough around the edges

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless and ends just at the right time

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo, which also includes Super Galaxy Squadron Classic overall, however, is an okay game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is an okay action game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198081290221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1589387352}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo est un excellent Shoot'em up à scrolling vertical.

Visuellement, il présente un look rétro plutôt réussi. La bande son est également agréable et très entrainante et s'accorde à merveille avec le genre.

Je trouve le titre relativement accessible du point de vue de la difficulté. Un débutant sur ce genre pourra bien s'amuser. Pour les vétérans, un grand nombre de modes de difficulté permet de bien personaliser celle-ci. 

Du point de vue du contenu, on retrouve différents modes de jeu :
- un mode arcade qui se présente sous forme d'une succession de niveaux (incluant boss) entrecoupés de cut-scenes.
- un mode endless qui propose de jouer une session de manière inifinie avec une succession d'ennemi jusqu'à ce que le joueur perde ce qui met fin à la partie.
- un mode boss rush qui permet de rejouer successivement les boss du jeu.

Il y a 17 vaisseaux à prendre en main. Certains ont un gamplay très spécifiques, et on prend beaucoup de plaisir à les tester le temps d'un run. Les 3 derniers ajoutés dernièrement sont vraiment sympas. Ce grand nombre de vaisseaux jouables est pour moi une vrai valeur ajoutée comparativement à d'autres titres du même genre.

Le contenu est donc intéressant, et présente une bonne rejouabilité.

Un très bon jeu, je le recommande autant aux débutants sur le genre qu'aux plus expérimentés. Une réussite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063917143', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1634366538}
review:
An amazing Shmup game, you have a lot of ships, shiny colours, very unique soundtrack, every ship is very different from each other, and it comes with the classic version of the game too, just look up the game folder, while very good, it still has a few flaws, which some are critical for a game like this, but overall is a very enjoyable experience

Pros:
-A lot of different ships
-Double mechanic in the EX version, bullet time and the ship's unique hyper
-2 games in one, and the classic version looks amazing too
-Every ship hitbox is extremly small, making crazy dodges possible
-3 difficulty modes, Casual, Veteran and Hell, along with 2 modes, Normal (With checkpoints and a refillable life bar via health items) and Hardcore (No health items, no checkpoints, you only get one coin)
-Beautiful graphics in both versions
-Comes with the OST in 320 mp3 quality (while not lossless, its still a nice detail)
-Game install is really small (147 Mb, ost included)
-Has an addictive endless mode, along with boss rush
-Achievements (take that, ZUN!)
-Dirt cheap
-Hidden overcharge system, if you combo really well and keep the kills coming, makes your ship extra strong for a limited time
-Has a lot of charisma
-Leaderboards!

Cons:
-Hyper bar on the side is too shiny when fully recharged, and can be a bit distracting
-No rebindable controls (come on dude)
-Difficulty in normal is a breeze until you reach the bosses, specially the final boss
-The japanese ship feels a bit underpowered without full powerup on the main gun (its a penetrating shotgun type, and without upgrades it has almost no reach)
-For some reason avast considers the game a virus, some alexa generic virus or something, but totally sure its a false positive
-The ending is meh, just credits roll and score, along with a vocal version of the main theme
-Hitbox for the powerups is really small, so you can miss the items and look like an idiot
-No dedicated slow movement button a la touhou, you instead are expected to move the joystick very slightly to move slowly, and that is impossible if you use a keyboard

author: {'steamid': '76561198075673573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1625546493}
review:
I rate Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo 3.5/5. Pretty good. Fun for fairly short periods of time.

This is a fun little vertically scrolling schmup action game in the general style of early 1990s arcade games (think of 2-dimensional arcade space action games that were sort of like Galaga but came out years afterward). This game has a generally uninteresting though unobtrusive plot.

+Easy for beginners (until you get to the game’s final boss) but provides a good challenge for higher level players.

+Easy, responsive controls.

+No major bugs.

+Several playable characters/ships all of which are available immediately and do not need to be unlocked. Each character/ship has fairly unique weapons.

+/-Sound effects are simple and a bit traditional and scratchy sounding but each sound is meaningful and useful.

+/-You can change characters/ships every new level but cannot change your character/ship immediately before a boss fight.

+/-Several game modes, at least 2 difficulty levels and an earlier “classic” version of the same game is included but there are only 6 main areas/levels to play before the game ends.

+/-OK graphics in a sort of pixel art style though it makes use of a lot of pastel colors.

+/-Good sense of speed but some space backgrounds are simplistic and can get boring.

+/-An almost frustratingly difficult final boss (even on the lowest difficulty). 

+/-Generally uninteresting plot but then the plot doesn’t interfere with the classic feel of the arcade style action gameplay either.

-No apparent online multiplayer capability (and this game could really benefit from a nice cooperative online mode).

-Generally bad, uninteresting music with nearly no catchy tunes.

-Most bosses are uninspired and boring.

-Most enemies are uninspired and boring.

-Most environments are uninspired and boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282412187', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1709628961}

author: {'steamid': '76561198351481728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1572548238}
review:
This game has potential, some people might enjoy it, but I absolutely didn't.

[b]My pros:[/b]
+ Nice artstyle/graphics and sound overall, decent voice acting during cutscenes
+ Good controls
+ Enjoyable soundtrack (but few tracks). The music sounds like a mix of chiptune and progressive metal like Dream Theater.

[b]My cons:[/b]
- No key remapping. You are forced to play with the given keys, which are laid out in a weird way: X, C and Spacebar are close to each other, but you have to somehow reach Z with the same hand. You can't use WASD like I'm used to.
- No tutorial. You are shown the controls, but not the game mechanics. The game left me wondering how items and special attacks work until I was in stage 3.
- Lots of cutscenes with essentially nothing going on. Just technical blabbering about space warfare etc. that have nothing to do with the gameplay...
- Nothing is memorable. All 6 stages seem the same, just hordes of enemies spawning in vague patterns. Even the bosses are hard to remember.
- If this game is a "Bullet Hell", then it might as well be called a "Collectible/Item Hell". There are just as many collectable things flying around as there are bullets, which I find distracting and pointless.
- Player and bullet hitboxes are so tiny, I could often just move effortlessly through big sprays of bullets without getting hit.
- The bosses are a lot more difficult than the stages. I often reached the bosses with full health and then lost most of it attempting to navigate through their narrow bullet walls.
- You spend most of the time just spraying around with your weapon without focussing on anything. Most of the ships are destroyed just by moving around a little.
- Way too many different player ships to choose from. No thanks.
- When I played the classic variant of the game, the first boss glitched out after a minute and made it impossible to finish the stage.

This is my first negative review because I was deeply disappointed and in my opinion it's not even worth half the price. I would give it a rating of [i]2 out of 10[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198067073182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1668679599}

author: {'steamid': '76561198307490358', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1594465743}
review:
Хорошая СЛОЖНАЯ игра. Ну хотя для меня всё, что здесь сложно это финальный босс. Я 1 фазу прохожу только если продамажусь, выпадает аптечка, дамажусь, ещё аптечка и т.д. А во второй фазе всё становится очень сложно. Но у этой игры есть один очень огромный минус - она очень быстро проходится. За свои 2 часа я смог пройти игру на средней сложности, немного поиграть в бесконечном режиме и дойти до 6 стейджа в Hell моде (в игре есть всего лишь 6 коротеньких стейджей). Короче, игра хорошая, но платить 260 рублей за игру, которая проходится за час или два - такое себе развлечение. Лучше покупайте по скидке за например 130 рублей. Вот с такой ценой игра стоит своих денег, а так, если бы в стиме была оценка "Нейтрально", то я поставил бы её.
Короче, 7/10 я ставлю игре, потому что она мне всё таки понравилась :Р

author: {'steamid': '76561198033995360', 'num_games_owned': 2161, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1563768359}
review:
Un [i]pixel art[/i] ravageur, une bande originale sympa, une interface aussi propre et fonctionnelle qu'une vitrine Cuisinella, des affrontements dynamiques, beaucoup de personnages - et donc de vaisseaux - jouables, des modes de difficulté adaptés à tous les styles de joueurs, une action presque toujours lisible et de jolies couleur. Et c'est à peu près tout. Rien de [i]Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo[/i] n'est pas quasi parfait. Rien n'est vraiment génial non plus. C'est un [i]bullet hell[/i] bien fait mais trop classique et trop sage pour son propre bien ; les niveaux se ressemblent et on se contente de les traverser sans aucune subtilité, déblayant le passage à coup d'explosions, se frayant un chemin entre des pluies de balles de plus en plus excessives.

Ce qu'il y a de plus culotté chez [i]Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo[/i], c'est son titre à rallonge. Le reste n'est qu'un agréable jeu de tir qui aurait mérité d'autres obstacles que des ennemis posés çà et là sur la route et surtout de meilleures propositions de boss pour décrocher cette lune dont il se rapproche toujours mais qu'il n'atteint jamais. Il n'empêche qu'on s'amuse beaucoup en compagnie de ce [i]shoot'em up[/i] aussi pur qu'il n'est pas serti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082824979', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1561578841}
review:
"Super Galaxy Squadron is a fast-paced vertical shooter designed for human beings as well as shmup veterans."  There's nothing about this game that's designed for veterans.  Even playing on arcade hell hardcore mode gave me no challenge at all.  The focus mode slows everything down and the gauge refills really fast, so you have a get out of jail free card available at all times.  The stages feel abnormally long, too.  It's especially noticeable since basically nothing is going on in them.  I eventually just got bored and stopped in stage 3.  Also, your health refills after every stage.  

Endless mode was no fun either, I got to wave 26 with an SSS rank first try and only lost because at wave 26 there are more enemies spawning than you can kill so they all start moving down the screen.  Inevitably this just forms a solid wall of enemies and there's nothing you can do about it.

There's nothing wrong with making easy games, but there is something wrong with making them too easy.  If you feel zero resistance when playing, then there's no point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972636851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1561275893}
review:
This harks back to the classic era with arcade games sucking money. The classic mode is actually not bad but the turbo is just terrible. Compared to classic it just feels unfair. There is sooooooo much noise on the screen at times it is just pointless.

Looking at the achievements almost nobody that owns it plays it much and that says something. 12% have got the first boss achievement and to be honest I got that without trying

I got in a bundle for near nothing and the only reason I have 1.5 hours game time is to get all the cards. I walked the dog during part of that time and left it idle.

If you are a hard core shooter fan you might get something from it but all reality is there are better old school classic shooter on MAME that out class this in every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029708120', 'num_games_owned': 1211, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1558519643}
review:
Exceedingly easy throughout. Your hitbox is tiny and the bullet patterns require little thought to dodge. There's a lot of ships to choose from but they don't have anything unique to them other than shot patterns, giving no real reason to try the game again with a different character after you find one you like. Story is barebones and doesn't make much sense (A terrorist group attacked their race, so the response was to follow up and attack their home planet in defense..?)
The game only has 6 levels, so I considered pushing through just to finish it, but it ends with a ridiculous difficulty spike of a final boss, with no healthbar or any indication how close you are to finishing. At that point, I had to give up.
developer_response:

We swear :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198117393173', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1702845152}
review:

For me this game is pretty much just, Hold down fire and hope for the best.
Yeah this is the first time I've ever played a bullet hell game and I gotta say, ITS AWESOME! For some reason I really like that almost ALL the time I have NO clue what the heck is happening, but its great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964722740', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1549898220}
review:
This game could be fun, but it feels rough and has some issues with controllers in Linux (probably Game Maker bug). I didn't like the level design. The ship variety seems nice at first, but in the end it doesn't make much sense because the game feels cluttered and unimaginative, you simply can't decide which ships are better for each situation because the level design isn't there to make sense of them.

Linux users beware, you may find a bug that makes the game slow down when using the controller. I have the same problem in Momodora IV and I believe it is caused by the Game Maker they used to develop the Linux ports.

In the end, if you like this genre and graphics style, pick Blue Revolver instead, it works well on Linux and can stand on its own as a bullet hell shooter comparable with the classics. I wish I could recommend this, but the gameplay isn't there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999302391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1546619944}
review:
Joguinho de navinha fodinha!

Estava no steam tentando achar algum game bacana pra usar a grana que estava na minha carteira a meses e como os games estavam em promoção de fim de ano não deixei a oportunidade passar. Peguei vários games e um deles era um jogo de navinha.

Estava com um precinho daqueles que não dava pra deixar passar e acabei pegando e sem esperar muito fui jogar. Nunca me diverti tanto com um game assim. Na verdade nem lembro quando foi a ultima vez que joguei um game de navinha até o final e com Super Galaxy Squadron EX TURBO tive uma ótima experiencia.

O game tem uma historia de guerra, bem clichê, mais pra vencê - la você conta com 17 naves cada uma com três tipos de atributos diferentes. Então temos 17 estilos pra jogar! O interessante é que podemos escolher qual usar no inicio das fases variando bastante a jogabilidade.

O jogo conta com 6 fases e varias dificuldades para todos os tipos de jogadores, alguns modos de jogo,  e mesmo nos níveis mais simples não será fácil finaliza - lo. Temos aqui um game simples com graficos pixelados, muitos efeitos, chefes gigantes e uma boa trilha sonora e mesmo sendo um game curto, vale a pena ser jogado.

Prós: 
Ação frenetica e controles precisos

Contras:
Sem multiplayer e muito curto

author: {'steamid': '76561198821654331', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1656679927}
review: I like its gameplay and graphics. I wish I could change resolutions and controls. It runs fine on my Surface Go and even more fine on my gaming laptop. The thing is if I want to play this one outside and want to save battery I cannot. Besides that, arrow keys on some keyboards aren't big enough or placed too tightly that they aren't good for gaming. Please add options that allow me to do those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006304982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1546290948}
review:
Clearly made by people that either don't understand or don't care the shmup genre. The result is amateurish. I find it offensive that they would charge money for a game with mechanics and level design of this level of quality.

Check out Blue Revolver instead if you're looking for something to scratch your STG itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984086236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1533394548}
review:
SGSEXT (great acronym) is a very compitent shooter. It's very solidly made, with almost no technical issues. The OST is banging without being to distracting, the visuals are juicy while being easy-to-read and the levels are designed well enough to be replayed. Different ships add to the replayability nicely.

It's just a great, all-round game with very little flaws. I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001961650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1572226486}
review: I suck at shmups. I love how they work, but honestly, I suck at them. This game was awesome, and not because it was just easy, because it isn't. It has tons of ways to customize your gameplay, and gives those who are like me, a challenge that isn't insurmountable except for with 1000 hours of practice without any results. No, this provides a variety of gameplay styles and levels of difficulty, in a very well-made shmup. Definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067106867', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1602978751}
review:
安価だけどしっかりと丁寧に作ってある。
クラシックモードは一撃死だけどEX Turboモードはシールド制だからシューティングゲームが苦手な人でも割とカジュアルに遊べます。
装備の違う機体が沢山あって楽しいです。
海外のシューティングゲームにありがちな打ち込みの爽快感がないって不満もなく効果音と振動で気持ちいいです。
不満点はパワーアップアイテムの判定が若干小さく、取りづらい。

地味に音楽もいいのでサントラも一緒にどうぞ。

[h1]6.5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198134500805', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1542881809}
review: It's a good shmup, with a nice soundtrack too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999923551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1542413306}
review:
Great graphics, good music, fun bullet hell gameplay.

Difficulty is rather uneven - levels are either too easy or too difficult.

Not a lot of variety between levels.  Probably the backgrounds and enemy ships are different but I didn't notice. On the other hand there is variety and replayability in the large choice of player ships/characters available.

There is a story which is told via a few animations and some poor voice acting.  You don't really need a story in a shoot'em up, so I guess this is fine, but it feels like a bit of a missed opportunity to introduce all these characters and then not develop any of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008912459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1704095928}
review:
機体の数が１４と多い。
カジュアルを選べば、遅くて数の多い弾幕避けを楽しめ、バツグンスペシャルVerを思い出す。
ゲーム的には怒首領蜂を思い浮かべる。
武器はメインとサブで、ABXYがショット、Rがハイパー、Ｌが低速（敵と敵弾のスピードが遅くなる。）
とシンプルな操作。
１ステージ辺りの時間はそれ程長くなくテンポが良い。

個人的には、カジュアルモードで、右から２番目のガンビット的なオプションがある機体と、
異星人の４発同時発射のショットが中々お薦め。

動画を見てから買うのを決めても良いと思えるが、
これからもっと楽しんでから、追記があれば追記すると思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198326671674', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1682471241}
review:
Excellent shooter in the classical style with two major twists: First, instead of being able to move slowly, the focus button causes the game to slow down so you can react faster. Second, there is no invincibility after being hit, which can be frustrating if you're used to being able to relax and reposition yourself during the post-hit invincibility.
-There's a wide variety of ships with different attack types, speed, and armor. 
-There are cutscenes with voice acting which is cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302554187', 'num_games_owned': 3354, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1530618692}
review:
先に不満点としては、アイテムはもっとコリジョン大きくてもいいんじゃね？くらいか。

ゲームとしては、完全にCAVE系弾幕ながら、音楽や見た目からPCEのカネコっぽいが、音楽がサイバリオンっぽいステージもあって、メロディアスさとかで渡部氏っぽい要素もある。
日本語はないが、警告とか日本語で出てくる辺り、どっかのアレを思い出す。

システムはショット、これはメインとサブが別に段階パワーアップだがボタンは1つ。
左BorTでスロー(時間チャージ式)と右BorTでボム的な攻撃(アイテムチャージ式)。
機体は沢山あり、かなり能力的な差があるが、面開始時やコンティニュー時に変更も可能。

難易度は広く選べ、カジュアルなら弾速が遅いし、残機制じゃないのでゴリ押し出来ないのも相まって、この手のゲームスキル向上には良いゲームかも知れない。

惜しいのはプレイ感の地味さと、もう少し細かい設定項目があってもいいかなぁという部分。
あと価格的に、セールでもこれくらいだと初心者は買わないだろうって微妙な値段なのも惜しいか。
もし300円とかだったら、是非、買って遊んでみて欲しいと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990335583', 'num_games_owned': 3532, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1530521429}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078887697', 'num_games_owned': 1806, 'num_reviews': 673, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1669772068}
review:
Anything with this many adjectives in the title can't be good

Edit: Revisiting this years later, I think this is a decent game in the bullet hell genre. Controls are simple and fluid, but the regular levels feel completely inconsequential and only the bosses are worth rushing. At the same time, I don't really enjoy rushing bullet hell bosses over and over. Ultimately it's just not the game and maybe not the genre for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993922877', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1524449007}
review: The shooting is really punchy and the art style is good. But there isn't really much here. You just hold down the button and avoid bullets. I like the focus feature but hyper takes a long time to charge and never feels like it acomplishes much. Not bad if you're looking for a bullet hell and it's on sale, but don't expect it to keep your attention very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005774949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1521420883}
review:
[h1] What is this game? [/h1]
[i]Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo[/i] is a top-down, bullet-hell "shoot 'em up" game in the purest sense. For those familar with games like [i]Ikaruga[/i], you'll feel right at home here. Featuring great pixel-art and fast paced "dodge bullets, blow up spaceships", SGS provides that arcade-like experience for retro fans. Though the campaign is fairly short, there's an endless mode and boss rush mode, as well as 17 different ships to try out.

[h1] You Should [b]Buy[/b] This Game If: [/h1]
[list][*]You really like bullet-hell shoot-em-up games and are looking for a quick distraction.[/list]

[h1] You Should [b]Skip[/b] This Game If: [/h1]
[list][*]You dislike having your screen covered in deadly moving shapes.
[*]You already have access to this type of shoot-em-up game (this one offers nothing unique).
[*]You're looking for a story-driven or lengthy gameplay experience.[/list]

[h1] My Personal Opinion (Recommendation Reflects This) [/h1]
What can I say, it's a shoot 'em up. It delivers exactly what you'd expect, nothing more and nothing less. I'm not typically a fan of these types of games, but I received [i]Super Galaxy Squadron[/i] in a bundle a while back and figured I'd give it a go.

I can't say I'm that impressed. I had fun for a little while, but after around the hour mark, the game gets a little repetitive and dull. The enemies just aren't interesting enough. They all do the same thing: enter from the top, shoot a few projectiles, then proceed to get obliterated. Rinse and repeat.

The six bosses are equally as tiring, as they take a ridiculous number of hits and resort to just filling your screen with shapes rather than doing anything interesting or interactive. And if you want to talk about lame, the final boss is literally a giant ball.

The game offers 17 ships, but honestly I'm satisfied with just the two I tried out. There's no incentive to go back 15 more times.

I can't recommend this game, especially at a $12 price tag. Go pick up [i]Spy Fox 2[/i] and play its "Things from Space" instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072553411', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1521088297}
review:
I am not a veteran to shmups - that being said, I have played SOME in the past and can throw in my two cents about the quality of this game.
This game has good pixel graphics, music, and feels exhilirating. It has it's tense, exciting moments as you are low on health and are hoping one appears soon. However, it also has it's lackluster moments, such as boss fights. They are quite boring, as you figure out a general pattern and kind of just shoot, not much skill involved after you figure out the boss "trick". Not to mention that the boss, like many of the enemies, are boring spaceships with no character or design effort put into them. 

Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo is not a bad game. It's not a bad shmup. But it's not a good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078127217', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1518874428}
review:
Pro:
 * Looks and feels great

Con:
 * Default difficulty is too easy. I didn't lose a single life until the game suddenly ramped the difficulty for the final boss. I'm not even good at these games - so don't waste time, and challenge yourself from the start.
 * It feels a little light, with just 6 stages. It doesn't feel like there's much you can do to influence the score you get, but I could be wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198631886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1646518042}
review: Хардкорная игра, если не пользоватся щитом или замедением времени. Интересные боссы, но в целом дождь из пуль и космических караблей. Классный визуал и просто офигенное звуковое оформление.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1517512983}
review:

It is not very appealing, when you start your shoot them up experience with jamewtown, this one is pretty flat, or lifeless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046132108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1519801443}
review: 1CC'd the game on my first attempt. Was quite surprised how easy it was to do so, although I suspect that's likely due to my past experience with these kinds of games and a beginner would likely feel very differently. Difficulty isn't everything though and the game was a blast with it's awesome sprites, colors, animations, and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097629172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1514045190}
review: If you're looking for another shmup to play I think this is a pretty good one.  The genre has a pretty specific but devoted fan base, so if you're not sure if you like these kinds of games definitely do your research if you're new to them.  If you know what you're in for this is a good solid shmup that is at least comparable to the old favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047391587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1618026715}
review:
I'm a bit disapointed by the lack of customizable controls - you're forced to play the game with the arrow keys if you don't have a controller handy. You're certainly going to have a lot more trouble if you're not using a joystick, but playing in casual difficulty on lunch break at work would be a lot nicer if I could use WASD. Ironically, picking a ship with worse maneuvrability (aka slower movement speed) is best when playing with the keyboard. Still, just use a controller if you can.

I don't play manic shooters (aka bullet hell) very often and I'll say this is one of the more accessible ones I've tried - although the final boss certainly made me give up on a few otherwise flawless playthroughs. I haven't had this much fun on a game of this kind since I discovered the Frantic flash games ages ago. I found the veteran difficulty to be just the right amount of challenge for me (middle out of three options).

The campain is made of six levels and is quite short, you'll tear through it in a single sitting. However, many ships have gimmicky controls that will make you want to retry the game with all of them. The boss rush and endless modes are nice little extras, but you'll probably be able to complete the campain and most achievements in 3h. All that will be left is to play through the game in hardcore mode: no health pickups and no checkpoints. There isn't anything to increase the durability like unlockables or customization options. If you're the kind of person who plays a game to a satisfying level of completion and never touches it again, you might want to pass on this one. But it certainly is a great game and I know I will spend hours playing the endless mode casually whenever I have a short break.

The game's graphics are flawless. Both your hitbox and enemy bullets stand out, making them easy to notice within the ton of sprites covering the screen at all times. The soundtrack fits the game perfectly. I don't have much else to say about the art direction. The "story" and lore of the game are of little to no interest, but that's not really what we're here for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029508562', 'num_games_owned': 2560, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1512794287}
review:
- I liked the endless flow of explosions and easily killable enemies and collectibles to pick up and bullets to dodge: the screen is always filled, the controller is always rumbling, it gave me a feeling of satisfaction

- It's good that I have control over the difficulty level, I'm bad at shmups and happy to finish on Casual first, then improve my skills a bit on Veteran (while for sure there will be those who prefer Hell)

- When you die in a boss fight you are not sent back to the start of the stage, but rather just the boss fight is restarted. This was a good design choice - I would have logged more hours if it wasn't the case, but it would have been a far worse experience

- There's a good variety of ships to choose from, which play differently from each other - armor, power, and agility change from ship to ship, along with the type of weapon and its reach. I had fun the most with the default/first ship

- It's not my favorite shmup, but it's quite good

author: {'steamid': '76561198027061332', 'num_games_owned': 2004, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1511926057}
review:
While not the best shmup I've played on Steam, I often find myself returning to this when I just want to tear through enemies and listen things blow up. I find the spritework and art direction very satisfying, especially the vibrant colors. The rhythmic explosions of enemies feels good to my ears and the music is fine. I also commend the devs for the amount of content added after the EX Turbo update. I still have yet to try out all of the ships.

I will say that sometimes the levels can feel a bit samey. A bit more variety in the backgrounds could help there. The boss variety is decent, however. Also the bullet patterns tend to get cluttered to the point where I can't tell what's happening (I guess that's what the slow-down mechanic is for). Despite those issues, I'll still be picking this up again from time to time.

review:
Le seul problème avec ce jeu, c'est que la musique reste en tête. :(


Blague à part, le jeu à tout pour lui. Musique donc mais également graphismes, accessibilité (du néophyte à l'hardcore gamer) et gameplay. Simple, efficace et diablement rythmé, c'est dans le top du shmup actuel.
Une valeur sûre pour ceux qui apprécient le genre. Pour les autres, c'est sans doute une occasion d'apprécier un genre toujours aussi clivant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400079598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1523705603}
review:
[h1]SUPER GALAXY SQUADRON EX TURBO - SYNSET - 2014 - PC : LE DANMAKU INDE DE LA REACTIVITE[/h1]

Excellent Danmaku à la réalisation tout en gros pixel qui fait bip, proposant 6 stages totalement orientés esquive "au réflexe", SGSEXT cumule les spécificités qui vont dans le sens player-friendly à l'image de son gameplay très permissif, notamment grâce à sa barre de vie rechargeable ou encore de la possibilité d'user de "bullet-time" pour se sortir du pétrin quand ça se charge un peu trop.

Le scoring est addictif en diable grâce à sa jauge de combo (bien difficile à optimiser, les placements ratés ne pardonnent généralement pas), les boss donnent du fil a retordre, le rythme ne faiblis quasiment jamais, bref on s'éclate très facilement, et la profondeur est au rendez vous pour qui souhaiterai optimiser un peu tout ça : un très bon mode Boss rush ainsi qu'un excellent mode Endless seront également de la partie, permettant le même gameplay que pour le mode Story.
De plus, avec pas moins de 17 vaisseaux vraiment différents, on peux raisonnablement parler de diversité dans l'approche permise par le jeu. Et ça, c'est bonnard.

Ce titre se place tout simplement parmi les indispensables Steam de mon point de vue, que ce soit pour ses qualités intrinsèques indéniables, dont sa grosse re-jouabilité, ou encore par le simple fait de constituer une exclusivité PC particulièrement complète.


"Extrait de la review du jeu sur Shmupem'all.com"
==> [url]http://forum.shmupemall.com/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=2731[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063952782', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1515376247}
review:
You can't rebind the controls, so when I played on my laptop (which only detects 2 keys at the same time) I couldn't shoot, move and use the slow mode at the same time. If anyone else has this problem, I used Autohotkey to assign shift as the slow mode, and it solved the problem.
I also think the game could benefit from a manual, as there are a lot of mechanics, such as healing when you dodge very close bullets, which I didn't know at first.
I still recommend this game, though. Some parts were really hard, but you can retry infinite times from where you left, so it was really fun to play, to keep dying and getting better at the parts you died without having to restart the level all over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261589194', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 305, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1498616577}
review: 게임 하나 사면 오리지널하고 리메이크작 EX Turbo를 둘 다 준다. 처음 해보는 탄막 슈팅 게임이었는데, 즐거운 경험이었음. 확실히 탄막 슈팅의 '느낌'이랄까, 아무튼 그런 거 찾는 데는 도움이 됨. 난도는 처음 해보는 필자도 조금만 집중하면 안 죽고 원코인 할 수 있을 정도? 일단 슈팅 게임인데도 HP 시스템을 도입해서 목숨 연명이 쉬운 게 난도 저하에 큰 몫을 한다. 혹시 탄막 슈팅 입문을 원하는 사람에게 강력 추천. 도트 그래픽도 예뻐서 좋았다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049433567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1497622755}
review: Like others I got this through Humble. Anyway, this is far from the worst bullet hell game, and I'm even tempted to say it is on the good side, but this one has a few minor issues that gave me a bit of a strange first impression. First, the voice acting in the story sections is very serious and dour and wholly at odds with the absurd title and overall silliness. That's kinda a minor thing, but it was the first thing that hit me. The much bigger issue involves the hitboxes. I'm not sure if they change based on difficulty, but I had a very hard time getting a sense of what would actually hit me. It didn't help that my ship had two little things sticking off that apparently were not at all part of the hitbox. But even once I established that, it seemed like there were some projectiles that I did not understand why they did not hit. On the whole I'm not the biggest fan of bullet-hell games to begin with, and while this one is not the worst I've tried to give a fair shot, it's not going to convince anyone who isn't already a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064939378', 'num_games_owned': 6997, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1500564818}
review:
游戏有两个模式经典版和加速版。

经典版难度适中适合我们这种手残人玩。而且战机的威力可以升级，每一小关都会有增加战机威力的东西可吃，关底boss有点小难。其他都还好。

加速版标准的像素版首领蜂但是多了一个减速技能很好的控制了节奏，但对于我们这种手残党来说还是很难的。

游戏总体来说关卡设计的很不错尤其是加速版给人的感觉很燃。BGM可能是特意为了和像素配合很复古。让人有一种玩小霸王的感觉。还有飞机真的很多有点多得离谱，各种性能的都有实在看着眼花，但这也算是设计者的诚意吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019328070', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1496215052}
review:
A very fun arcade shooter. There are lots of different ships to play as, all unlocked from the beginning, each with their own different firing styles and special attacks, so there's some good replayability. It's fairly short (only 6 stages, each of which takes about 5 minutes). I played through first time on Veteran difficulty, normal setting, and didn't have much trouble getting through the game until I got to Final Weapon, who's a serious uptick in difficulty. (Appropriate for a final boss, I guess!) I finally beat it using Black.

Defnitely worth picking up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010754797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1662783328}
review: I got this game as a part of the Humble Freedom Bundle. I love the chiptunes-style soundtrack and the bright colors. It's also a really fun bullet hell shoot-em-up, although it would be nice if there was a bit of explanation at the beginning of the primary and secondary weapons. Also, in some levels the background is busy and it's difficult to know what is aesthetic and what is actually going to hurt you. Overall, though, I definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998788476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1491521718}
review: Coming from the days of these types of shooters (Shmups I believe the young 'uns are calling them).  I enjoy the sessions I play. Lots of action, lots of bullet-hell, good bosses and no frame drops. I will always go back to this to kill time. If you get chance, in a bundle or on a sale, I have no hesitation in recommending it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2121, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1494699782}
review:
Lovely graphics and lovely arsenal of ships to fly without having to unlock them. Campaign is the typical 5 levels and boss at the end of every stage. 

Additional game modes and difficulties to extend the experience exists. All in all i like this title quite a lot. Grab it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010315744', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1494799604}
review:
I was looking forward to playing the game for a long time. Sadly, for all the updates and upgrades this game has there is a lot to be desired. 

-Arcade mode is basically Story Mode, (no this game does not include a separate Story Mode). After every level is a fully voiced cutscene. Look i appreciate the thought put into this but for a shmup the less of a story the better. Have a intro reel play before i hit the start button and give me a nice cutscene after i beat the game. You know what's funny though? After beating the game all you get is a screen or two of text basically saying "congratulations". No fully voiced ending here, its like the devs spent all their budget and shoehorned in the text as an afterthought. 

-There's about 10 ships to choose from but over half of them are useless because of their stats. 

-Every time you get hit you lose powerups which for some reason float toward the top of the screen, (and also disappear quite quickly). 

-The bosses are supposed to be intimidating and fierce but here they show up and just sit there. That, and like another reviewer has said, they are giant bullet sponges that are a grind to beat. Dont even get me started on the last boss' health (which btw the devs decided that the last boss doesnt show a health bar for some dumb reason). 

-The music is tinny and annoying as all hell. I enjoy 8-bit style music but this is really bad. 

There are literally a TON of better shmups on Steam than this. 

3.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970576581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1494068052}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1493870541}

A straightforward shoot-em-up pushes past the competition by featuring a wide range of ships to play as, a varied array of well balanced difficulties, and a high powered soundtrack.

It doesn't redefine the genre with any of it's choices but shows the best of what the basic package can be.

review:
Gotta say this game is such a nice feeling throwback to going to arcades off the bat.

Pros: 
-Amazing Soundtrack
-Great Artwork
-Fully fleshed out features 
-Backstory to characters
-Overall feels nice when playing (especially with a controller)

Cons:

Would have to say 10/10 would shoot'em up again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028049202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1490702888}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198025049565', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1690725347}
review:
Ce schmup est ce qu'on peut appeller un jeu complet. Plein de modes de jeux pour les débutants ou les plus couillus, plein de vaisseaux aux tirs différents, différents modes de jeux, 6 niveaux à faire et refaire.


Le style graphique plaira aux nostalgiques de la Néo geo dont je fais partie. Le jeu propose un mode "focus" qui ralentira l'action ce qui vous permettra de slalomer dans les océans de boubles : trés utile surtout contre les boss. Et une attaque "Hyper" des plus classique fera le ménage pour vous en cas de coup dur.

Ce jeu est bon.


+
Jeu ultra complet
Plein de vaisseaux
Des boss cool


-
La musique pas mémorable

author: {'steamid': '76561198080691587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1570111888}
review: 爽快类的STG，美工、音乐和音效都属于上乘，画面色彩偏鲜艳，这点不多见。但是关卡同质性很严重，敌方的机体和BOSS也没给我刘下很深的印象，虽然我方可选机体众多，但攻击方式都大同小异，只是最近一个更新加入了一个可激光照准的机体，算是有点不一样了。论机体数量庞大，以前的《音速之翼》、《闪亮之星》哪一个机体数量不多？而且都还能做出机体差异性。由于机体决定了攻击方式，所以游戏途中的升级物品就只是单纯升级主副武器的火力而已，但说实话升级与否并看不出来有什么多大的区别。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1490757883}
review:
A great 90's style shooter , I've not really connected with any of the reasons behind "not recommended" reviews - its priced right , has replayability and is just really well done.

PROS:
Feels like an authentic 90's arcade experience
Great music and artwork (for the 90's style)
Endless and Arcade Hell hardcore mode add good challenge.
LOVE the maaaaany options for graphics style, from the early 80's right up to modern time (VIC 20, 240 vga, Amiga, C64 etc)

CONS:
Can seem too easy on "default" arcade mode - you will complete it in 1 sitting if you are prepared to continue.
No real user guide (that I could find) could make it a bit harder for newbies,  but nothing serious.

Overall I'd give this as a 90's Shoot-em-up - 8/10.

Will spend the night playing it when I meant to only have 1 game, again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050217034', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1708398402}
review: Amazing. Very difficult (pre update)*. Comes with Super Galaxy Squadron EX Turbo and Super Galaxy Squadron. I reccomend you try the original first so that you get a feel for the bullet hell before going in to EX Turbo. The turbo update added quite a few things, but no additional bosses. The addition of bullet hell mode is very nice. The game feels very much like 1942(3?). Sadly there is no TATE mode, but is the current most requested feature. Please enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029186365', 'num_games_owned': 1139, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1489442577}
review: I had fun with it. The asking price is a bit steep, I'd grab definitely grab it if it's on sale and you're interested. It's not going to blow you away but it's a solid shoot em up/bullet hell. There's lots of different ships to pick from, each one has a different feel/mechanic. The soundtrack was definitely a highlight, along with the brightly colored aesthetic. It's a bit light on content, you have 6 levels in the single player with various difficulty levels, along with an endless mode and a boss rush mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072094836', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1526385853}
review:
海外スタジオ制作の縦スクロール弾幕シューティング。
「Super Galaxy Squadron」は最初パッとしない「ああ、海外のファンが日本のこれ系を模倣して作った感じかな」
程度の出来で悪く言えば単調地味だったのですが、EXを経て今回のアップデートで
敵機破壊時のエフェクトがど派手になり爽快感大幅アップ。
目の肥えた弾幕シューターにもアピールできるゲームになったと思います。


基本操作は
・ショット（プライマリ・セカンダリの二種類。共にショットボタンで同時発射）
・ハイパー（得点アイテム回収→ゲージマックスで発動。機体により効果はは多種多様）
の2ボタンだったのが新たに「スローモフォーカス」が追加。
ゲージがある状態で発動すると時間の経過を遅くすることができます。
これにより初心者でも「画面を埋め尽くす弾幕の間を通り抜ける」事が格段に容易になっています。
またこのフォーカスゲージは敵機破壊で回復するので回収も容易です。

アップデート前までは判定が非常にシビアだった
「敵機を連続で破壊し続けることによって得点に倍率がかかる」という稼ぎシステムも
ターボというだけあって敵機の出現数も敵の放つ弾も倍増した事で倍率維持が容易になっています。
最大で倍率10倍になったので弾幕好きは買ってみて損はしないんじゃないでしょうか。
特にエンドレスモードの敵機の圧倒的出現数とさじを投げたくなるレベルの弾幕は
プレイヤーに非常に挑戦的です。

日本ではなく海外のゲーム会社からこういう良作が出ていることに素直に驚きと喜びを覚えました。
また日本の会社に負けないぐらいのSTGを作ってほしいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119476528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1664659123}

As if the game wasn't already great, they updated it to EX.
Then they made EX Turbo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062603596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1488958018}
review:
"what we think is one of the most full featured, fun and accessible SHMUPs in the galaxy."
-dev notes on TURBO update

Well, let's speak on full-featured shootemups.
SGSEXT lacks a replay mode, a TATE mode, a practice mode, and a frame counter. Pretty much all these should be expected in a modern vertical PC STG.
It also lacks remappable controls and seperate volume options for music and sound effects. All PC games should have this. 
Since the dev update makes it clear that this is the super mega final version forever, I assume none of these things will ever be added, making the above statement seem pretty ridiculous. When STG players think "full-featured", "Endless Mode" is likely the last thing on their mind. Study what actual habitual players of your game want, not just the casual indie game bundle shoppers.

Some of the music is pretty cool and most of the art is much better than the gameplay.
The gameplay is fun enough for a few playthroughs, but suffers from poor tuning. The first boss is too hard, the final stage is too easy,etc. The FINAL WEAPON is annoying to play with infinite lives(AKA standard difficulty). Infinite lives on a TLB? Go ahead and give me a game over, I stopped after 20 tries and had to turn the game off. Merciful death in shootemups is actually a good thing, the game is supposed to boot you out if you suck too hard so you can go do something else for awhile. Infinite lives just means you get to bash your head against the wall or give up manually. Modern game devs are quick to dispose of antiquated systems, while missing the reasons they work.

The respawning health system and bullet time seem like a crutch for poor tuning if you ask me.
This game supports GRAZING, yet it does not have a BRAKE button to slow your ship. These days, that seems pretty silly, especially with bullets this fast. Bullet time doesn't count, it's limited-use and is a lazy mechanic in almost ANY game. The fact that games market it as a feature is ridiculous, it doesn't take an amazing programmer to make a game run slower. Most danmaku games will give you a brake if grazing is expected or if bullet speed/density is as high as it is in this game.

I ignored this game for a long time and eventually got it on sale. Many many months later, I've only booted it a few times. I don't think it's as bad as some players do. Mostly it's a generic western indie retro STG that, like most similar games, fail to offer much besides pretty bullets and constant explosions. There are dozens of better shooting games on Steam and most of them were made in Japan. Western indies just don't understand these kinds of games, and most players, if they haven't been paying attention to the last 20 years of imports, wouldn't even know what they were missing. With that in mind, here are some other titles I feel better deserve your attention:

Diadra Empty
Gundemonium Collection
eXceed 2nd/3rd
RefleX
RefRain: Prism Memories
QP Shooting: Dangerous
Crimzon Clover
Eschatos
Mushihimesama
Raiden IV
Star Saviours
