author: {'steamid': '76561198008305545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1488395861}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron Ex (SGSE) est un Shoot Them Up qui propose d'aller annihiler une armée de robots (J'avoue, j'ai zappé l'histoire).
Le tout est en scrolling vertical, il y a plusieurs modes de difficulté et un mode sans fin. Le jeu se veut dans la veine Danmaku (Pluie de boulettes si google trad a bien bossé). Comprendre qu'il va y avoir plein de projectiles à éviter et faire du scoring.

L'une des particularités de SGSE est de ne pas proposer de continue, ni de crédit, mais un système de sauvegarde assez simple : L'arrivée au boss déclenche une sauvegarde automatique tout comme le début de chaque niveau. Entre les deux, la mort se solde par un retour au début du niveau (de là à dire que c'est pour rallonger la durée de vie...).
Il y a un choix assez impressionnant de vaisseaux (une douzaine environ) avec leurs particularités. Le gameplay consiste à éviter les boulettes et tuer les ennemis en face. Rien d'original sauf qu'il y a une jauge de vie et une d'hyper qu'il faut remplir pour déclencher le tir secondaire (différent suivant le vaisseau choisi). Les ennemis donnent de la vie assez régulièrement et laissent parfois tomber des petits bonus pour augmenter le tir principal et le secondaire. Le maximum étant de cinq augmentations pour chaque. Le reste se transforme en points et le fait de se faire toucher baisse la jauge de vie (à un moment, il faut bien justifier son existence), occasionne la perte d'un ou plusieurs bonus qu'il faudra récupérer (prévoir un petit temps avant de les ramasser).

Les graphismes sont assez jolis sauf que la direction artistique est ultra générique avec des niveaux qui sont, pour la plupart, statiques et sans intérêt. Le "bestiaire" est très limité en plus d'être particulièrement peu inspiré même les boss ( peu marquants et réutilisés sur 6 niveaux).
La visibilité est parfois problématique. Cela vient peut être de moi, mais j'ai trouvé que la palette de couleurs des boulettes était souvent très proche de celle des vaisseaux.
Le boss de fin m'a posé énormément de problème, mais je mettrais plutôt ça sur le compte de mon absence totale de talent pour le genre.

La durée de vie est toujours relative et encore plus pour les shmup : 1H pour finir le mode arcade grand maximum. 100X plus si vous accrochez et voulez battre des records dans les modes les plus difficiles.


En résumé, c'est un jeu sympathique qui n'arrive pas à la cheville des ténors du genre sortis sur PC. La faute à une progression peu intéressante, des décors statiques et une direction artisitique générique couplé à un bestiaire pas assez marquant. La profusion de vaisseaux est vraiment sa seule originalité et ne suffit pas, de mon point de vue.
Je recommande parce que je ne me suis pas ennuyé et si l'évaluation neutre avait existé, je l'aurais mis dans cette catégorie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156231391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1548901914}
review:
You know what, fuck it, this game deserves it. Super Galaxy Squadron EX does not warrant a fraction of its positive scores. It is a terrible game that does almost nothing right, and only appeals to people who don't know or care what good game design is. This is obviously far too many people!

And this is EX, which is supposed to have been built off an original. That game is even worse by the way, it happens to come with the purchase for some reason but don't bother trying to play it. Turbo had better be absolute MASTERCLASS to make up for this shit, and I have ZERO faith in the developers to pull it off.

edit: Turbo's out. Game is EVEN WORSE somehow. Sure wouldn't mind a double downvote button right about now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974085922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1487820406}
review: If Ikaruga and Gradius are the pinnacles of the Shoot-Em-Up genre, this is more like the Bonk's Adventure to their Mario.  Boring looking enemies, empty environments, and simple looking bosses are the least of this game's problems.  No, the worst part is that the hit detection is nonsensical.  Sometimes you'll watch bullets pass right through your ship.  Sometimes you get invulnerability when you get hit.  Sometimes you get hit several times in a row.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042664584', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1487727283}
review: I rarely play SHMUPs but I got this in the Humble Freedom Bundle and had a good time. The story mode lasts about an hour and presents a good challenge. The pixel art is great and the retro style music is intense and fits the aesthetic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093065723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1487677100}
review: A visually and aurally polished game with plenty of stuff to do, but ultimately fails at being fun due to some design flaws making the experience frustrating. Lack of mercy invincibility takes away the leniency the HP bar is meant to offer, losing power-ups randomly each time you're hit not only punishes you doubly for making a mistake, it also distracts you and introduces an element of chance. Finally, your bombs don't even make you temporarily invincible, taking away the ONE thing they're meant for!

review: Is a really classic bullet-hell game, the pixel art is lovely, the midi music nostalgic and the level design and control are awesome. [strike]The only bad thing i see (and i probably regret saying that) is that the hitbox feels a little "permisive" sometime you feel yau've been hit but no. [/strike] (Edit: I've been told the hitbox is the dot on the center of your ship and is done on purpose so take back what i just said, no bad things hahaha). Anyway is a great adquisition bring me back to 90's when this kind of games feel really hard but no unfair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021959875', 'num_games_owned': 6844, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1487514829}
review: 有在水準之上的彈幕遊戲，操作簡易，只有子彈與大決兩個按鈕，武器升級很直覺，共六大關，雖然有多達14種機體可操作，但彈幕效果與敵機出現位置重複性太高，整體難度是靠敵機出現頻率多寡堆疊起來的，內容貧乏，容易膩煩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198140974275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1487899704}
review:
If you've ever played top down/vertical shooters like the Raiden series(multi plat), Star Soldier series(multi plat), Raptor: Call of the Shadows(PC), or if you're a big fan of shmups, I highly recommend this game! There are a total of 6 Stages. Jus a little warning. The final boss is tough as heck, as I played this on Veteran!!

Graphics: 5/5, Sound: 5/5, Story: 4.5/5, Gameplay: 5/5, Replay: 4.5/5, Overall: 5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988886676', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1480497269}
review: I love vertical scrolling shmups and this is pretty fucking amazing. the stat system and weapons for each ship are interesting and change up your approach to the game (though not quite as much as in other more tactical customizable games) and all of the graphics and sound are 100% on point. Heaps of bullets, all helpfully designed in such a way that they scan easily, which is appreciated considering how little attention you have to spare at any given moment in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996761804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1472975461}
review:
[url=music.randomencounterband.com/track/galaxy-of-friendship] それでは、お聞きください「友情の銀河 (Galaxy of Friendship)」[/url]

[i] 宇宙レーザーと爆弾　　心の鎧(アーマー) [/i]
[i] 君は美しい　　永遠に離さないで [/i]

[i] 一緒に戦おう　　Fighting for Peace and Love! [/i]
[i] 協力者とデートしない　　Super Galaxy Squad! [/i]

歌サイコー！！
クレジットで流れる歌、「友情の銀河 (Galaxy of Friendship)」の歌詞です。

14種の性能違った機体が登場する縦シューです。
（いや、後に書いてますが、[u]全16種[/u]ですｗ

他の方も書かれていますが...いや、書かれてないか。
ムズい！難しかったよ。
カジュアル(イージー)クリア出来たけど。
エンドレスでランクA取れってあるから、やったら一回でSSSが取れたけど。

[h1] これらみんな、ぜーんぶ　隠し機体のおかげ！ [/h1]

そーなんです。隠し機体あるんです。
しかも、見つけるだけで、実績解除！
隠し機体の性能は、わかるでしょ？
シューティング下手な人がクリアできる機体ですｗ
特殊弾が無いですが、高威力です。ボスがあっという間に...
[strike] あのボスを倒すのに掛かった時間返せ！[/strike] 

それでは、どーぞ歌の続きを
http://music.randomencounterband.com/track/galaxy-of-friendship
で聴けます。もちろん、購入も出来ます。

[i] 言葉に撃墜 Boom!　　防衛線内 [/i]

[i] For Love we Fight,　　Beneath the Starlight. [/i]

[i] 拒否は辛い Boom!　　残機が少ない [/i]

[i] 多勢に無勢時も　　君が by my Side. [/i]
[i] 諦めちゃダメ　　Tau Ceti星から逃げよう [/i]

[i] 宇宙船の撃沈で　　Reflect Your Silent Grace. [/i]
[i] 協力者とデートなら　　みっともない行為ですよ [/i]

[i] 宇宙レーザーと爆弾　　心の鎧(アーマー)に [/i]
[i] 君の戦術は　　一芸一能 [/i]

[i] 一緒に強く成って来た　　Fighting for Peace and Love! [/i]
[i] 終わると退職(やめよう)　　Super Galaxy Squad! [/i]


最後までお読み頂き、ありがとうございます。
それでは、隠し機体の出し方を。

[spoiler] 機体選択画面で、下押しながら、決定キーを押し続ける。[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 同様に、上押しながら、決定キーを押し続ける。[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 箱コンを使ってるなら、スティックの方のみ対応。（何故か十字キーはダメなんだ）[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970841939', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1475735237}
review:
I love SHMUPS and bullet hell shooters, and I love this game. Very clear reverence for CAVE classics here. A big variety of ships to choose from, each with enough variation to make you want to try them all. Very colorful and well-done pixelart that falls somewhere between what you'd expect from a number of modern indie games and the classic arcade SMHUPS this is clearly inspired by. Music fits the gameplay and visuals well and is mostly very good (sadly, my least favorite track is the boss theme, which I'd really prefer to be the most hype one). Great enemy and bullet pattern variety make sure you are constantly threading the needle to avoid taking damage. 

Which leads me to the fact that there ARE some respectable modernizations (or even concessions, if you will) made to make this slightly more approachable (make no mistake, this IS a bullet hell shooter, through and through). You still have the magic pixel hitbox in the center of your ship that is common to SHMUPS, but instead of dying instantly upon getting hit, you have health, which can also be replenished with health pickups. It honestly feels like a good decision and never makes the game seem easy or dumbed-down. It's still a constant battle of attrition, particularly the boss fights, which are a constant wash of colorful projectile patterns across the screen, from both you and the boss. As a welcome stand-in for credits, and also making the game more approachable, the game has checkpoints at the beginning of each level and again before each level boss. 

All in all, one of the best SHMUPS on Steam. Doesn't do anything new with the genre, but it knows what games it wants to immitate, and it does so very successfully. Well worth the money for bullet hell fans (also includes a second verison of the game, a "classic" version, which is fairly different and a little more oldschool).

author: {'steamid': '76561198036371503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1559736890}
review:
Неплохая игра, но финальный босс как всегда не убиваемый в подобного плана играх, не ну если хорошо постараться может и можно пройти, но я раз 10 пробовал не получилось и все бросаю это занятие. 
А так игра весьма неплохая, за рублей 40-50 вполне можно купить если по скидке или в розницу.
Конечно все стандартно для таких игр, никаких откровений там не увидите, но и разочарованы думаю любители жанра не будут.

Кстати и не забывайте апгрейды сохранять если теряете, без полных апагрейдов последние два уровня пройти нереально, так как бронированные враги сплошной стеной летят.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068182835', 'num_games_owned': 4271, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1471480691}
review:
Well... this started out very good. Nice pixel art and great variety of ships, every one very different from others. The gameplay is smooth and nice. I already went thumbs up for this game. But... then I reached the final boss...

I am not a total greenhorn when it comes to shumps, I played my share of them and I consider myself to be quite fond of them, but not a shmup maniac (I'm not masochist). 

But even so... the final boss is a total misunderstanding, I played the game on casual difficulty and all went quite good, I had to repeat some levels couple of times but overall it was challenging and fun. Then came the final boss which sprays a f*ckload of projectiles.... I mean total bukake of projectiles. . I tried defeating him... I tried, I cannot even count how many times I approached the game to defeat him... it wasnt fun it wasnt challenging. It is pure frustration. Avoiding his shoots is sth impossible. You have a pattern there but then at one point along with the pattern he starts spraying extra projectiles in places that you have to escape his pattern shots and then you get hit, loose your powerups, and it all goes to shit as you try to regain them. 

I recommend the game only to shmup masochists. To casual shmup enthusiasts this final boss is dealbreaker. Totaly fu*ks the game. Shame really as like I said, until that final boss moment, the game was great

author: {'steamid': '76561198045370126', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1533881072}
review:
[h1] ★★★★★☆[/h1] 

追加レビュー：
いつのまにかパワーアップしてる！！最高！！
時間をスローにできたり、新自機が増えたりしました。貯め打ちできたりもします。

ただ個人的な要望としては、ＳＦＣパッド対応してほしかった・・・。
一応は要求はしてみたけど、返答は不明。

ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー
基本レビュー：

フレンドが神ゲーって言うからやってみましたけど、ゲロ面白い。
やっぱりフレンドの口コミは、企業の癒着とか無いから信憑性が良いですね。
ぶっちゃけ。買う前は期待してなかった分、驚きもあります。
１週目より２週。２週目より３週。
リズムだったり、それぞれの自機の癖だったり、その都度いろんな発見できました。
シンプルでわかりやすく、敵を倒さないと増えていくので弾幕が回避が難しくなってきます。
そして、グローバルランキングであがった時はうれしいものです。
僕みたいなSTG初心者におすすめ。値段もお手ごろな、爽快系クラシックSTG。


買い。

[h1]気になる点[/h1]
オプション項目が少ない。せめてボタン設定ぐらいさせて。
SFCパッド非対応。仕方なくJoyAdptr（外部ツール）使用。
リプレイ視聴なし・・・。今までで使ったことないからいいですけど。
アーケードのムービースキップしかできない。OFF設定ほしかったです。基本はエンドレスで遊んでるからいいですけど・・・。
あと、一部の方が絶賛するアーケードのエンディングの歌・・・。鳥肌立ちました・・・。すみません。。。正直いらないと思います。
それと、盛り上がるBGMが少ないのは欠点。

他の方が間違ったレビューを書かれてたので、追加で訂正はいります。
[h1]訂正[/h1]
①起動時にEXか”クラシック”どちらか選べれます。
②updateで”自機数”変更。
③基本操作に関して、移動・ショット・hyper(ハイパー）といわれる特殊能力。
このhyperは”ボム”だけではなく、自機によってシールドから援護射撃などにもなります。
コンボ１０（max)の状態で　hyper　使用してみてください。敵を爽快に蹴散らします。
④”ランキング”は見えます。すべての実績の表示から見ることが可能。
予断ですが、開発者のグローバルランキング(EXエンドレス)は１２位と６５位。（2016/7/18)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001956153', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1482076501}
review:
TLDR: If you want a shmup where you don't die in one hit and limits itself to two buttons, please buy Kamui or RefleX.

Super Galaxy Squadron is a textbook example of all style, no substance. SGS claims to be a shmup with modern design decisions and accessibility, when it really just feels like something without any of the nuance or depth that makes a good STG.

For starters, let's talk controls. There's analog movement, a fire button, and a hyper button. The fire button does not need to exist. There is never any reason to not fire your main weapon. In nearly every other shmup I've played, there's always [i]something[/i] there to make sure you're not just holding one button down the entire time, whether it be a situational weapon that requires you to stop firing, or an alternate firing button that makes you move slower for dodging bullets. Instead, SGS has a second button for your hyper, which charges up by grabbing medals dropped by enemies, and is either something that obliterates everything on screen, and/or something to clear away bullets. This is the only thing the game has to keep things varied. The game just feels utterly braindead because [i]this is all that there is[/i]. There's no intricacy or subtlety to any of the games mechanics, or even the scoring. Everything is just centered on dodging bullets and killing enemies really fast, and that's not enough for me.

Then you have the playable ships. There's fourteen of them, and they all don't feel much different. Each one will end up having a bullet spray that covers most of the screen with a few power-ups, leaving their hypers and movement speeds to make them feel unique. This simply is not enough, and each ship's ability to change to how you play is minor. They all look different, but they don't [i]feel[/i] different.

And for all the talk the description has on accessibility, there's two conveniences every other shooter has that SGS is missing; lives and continues. Instead of dying simply letting you come right back until you run out of lives, until you need to forfeit your spot on the leader boards to continue, SGS makes you go back to a checkpoint each time you die. Except in Hardcore mode, meant to give an "arcade-like experience" where dying shunts you right to the back of the level. I can't think of any arcade shmup that does anything like that, and that means you can't just grind through a tough section like in those other games, which is a big part of how those games can keep you invested in improving, with being able to at least see the end. 

Lastly, level and encounter design is non-existent. Stages are entirely enemies coming from the top of the screen against a starry backdrop, there's nothing interesting with how enemies are placed, or how they come in, or even interesting backgrounds that contextualize what's happening. Boss fights get more difficult by having their bullets fly faster until they can't be reasonably reacted to. Things are very plain and breezy until they suddenly get unfair. 

On the bright side, the game has really great music, beautiful, colorful pixel art, and really classy style for days. But that's all it has going for it. For anyone looking for a good shmupping time, I strongly recommend just about anything else on Steam. Triangle Service's games, the Alltynex series, anything that has more substance than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000564041', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1481233575}
review:
First thing's first, I am friends with some of the people who worked on this game.  And I'm also not what you'd call a shmup expert.  That being said, I've been having lots of fun with Super Galaxy Squad EX.  It's approachable for a genre newbie like myself (although there are a lot of options for adjusting the difficulty if you want a challenge), it feels very nice to play thanks to satisfying sound/visual effects and simple but precise controls, and... umm, I guess there's a story?  For some reason?

It's a great little pick-up-and-play game for when you want to zone out and dodge hundreds of projectiles.  Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179962105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1562556335}
review:
This game was everything I wanted it to be: a frenetic, colorful shooter reminiscent of the days of Toaplan and Treasure.

The story is simple: humans and aliens don't get along, so what happens? We go to war. We send the Super Galaxy Squadron out to rock some socks. And boy, will socks get rocked.

First and foremost, there are a vast amount of different ships to choose from. Do you like slow and powerful? Fast but weak? Concentrated fire or spray and pray? The combinations of primary fire, secondary fire, and hypers ensure that there's a perfect match for every style of play. A nice addtion to the selection of ships are short character bios for each pilot. It didn't affect gameplay at all, but it was a nice touch. My favorite was the gelatinous purple alien.

So with all of these awesome ships to choose from, how's the core game play? Very good. Destroy enemies to fill your hyper gauge, and when it's full, release your hyper attack. If you can get your score multiplier all the way to 10 and then use your hyper, your ship will enter into Overdrive and release a potent barrage of attacks. There's a subtle sense of strategy involved with knowing when to use your hyper which adds an extra level of skill to the game.

SGS: EX provides an arcade/story mode replete with auto-saves and checkpoints. Feel like that's too easy? Set the game to max difficulty and turn off the health items and checkpoints. The ability to cater to all skills levels was a nice touch. Aside from arcade, there's also Endless mode where I spent two hours the night I downloaded playing as every character. You know what felt good? SSS ranking one of my sessions. The Endless mode alone is worth this purchase.

Buy this. The pixel art is great, the music is fantastic, and it's a very competent shooter. If there was an issue I had with it, I would say that the screen can become a little too cluttered with your bullets, enemy bullets, and hyper tokens. Especially with the final boss. Hot damn, that was rough. But the feeling of satisfaction upon beating this game felt so good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121255267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1550263671}
review: This is one of the best games I've played in a really long time. The music is awesome and so are the visuals. The only downside I see is that it doesn't seem like there are too many updates being done to the game and it isn't done yet. I spoke with the developers at PAX South 2016 and they said it'd be done by February 2016 but it is still missing stuff which is weird. That doesn't make the game any less good though. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that like shootem ups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129941326', 'num_games_owned': 3758, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1664199536}
review:
[h1] 플레이소감[/h1]

뉴타입들이나 하게된 탄막슈팅게임중에선 입문용으로 할만한 게임
도돈파치같은 느낌으로 플레이 할 수 있지만 난이도를 확 낮춘 느낌
기수제가 아닌 헬스제에 체력회복 아이템도 잘 나와서 난이도는 상당히 하락했다.

피탄범위가 심할정도로 작아서 노리고 피한다기보다 이동하다보니 피해지는 경우가 많다.
기체 중앙의 코어처럼 보이는게 피탄범위라고 생각된다.

각 기체의 스펙은 3종으로 파워, 내구력, 이동력으로 나뉘어져있다.
캐릭터는 많지만 밸런스는 그다지 좋은편은 아니다.
고내구 저속도 캐릭터가 대체로 사용하기 편하다.
특히 Amber의 경우는 혼자 다른 난이도에서 플레이 하는 기분이 든다.

피탄범위가 적고 피탄시 무적시간이 없어서  캐릭터 스피드가 빠르면 오히려 불리하다.
덕분에 Cyon은 난이도가 산으로 가버린 느낌

글자수 제한으로 개인적 기체평가는 가이드로 작성
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=701594828] 기체평가링크	[/url]


[h1] 장점[/h1]

+ 초심자에게도 상냥한 난이도(최종보스 제외)
+ 다양한 기체
+ 좋은 BGM, 반전의 엔딩곡
+ 클래식 버젼과 EX버젼은 다른느낌의 플레이가 가능


[h1] 단점[/h1]

- 기체간 밸런스가 좋지 않다.
- 무적시간이 없어 연속피탄 할 수 있다.
- 손이 저릴정도로 진동이 많다.


[h1] 총평[/h1]

[b]10/7.5[/b]

탄막슈팅형 게임치고 난이도가 낮은편이라 슈팅초보가 입문용으로 하기 좋은 게임이다. (캐주얼 모드 추천)
EX버젼과 클래식버젼은 비슷하지만 생각보다 게임성이 다른지라 2가지 슈팅을 하는 셈
문제점을 들자면 보스전 이외의 난이도가 너무 낮다.
그것 이전에 보스전도 최종보스 빼면 그다지 높지 않지만...낮아도 너무 낮은편이다.
탄막슈팅에 어느정도 경험이 있으면 쉽게 질릴 수 있다.
다수의 기체와 엔드레스 모드로 야리코미요소가 있긴 하지만...다른 게임에 손이 갈지도 모른다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119554518', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1465531757}
review:
スタンダードな縦スクロールＳＴＧ
１４種類もの自機を使えるのがウリだが、違いは火力・攻撃範囲・移動速度・ハイパー（ボム的な特殊攻撃）の弾消し性能の有無程度で性能が被り気味の機体も多く、ある機体が他大多数の機体を食ってしまうほど性能が高いという問題も
グラフィックは中々いい感じで自機の攻撃が程よく派手で多彩なので見ていて楽しい
敵配置は固定で小型機中型機がゾロゾロ出て来るが練り込み不足なのかどうにもメリハリが無いように感じる
BGMは総じて地味だがPVにも使われているタイトル曲はなかなかカッコいい、しかも何故か日本語ボーカル付きのバージョンまで入ってる力の入れよう
ボスに漢字の名前がついてたり、前述した日本語ボーカル曲が収録されてたり終盤のボス名があの弾幕ＳＴＧ真ボスのオマージュだったりやたら日本ネタが豊富だったりする
総合的に見てSTGが好きならセール中にでもと言ったところか、どうにも惜しいゲーム

author: {'steamid': '76561197981325824', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1664689568}
review:
I think I have enough time in this game to say it\'s awesome.

I\'ve loved shmups since I was little. Besides jrpgs, they were what I played when I was young, and I feel a lot of vertical shmups lately have lost the arcade feel. They\'re inventive and offer new things, but nothing\'s brought me back to nostalgiaville like SGS has. 

I originally backed this game when it was in the Kickstarter phase. In their video, they discussed wanting to make a shmup that brought the old-style feel into it. That\'s what sold me, and they delivered.

The music is by my favorite local band, Random Encounter, which is an extreme added bonus. 

I would recommend this game to old and new shmup lovers, especially those that fell in love with vertical shmups like Fever SOS, Viper Phase 1, and Xevious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979939833', 'num_games_owned': 1582, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1562480640}
review:
The Good:
+Arcade style game: 
This means you can hop right in without needing a tutorial, lengthy explanation, back story, etc. It gives you a brief intro and off you go.

+Nice look/feel: 
The game plays really smoothly and looks great! I used to love these games in the arcade so playing it was nostalgic.

+Challenging: 
Games like this are always a bit challenging, so thats good.

The Bad:
-Volume Resets Itself: 
The volume, out of the box, is loud as hell. If you turn it down, close and then relaunch the game, the volume will reset to default. The slider will say its lower, but you'll need to tinker with it again to get it lower.

-Boring?:
I don't know, I found this boring. Maybe on the harder modes its more adreneline pumping, but the overall experience for me so far has been eh. 

-Music: 
The music isn't that great and just repeats the same song over and over again until you finish the level. Bosses have boss music, each map has a unique song, but all of them aren't that great/kinda annoying.

Overall: 5/10

If you're looking for a game with a amazing story, look else where. This game is straight to the point. Pick a ship that suits your taste, blasts things to hell while avoiding a screen full of lasers, bombs and plasma blasts. It supports both keyboard and gamepad and I really recommend using a gamepad if ya got one. Overall, its a pretty good time waster, but I honestly didn't find it that compelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201996886', 'num_games_owned': 1203, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1488915101}
review:
진짜 오랜만에 탄막슈팅게임류를 했는데 정말 재밌었다.

보통 슈팅게임하면 한번맞으면 폭☆발 하면서 죽어버리는데
우선 이 게임은 체력이라는 시스템이 있는 것 만으로 진입장벽을 확 낮춰줘서
나같은 탄막장애가 있는 사람들도 시작을 불편없이 할 수 있게 만들어줬다.

총 14가지의 개성있는 전투기들로 1942같은 전개로 진행이되는데
각 전투기마다 주무기, 보조무기, 하이퍼무기의 세가지 탄막을 들고 시작한다.
하이퍼는 적을 맞출때마다 게이지가 상승되어서 일종의 스킬처럼 발동되는 무기이며,
주무기는 일반적인 탄막, 보조무기는 레이저로 이루어져있고
이 두개는 오른쪽 상단에 각각 얼마정도 파워업되어있는지도 알 수 있게 표시된다.

특히 이 파워업이 정말 맘에들었던게 한대 맞았을때 확률적으로 파워업 아이템이 드롭되어서
적한테 맞았다는것에 대한 어느정도의 보상이 되기도 하고 어렵사리 적들을 죽이는것만으로
풀업상태로 게임을 할 수 있는게 아니었다는것이 정말 만족스러웠다.

마지막으로 이 게임의 메인디쉬라 할 수 있는 오버드라이브모드가 있는데
왼쪽상단의 콤보가 x10에 도달하면 발동할 수 있으며 말그대로 존나짱쎄진다.
주무기고 보조무기고 발사속도나 그 파워가 어마무시해짐에따라 맵을 싸그리 정리할 수 있다.
물론 그에맞게 점수또한 몇배이상을 얻을 수 있으므로 지속적인 콤보누적을 목표로 하자.

레트로풍 분위기를 잘 살리면서 동시에 인터페이스가 유저특화되어있어
한눈에 게임플레이와 HUD를 볼 수있는 것또한 추가점수를 줄 수 있다.

화려한 탄막장악과 그에걸맞는 웅장한 OST까지,
슈팅게임은 하고싶은데 난이도가 높아서 못하겠다 싶은분들에게 꼭 추천해주고싶다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990897377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1460683181}
review:
NO! why the f*ck did you fucked that game ?
there is some of the most stupid design decision that any shmup lover will hate to the bone.

1. when you get hit you have a stupidly short invulnerability window. 
  you do not clear the screen, neither so you can be 'one shot' into a dense pattern (wtf)

2. where is the hitbox ?!  because there is no clear indicator good luck to see it

3. ffs the color of the bullets ?!!? ORANGE OVER ORANGE ?!!? are you *kidding* me ?  it's so much of a pain to see anything... use PINK like 99% of the ppl out there! there is a good reason why the hell it's pink ! 

4. 'hyper' the hyper is weak and for some vessel there is a freaking delay a la 'raiden' but it's not raiden either...

5. weak patterns . it's the same over and over 

beside that ? 

I loved the pixel art , there was some good idea but it's too bad it's just another bad 'shmup' that will be forgotten...
with CAVE starting to publish on steam there is no more excuse to indulge the weak shmups!

it's too bad because it's just some tiny details... I'm pretty sure it can be fixed in one week ! until then ... 
go play crimzon clover , mushihesama or deathsmiles ...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990695056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1590990833}
review:
This is a VERY worthy addition to any devoted shmupper's library, as well as a good introduction for players new to the genre, as SGS EX has a casual mode to ease them into the action.  

The original SGS (which is also included, as "Classic" when launching) was a blast to play, but the fantastic EX revamp has made it sweeter in every way.  

It's gorgeous, hard-nailed space combat with sweet tunes while bringing Ceti dooms!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071510906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1460559554}
review:
Un Shoot 'Em Up decente y entretenido que se queda a las puertas de ser algo mas.

Super Galaxy Squadron Ex es un juego del genero 'Bullet Hell' el cual en los ultimos años se ha puesto de moda y por ello se pueden encontrar muchos juegos clonicos los cuales no aportan demasiado.

Por suerte este juego tiene ese algo, que lo hace unico, no es el mejor juego de este genero ni mucho menos, pero personalmente me ha divertido durante mis sesiones de juego y no me ha parecido para nada uno mas del monton.

[u]Historia[/u]: Aunque parezca mentira, si, tiene historia, y sintiendolo mucho me salte todas las escenas que se muestran al empezar/finalizar las misiones, aunque personalmente no crea que sea necesario en este tipo de juegos darle demasiado peso a este apartado, lo poco que llegue a ver parecia bastante trabajado y si como a mi no te interesa siempre puedes saltarlo comodamente presionando un boton.

[u]Graficos/Arte[/u]: Tengo que admitir que este apartado esta bastante bien realizado en enemigos, balas, y la interfaz, aunque si que me faltaria un mayor detalle en el mapeado, siendo bastante monotono en general (a excepcion de la ultima mision en la cual mejora un poco)

[u]Musica/Sonidos[/u]: Siendo un apartado que suelo valorar bastante en este tipo de juegos cumple bien en cantidad/calidad de sonidos pero se queda un poco flojo en la musica, la cual no destaca ni para bien ni para mal (a excepcion de la ultima mision, en la cual al igual que el arte mejora un poco).

[u]Controles[/u]: El juego se luce en este apartado 10/10 al menos con mando de xbox one, el movimiento es muy fluido y permite navegar entre las balas de manera que no he sentido en casi ningun otro.

[u]Jugabilidad[/u]: Manejas una nave (de las 14 posibles) y tu trabajo es matar una oleada tras otra de enemigos hasta que llegas al jefe de cada fase los cuales son bastante diferentes entre si,

Como se ha dicho antes se te dara la eleccion de elegir entre 14 naves con las que demostrar de lo que estas hecho, cada una de ellas es totalmente diferente en estilo, forma de las balas, forma de jugar, esto le da bastante rejugabilidad, ademas en la pantalla de seleccion se dara informacion de su daño/armadura/velocidad.

Al iniciciar la partida empezaras solo con las armas principales de la nave pero matando a enemigos iran soltando mejoras con la que podras llegar a nivel 5 del arma primaria y secundaria todo ello sin parar el ritmo frenetico del juego, otra cosa a destacar es que las 'bombas' o 'comodines' como yo los llamo tipicos de este genero que hacen un gran daño a todo lo que esta en pantalla (incluso las balas desaparecen) y te hace inmune durante un periodo de tiempo, en este juego es el llamado modo overdrive, que consta de 1 unica carga que se ira llenando segun consigamos unos objetos azules que sueltan los enemigos al morir, muy necesario para sobrevivir a algunos ataques.

El juego te presenta 2 modos de juego:
         
Arcade: Comunmente llamado 'modo historia' el cual te presenta 6 misiones que se deben cumplir secuencialmente,           en cada una de ellas al final se presentara el jefe de cada fase. El modo historia te da ha elegir entre 3 dificulltades posibles.

Endless: Lucha de manera continua contra oleadas y oleadas de enemigos, que aumentan de manera progresiva y que te llevan al limite.

[u]Dificultad[/u]: La curva de dificultad esta bien aunque si que tengo que decir que me ha molestado un poco la pequeña diferencia que existe entre los 3 modos que te dan ha elegir, no se me entienda mal, la diferencia es significativa, pero comparando con otros juegos parecidos en los cuales puedes pasarte el juego en facil llendo un poco sobrado, poner el juego en normal y no llegar al jefe de la segunda mision. Destacar tambien que puede que la dificultad en este juego varie demasiado entre fase de llegar al jefe (se me antoja un poco facil, monotona) y el propio jefe el cual si que puede llegar a ser un reto.

En definitiva recomiendo este juego, aunque por 10$ quiza existan mejores opciones actualmente, si el precio disminuye o el juego mejora (al parecer los desarrolladores siguen actualizandolo gratis)  es un compra obligatoria para cualquier amante del genero o los que se quieran introducir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043282817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1459111052}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron EX embrasse pleinement cet héritage et respecte la plupart des traditions du danmaku, ses diverses inspirations fièrement mises en avant.  Cela va de son look retro au cœur de son gameplay en passant par ses musiques ; on retrouve dans le jeu de Psyche Studios et New Blood les sensations des shoot’em up ayant faits les beaux jours de l’arcade et des consoles des ères 16 et 32 bits.  Pad en main (ou au clavier si vous préférez, mais sachez tout de même qu’il n’y a aucun moyen de reconfigurer les contrôles), la belle musique de Random Encounter à fond, on est au plus proche de ce à quoi un voyage dans le temps pourrait ressembler de nos jours. SGS EX respecte tous les codes du genre : à bord de votre vaisseau spatial (14 vaisseaux aux armes et statistiques plus ou moins différentes sont jouables), vous devez avancer au fil de niveaux de plus en plus durs, essayant tant bien que mal de survivre aux vagues d’ennemis remplissant l’écran d’une infinité de « bullets  » mortelles. 

Super Galaxy Squadron EX est un jeu apportant un fun immédiat et sans fin, pour peu que vous accrochiez au genre qu’est le danmaku. Accessible à tous, il permet de faire passer un bon moment aux néophytes du genre à la recherche de quelques heures d’explosions et de shoot comme aux fans à la recherche de challenge nécessitant réflexes et beaucoup de pratique. Terminable en quelques heures, le jeu a cependant pas mal de replay value entre son mode endless et les différents vaisseaux, plusieurs styles de jeu clairement différents étant disponibles. Le tout est accompagné de graphismes rétro qui font du bien aux yeux et d’une excellente OST qui en fait d’autant aux oreilles (d’ailleurs disponible sur Bandcamp, Steam, Spotify ou peu importe là où vous aimez votre musique).

Test complet : [url]http://www.gamesidestory.com/2016/04/09/super-galaxy-squadron-ex/[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1458046234}
review:
I thought that Super Galaxy Squadron was a pretty decent little 2D shooter, but this edition is flat-out superb.

First off, apologies to the individuals responsible for this game's storyline. Everytime I played, I skipped all of the cut-scenes. All I know is that the bad guys have to be destroyed, and there's something involving a core. I'll be real here, I tend to prefer STG storylines that are badly-translated, don't make a lot of sense, or are just flat-out insane. Anyway, there are six stages and several ships to choose from, have at it.

The level of difficulty can "best" be described as bullethell...but not really. There are more tiny orbs of deadly danger than average, but rarely will you ever navigate a sea of bullets. Why? Because if the situation comes to that, then you did something very wrong, and you'll probably die soon. Enemy ships tend to stay on-screen a long time. This gives them more than a couple opportunities to unleash their payload. While it certainly benefits your livelihood to destroy enemies as quickly as possible, you might want to hold off occasionally...

The scoring system is based around a multiplier guage. Almost every type of ship is worth a +.1, and these add up very quickly. Sometimes you'll want to keep enemies alive for an extra half-second or so to help manage your guage. Upon hitting the maximum of x10(!), then you'll want to use your hyper weapon. This will trigger overdrive aka FEVER mode, and all pick-ups are worth ten times their value. 

When it comes to making a good STG, dodging and shooting are the most important aspects. This is where the game really shines. Everything has a natural feel to it. When you're avoiding bullets, you acquire this 6th sense, and sink into a sense of sublimity. To put it another way, I like this game because I [i]don't[/i] notice anything that stands out. To me, 2D shooters should be business as usual. Things that stand out tend to be bad, like erratically-moving bullets, weird/poor hit-boxes, and so on. There's none of that nonsense in this game.

The overdrive/fever system is really neat, but unfortunately it doesn't come into play very often. I suppose this should be blamed on my lack of skill, but I can only catch the FEVER maybe once or twice a play-through. At around the 7x to 9x mark, the multiplier guage can drop at an extremely fast rate, and I just can't seem to destroy enemies quickly enough. While this is going on, some potential moments for huge points are missed out on. For example, there are nearly-invisible rings at certain points in the game. If you fly your ship inside them and fire away, you'll discover a medal worth 500,000 points. Imagine grabbing that shiny behemoth while under the effects of a FEVER. 

But let's consider the possibility that I'm wrong, and it's not actually my fault. The reason I and possibly others can't maximize our scoring potential is because the playable ships are a little too weak. I'm not asking for a huge buff, just 15-20% more damage for most ships, and possibly larger boosts for certain ships. I noticed that one of them uses a lot of close-range weaponry. For piloting such a high-risk piece of junk, I expect to do a ton of damage.

As good as Super Galaxy Squadron EX is, it still requires some refinements. The top-scores on the leaderboards can be attributed to the game sometimes not resetting the score when starting a new game. My 60+ million score at or near the top is the result of two play-throughs. The final boss is far more difficult than anything else in the game, and requires a lot of needle-threading. Some ships are just too fast to safely weave between everything, and other ships are too weak to destroy the boss in a reasonable amount of time. Then there are the minor issues like rumble and screen-shaking re-enabling itself everytime I start a new game.

I figure that this game is still being worked on, but even in its current state, I highly recommend it. This is one extremely solid STG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970323222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1630901735}
review: Very accessible. I enjoy shmups but the legendary brutality does make them sometimes very tedious and too frustrating to be fun. Here, shots knock powers off your ship, rather than instantly obliterating you -- so you feel like you have a fighting chance after making a few mistakes. It's still plenty tough so far, and of course, you can adjust difficulty higher or lower to taste. Quite cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001252754', 'num_games_owned': 2915, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1659779414}
review:
Όταν ξεκίνησα δεν μπορούσα να φανταστώ ότι θα παίξω τόσες ώρες τρώγοντας τεράστιο κόλλημα. Ο Nick Clinkscales ισχυρίζεται πως απευθύνεται σε “κανονικούς” παίκτες θέλοντας μάλλον να προσελκύσει εκείνους που έχουν πάρει κατάκαρδα την δυσκολία της εν λόγω κατηγορίας. Η αλήθεια είναι πως απευθύνεται σε όλους καθώς οι επιλογές δυσκολίας εμπίπτουν σε όλα τα επίπεδα εμπειρίας. Κάποιοι πιο παραδοσιακοί ίσως τσινίσουν με το πως ανακατεύει τα πολλά και διάφορα στοιχεία που δανείζεται όμως σίγουρα θα βρουν τις προκλήσεις που αναζητούν μανιωδώς, απλά λίγο διαφορετικά από την πεπατημένη κάτι που κρίνω ως θετικό.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198055981406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1456790026}
review:
This is a review for the EX version of Super Galaxy Squadron, unlike many of the reviews posted prior to Feb 18, 2016.  I have only played EX, and not the original version of the game.

I recommend this game, but with a few caveats.  First, the good:  The pixel art of the graphics is very well done.  Every ship, enemy, background, and attack looks good.  The music is amazing.  You could play this game just to listen to the music and it would probably be worth it.  There are 14 ships to choose from, and that is a huge plus.  Each has its own pilot with a couple-sentence long story that adds some flavor to the game.  I appreciated this touch.  The Endless mode is another plus for this game; it makes a fun little diversion when you are low on time but really want to just shoot stuff up.

Now, for the negative...backgrounds and enemies do get repetitive.  Many levels have the same enemies and while each level has a unique background, some have no transitions and those that do have only 1 or 2.  This can make the levels, especially the first 4 or so, kind of boring and repetitive.  If you play on Hell difficulty you may not notice the lack of variety so much, but you will definitely get used to the same enemies and attack patterns.  Speaking of attack patterns, this game bills itself as not really a bullet hell, and that is mostly true on the stages.  There are alot of patterns that aren't necessarily dense but require fast dodging, kind of like what might be seen in a Raiden game.  Then, on the bosses, there are some patterns similar to those "fast dodging" games, but also other patterns straight outta Touhou.  This game definitely treads on bullet hell territory on the bosses, which makes for a somewhat jarring experience.  Another issue I had in terms of difficulty, is the second attack pattern on the next to last boss on Veteran and Hell difficulties.  I got to the final stage and first boss pretty easily on veteran, but I cannot fathom how to dodge this pattern.  It was like all of a sudden the game jumped in difficulty tremendously.  I am fine with hard games, especially in a shmup but the very sudden spike really frustrates me (I still can't beat this boss).  I figured I would try the game on Hell for a different kind of challenge....and I still reached the boss, granted, not as quickly as on Veteran, but I didn't have any major troubles either.  Even on Hell, the difficulty spikes so high on that second attack pattern.  To make this even more frustrating, the official video on youtube for this game which demonstrates the sixth stage is actually missing this attack pattern for some reason, which really confuses me.  On novice, it can be cleared fairly easily, so I was at least able to see the ending.  And speaking of the ending...it had no cutscene, a super short conclusion, and no voiced content (whereas stage transitions did have these), so it felt very anticlimatic.  It really feels like the very end game needs a little more work.

Overall this game is worth the money, just don't be expecting a masterpiece.  Do expect a great soundtrack and good times to be had playing 14 different ships!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017480183', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1553829981}
review:
Great! I bought this game around when it was realeased (don't remember when). I really loved it then. When I heard it was going into beta to make it better, I thought it was cool that the devs wanted to make the game more than it was already. I played everything time there was an update.

Just finished the game in its whole glory. New voice overs (was a suprise for me!), a story, new boss paterns, more difficulty and of course the song at the end ;) . The dev put effort in this game because they like it and it shows. Well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037166965', 'num_games_owned': 1508, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1456331217}
review:
[h1] [url=http://contranetwork.it/super-galaxy-squadron-ex-recensione-pc] Recensione Completa sul Sito Ufficiale [/url][/h1] 

Super Galaxy Squadron EX è uno sparattutto arcade molto veloce e dinamico progettato per i veterani degli “Shoot ‘em up” . Caratterizzato da una grossa difficoltà proprio come i giochi di una volta!
https://youtu.be/DgXfM_HuCH8

Il gioco è un espansione/remaster di Super Galaxy Squadron uscito lo scorso anno, in questa nuova edizione oltre alla grafica ci sono nuove caratteristiche, ovvero:

– 14 Navi con abilità differenti!

– Nella modalità Arcade troviamo: 6 Livelli con enormi Boss

– Aggiunte nuove difficoltà!

– Nuove meccaniche come l’Overdrive che permette di uccidere più nemici contemporaneamente per ottenere maggior punti

– Miglioramento grafico


Super Galaxy Squadron EX comprende anche l’originale Super Galaxy Squadron, quindi al prezzo di uno si ottengono ben due giochi!
Grazie alle nuove modalità di difficoltà Super Galaxy Squadron EX risulta più accessibile, soprattutto per i novelli del genere, si possono scegliere ben 14 personaggi, ognuno con abilità e caratteristiche differenti, e in ogni livelli prima di iniziare è possibile cambiare navicella, il tutto rende il gioco più immediato in quanto non bisogna uscire dal gioco per cambiare personaggio!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960340216', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1555621839}
review:
Accessible et magnifique dans son style, c'est le meilleur shmup que je connaisse sur Steam. Musique génial, rythme de fou et truc de dingue: vous pouvez gagner! J'aime beaucoup ce genre de jeu mais traditionnellement, ils sont trop difficiles pour moi mais pas celui-là, de toute façon, si vous êtes un pro-gamer, vous avez le mode Hardcore.

Petit prix et 14 vaisseaux différents (Donc grosse "rejouabilité"), si vous aimez ce genre, il n'y a pas de raison d'hésiter.

A recommander 1000 fois.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016432675', 'num_games_owned': 1503, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1456099160}
review:
[I] This key was obtained from evolve.pr for the purposes of review. [/i]

[b] Target Audience: [/b] [I] Action oriented fans that want twitch reactionary gameplay...even if you're not a veteran of the SHMUP genre.[/i]

[b]Video Review: [/b]  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-GT56CIRT-c
 
[u] Summary: [/u]
Not only is Super Galaxy Squadron EX pretty solid across the board, it's one of best “remasterings” for an indie game that I've seen. The game has been turned up to 11, as the game is not only pretty to look at, but it has ramped up the enemies and challenge in several ways. The developer obviously took feedback from the original game, as UI changes makes things a lot easier to see, and it complements the strong action gameplay that has the controls necessary to get through the tight spaces in between bullet barrages. There's a lot of ship variety as well, although the number of bullet patterns do leave a bit to be desired. And the game, while it was in Early Access, seems to still have a mode that's “coming soon”, which offput me a tiny bit. But never the less, A great shmup for the price of admission here, and can not only help satisfy the SHMUP veteran, but is a good introductory game for those who want to try the genre out for the first time. All in All, a worthy purchase.


[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]+:[/b]
[list]
[*] Good basic SHMUP action. Throws everything and the kitchen sink at you, and when things get nuts, things get nuts.
[*] Controls are where they need to be. Gives you the precision to get through the onslaught of bullets that you need, without being overly sensitive. 
[*] Great presentation and aesthetic. The story presentation does the scifi theme well, but the color choices for bullets/ships was smartly put together. It's easy to see everything on the field, and it's clear that the developers understood how to complement game design with aesthetic. 
[*] Good accessibility for new players of the genre, but gives the challenge for SHMUP veterans as well.
[*] A good variety of ships. A lot of different strategies are viable because of the variety here, from close up in your face “melee” type damage to turtling damage and focusing on hitting powerful enemies. Some may feel similar in the end, but there is a level of detail that does separate the similar ships from each other.
[*] Like the weapon powerups system and how getting hit makes you drop a couple of them. Forces quick decision making as being bombarded with bullets could lead you to abandoning the power ups because of the additional damage and power ups that you'd lose. 
[*] A good example of a remastering: changing some slight mechanics in game play, upping the graphics 
[*] Decent soundtrack. Complements the scifi and gameplay rather well.
[/list]

[b]-:[/b]
[list]
[*] Lacking some basic options. A music slider? That seems like a standard  now a days, and no bindable keys as well. Disappointing.
[*] Could actually use a bit more variety in the bullet patterns area. Within the first few levels, it's thrown pretty much all the different patterns at you, it just throws MORE at you.
[*] Despite coming out of early access, there's still a mode that seems to be unfinished. This is a personal gripe: if you're part of early access, I expect a completed product if you're going to come out of it.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198152753160', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1508513655}
review: One of the best Shoot em Ups here! Great art style, explosions, upgrade system, animations, interesting story and freeking ENDLESS mode! Would love to see some lan coop endless mode but I can live with destroying aliens solo.. Great work and be sure that even the 10 bucks are worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009234218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1527157529}
review:
Very awesome game and a must have for any bullet hell fan. 
A vast variety of ships to choose from fitting every play style. As a bullet hell player for many years I would say that this game ranks from hard to very challenging. Even the casual/easy mode becomes difficult by the end. 
Nice options of autosave/resume after stages and Endless Mode is fun and endless. 
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970573281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1577869771}
review:
ざーんきーがぁ　すくなぁーい・・・

「MSX2やPCEからスプライトリミットを取り払って、作り手にヤンチャさせたらたらどうなるか？」という按配の、ゲージボムあり弾幕シューティングです。
中型機が基本スクロールダウンするだけで、「そーいや昔はBGで描いてたから動かせないんだよね・・・」などと回想してしまう地味さが人によっては気になるでしょう。
バランス的にはくせ弾が少なく弾速もまったりで、特に耐力制のノーマルは私の様な枯れ果てた反射神経の持ち主でも楽しくプレイできます。
じゃあヌル過ぎるのかと言えばそうは問屋がおろさない。理由は被弾＝パワーアップの脱落と、連続被弾アリの複合ワザに由来します。
基本的にパワーアップが潤沢なゲームではないし敵も硬めなので、できれば脱落したパーツを回収したい訳です。
しかし、弾幕のなかでアイテムも追いかけ連続被弾し、素っ裸にむかれるところまでがお約束。
アイテムは割と直ぐに消えてしまうし、脱落から暫くは回収不可なので本当に悩ましい。
とはいえこの仕様が過剰なストレス源になるようなバランス調整でもないので、軽くスカッとSTGがしたい向きにお勧めです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198221484468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1455988692}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron si pone come un "bullet hell" ma, nonostante l'etichetta, risulta molto accessibile anche per coloro che non hanno mai provato un titolo del genere. Ci sono evidenti influenze da giochi simili come Dodonpachi o Radiant Silvergun ma questo è un gioco molto più semplice.

A disposizione una vastissima gamma di navicelle che promettono dunque un fattore rigiocabilità altissimo. Ogni navicella ha caratteristiche differenti, queste differiscono per armi primarie e secondarie, agilità, potenza e frequenza di fuoco. Tuttavia, le navicelle sono troppe e coesistono purtroppo navicelle troppo avvantaggiate e navicelle orribili per masochisti. I livelli sono un po' piatti ma tutto sommato è quello che ci si può aspettare da un gioco simile. La tanica di energia è una ottima feature per quei giocatori che si vogliono cimentare con un Bullet hell in quanto, in questi giochi, i novellini sono soliti a farsi travolgere facilmente dai proiettili in arrivo. Questa tanica di energia, a sua volta, si riempirà ogni qual volta si sfiora un proiettile nemico (nonché raccogliendo gli appositi power up) perciò, quando si sta per essere travolti dai proiettili, è meglio restare sulla linea del fuoco e farsi strada attraverso i cunicoli fra un proiettile e l'altro. Questo gioco si può prestare benissimo come esercizio per i giochi più difficili come Dodonpachi o Mushihimesama o la stessa modalità Hardcore che ripropone lo stesso identico gioco solo senza questa feature: one hit kill. Interessante e divertentissima la modalità infinita che può essere giocata con o senza barra della vita e dunque in modalità normale o hardcore. 

Tutto sommato questo gioco è un sacco divertente, il gameplay è solidissimo e non è per niente frustrante... a meno che non vogliate giocare con la modalità hardcore! Unica pecca è solamente la mancanza di checkpoint; il gioco è tuttavia molto equilibrato ma il boss del livello 6 richiederà qualche tentativo in più ed è abbastanza frustrante dover riaffrontare tutto il livello solo per poter riavere una chance. Super Galaxy Squadron offre una difficoltà solida che può mettere in difficoltà anche coloro che hanno una buona esperienza con gli shmup ma forse non abbastanza per coloro che riescono a completare Radiant Silvergun senza perdere neanche una vita o vivono la loro vita completando shmup di continuo entrando in loop nello stesso gioco almeno 45 volte. Dateci una chance... e se lo comprate buona fortuna per lo stage finale! 

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197979382471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1489257157}
review:
HOLY CRAP this one caught me off guard! It’s amazingly fun with really well done pixel art, tight controls and good feedback. This is one of the few I didn’t want to stop playing. Lots of ships right off the bat with a ton of variety in shots and hyper modes (rechargeable single bombs)

It’s extremely fun, well done and I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033802030', 'num_games_owned': 2082, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1445872515}
review:
Summary: Vertical bullet hell with lots of ships
Multiplayer: No
Completion: 1 hr
Cards: Yes
Cloud:  No

Super Galaxy Squadron is a very standard vertical bullet hell shoot 'em up.  It won't win any awards for its concept, but it does offer a surprising number of unique ships that play somewhat differently from each other. The result is a rather replayable shooter, if only to test the functions of each ship, which I found enjoyable. 

Gameplay is a standard shmup. Shoot anything that moves, avoid bullets, grab items. The items dropped by enemies are mostly random; it is thus possible to have a bunch of missiles before you ever get a laser upgrade. The game lacks a "focus" mode, where you can slow down your ship to maneuver tight spaces. Thus I found faster ships, which often have less armor, work against me.

There are 14 ships to choose from in this game. Surprisingly most ships have a good balance about them, though a few stood out as being much better or much worse than the others. The majority of my time spent on this game was comparing each and every ship by fully upgrading them, and finding out which ones I liked best. Every ship possesses a unique "limit break" of sorts. As you grab points, your bar fills up and you can unleash a powerful attack or defensive ability that is based on your current ship. These occur often enough that your ship's special power is worth taking into consideration, especially on endless mode.

There's a rudimentary plot about a cold war between humans and aliens, and every ship has a bit of backstory, which is cool. Beyond that, the game largely throws story out the window, much like the entire genre does, which is a shame because it seemed like a promising story.

Unlike most bullet hells, SGS has a health system that allows you to withstand more than one hit. On top of that, enemies occasionally drop health items to replenish your life. You can even heal yourself by getting grazed by enemy bullets. Also surprising, the invulnerability period after getting hit is relatively generous. It's a refreshing system that provides some amount of tanking ability, and is thus friendlier to new players to the genre. When you get hit, your ship will drop one of its power-ups, but it's easily reacquired by simply flying over it and grabbing it again. Hardcore mode exists for those who prefer the one-hit death style of gameplay. There seems to be no additional reward for playing on hardcore.

Most of the game is easy enough. There's six stages in total, each one lasting maybe 3-5 minutes. If you die, the game generously lets you continue on the last stage you were on. The bosses are great, being hulking machines (mostly) with collapsible parts, wide bullet patterns and just as large health pools. The last boss is such a large leap in difficulty that I'm not sure I could ever beat it with certain ship designs. It's a long enough battle that it might as well be considered a stage in of itself.

Graphics are good. It's entirely pixel-art, and well-animated, particularly explosions. I like that every upgrade you acquire is a noticeable improvement, typically giving you additional shots, and sometimes even a graphical change. I have not experienced any slowdown despite the large number of moving things, even on endless, so that gets good marks. Music is chip-tunish, and somewhat upbeat but also kind of on the forgettable side.

I recommend playing the game with a gamepad, though keyboard actually works well enough. The game did not recognize my USB gamepad; if the same occurs to you I recommend Joy2Key which often solves this problem on similar games.

While I wouldn't recommend it at full price, it's not bad at a discount. All proceeds go to the Child's Play charity, so even if you don't enjoy the game, someone else may benefit. For the game to be created by largely one person, this is a pretty commenable effort. I give Super Galaxy Squadron a 7/10. It's super short, but because of that, you can replay it in short bursts with many different ships, so it works out in the end. SGS satisfies that urge to just jump into a game and start shooting stuff without rhyme or reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047713531', 'num_games_owned': 2085, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1455875789}
review:
你可知道3D龙事件？由于强烈而且频繁的红蓝交替的闪光，导致观众观看后出现眼花、头疼及恶心的症状，严重者甚至暂时失明、抽搐和晕倒的症状。
这货有着同样的强烈高频闪烁，而且来源主要是自机子弹，所以游戏时请保持房间明亮，并注意休息缓解疲劳。
==========================================
优点
+传统STG 系统简单
+船只众多 不同船性能各异
+画面细腻 别看是像素画风 但细节丰富
+++生命值设定 沙包救星 再手残也不会三秒挂
缺点
---高频闪烁 瞎狗眼啦
-BGM数量过少 虽然好听但是实在太少了

author: {'steamid': '76561198036591318', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1709952742}
review:
The video and the devs are lying! Make no mistake - this is most DEFINITELY a bullet hell shmup! I don't know where they get their idea of what constitutes a bullet hell shooter, but apparently they also must not regard bovines which give milk and meat to be cows... This game IS a bullet hell swarmer and it IS impossible once you get to the end of Stage 6 (unless the other half of the ships are somehow more capable).

This game can be summed up as: DoDonPachi + Raiden Fighters Jet + Battle Garegga + Air Gallet + Sonic Wings (Aero Fighters).

DoDonPachi for the insane bullet swarms & small hitbox
Raiden Fighters Jet for the number of unique ships and token collection
Battle Garegga for the almost constant stream of tiny token pickups
Air Gallet for the LOSING A POWERUP WHENEVER YOU GET HIT
Sonic Wings for starting you ALL THE WAY AT THE BEGINNING OF THE STAGE WHEN YOU DIE

author: {'steamid': '76561198003702727', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1443551809}
review:
Un "vertical shooter" del tipo "bullet hell" (vamos, una nave que va desplazándose verticalmente y matando todo bicho viviente mientras le llueven tropecientas balas) de lo más tradicional (lo que los culturetas llaman "de la vieja escuela"). Y en este caso lo de tradicional no es gratuito porque todo en este juego tiene un corte clásico: música, gráficos, animaciones e incluso controles (arriba, abajo, izquierda, derecha, disparo y arma especial).

De hecho, es precisamente ahí, en su enfoque tan conservador, en donde radica su virtud y su defecto. En un mundo en donde los juegos parecen abrazar una complejidad que tiende hacia el infinito, con inteligencias artificiales refinadas, mundos abiertos de inmensidad mayúscula y un grafismo que ya compite con el realismo que podamos ver en las películas, este juego busca no complicarle la vida al jugador. Mata, mata y vuelve a matar. No hay más. Una simplicidad que bien parece aspirar a ser relajante.

Pero, por otro lado, también ahí residen sus limitaciones. Gráficos de 16 bits (o, mejor dicho, de la gama baja de los 16 bits), música con sonido a lata y animaciones poco refinadas hacen de este juego un producto que bien podría haber sido traído por la tía de la lejía de los anuncios de TV aunque, lejos de venir del futuro, lo haría desde el pasado.

Si lo consigues por cuatro duros es una buena inversión. Eso sí, es necesario superar la cota de los treinta años. Si no se dan esas dos condiciones, no lo pilles. Te resultará extraño y pensarás que has tirado tu dinero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006377511', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1549232418}
review:
While I had really fun playing this one I can't recommend it. The game has some parts which can make it very challenging like the hardcore mode and endless mode, which is great. The scoring in normal mode is totally deifferent. It seems to reward bad play over good play leaving veterans and scorechaser fallen apart or losing their ability do dodge right. There is one achievement, where you have to get hit multiple times get a high enough score by taking your fallen powerups. For me this just didn't feel right.


The powerup system is a nice idea though. You can upgrade your main shot up 8 times your firerate 5 times and your secondary weapon 7 times. The ships felt quite balanced. There are enough ships for everyone's playstyle. 
If your health reaches zero your ship explodes and the stage starts again.

But as stated in the first half of my review the game doesn't seem to reach the requirement for me to recommend it to other bullethell fan unless you want to try the hardcore mode which gonna kill you at the stage bosses. 

The artstyle is o.k. for me. Nothing special. The stage bosses have highlighted parts when struck and are destructable. The patterns itself are mostly very easy to get through except for the last level propably, which is another reason for me not recommend it. 

If you want to spend some money for a help programm you can still buy this game and have fun with it.

Overall the game is fun to play and has enough variety to play it from time to time, but for bullethellfans and veterans of shmups I can't recommend it since there are other titles you gonna buy earlier before this one: e.g. Crimzon Clover, Exceed series, Siter Skain's games,Mushimesama etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032594853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1435686992}
review:
追記：ウィンドウモードにするにはAlt+Enterキーです

これは海外の人が作ったシューティングなんでしょうか？
Steamで買ったシューティングで一番おもしろい
というか今までやった中でもかなり上位に入る楽しさです

縦シューティング,それもハドソンのキャラバンシューティングを
やりこんだ人が作ったのかな？というカンジで
とてもバランスがよく,遊んでて単純に楽しいです
見た目すごそうな弾幕に見えますが
自機の判定がかなり小さく,たいてい誘導チョン避けで避けられるので
マクロスばりに避けられます
自分がうまくなった？とカンチガイするカンジｗ
（どの機体も中央にコアのような丸がありますが
おそらくアレがアタリ判定）

東方も似たような感じで,アタリ判定が小さい故に
異常な弾幕も避けれる楽しさがありますが
ちょうどあんな感じです
難易度ノーマルなら東方よりはずっとカンタンです
東方も「この作者はシューティング好きなんだろうな～」と
よくわかるデキですが
これもそんな感じを受けました

海外の方がこうも日本式縦シューを理解して作ってると
驚くと同時に,ちょっと寂しい気もしますね
2D縦シューでも海外に負けちゃうのか･･･と

このゲーム,自機がいっぱいあって選べるんですが
機体によって難易度にかなり差があります
火力のない機体だと敵を処理できずに
画面中ザコ敵でうまっちゃったりするので
火力（POW）の高い機体をおすすめします
縛りプレイ好きなら知りませんけどｗ
白玉フル装備のシルバーホークとソルバルウくらいの差があります

オススメはAmber
拡散弾+クラスター爆弾で接射火力が高いんですが
特殊攻撃が前方シールドのため
シールド張りつつ接射するとかなりの火力がでます
ラスボスに接射→ボスのオプションが破壊→ゲージ回復アイテムが出る
→再度シールドが張れるようになる！
この流れができちゃうので,クリアは一番カンタンです

ちなみにスコアランキングが一見無いように見えますが
ちゃんと記録されてます
Steam実績の欄を見るとそこに"グローバルランキング"とあるので
アーケードモードもエンドレスモードもそこで世界順位が見れます
1500万点以上でクリアする実績もあるので
チャレンジしてみてください

エンディングは驚愕のアニソンが聞けるので
ぜひクリアしていただきたいです
海外のシューティングとしてはかなり例外的で
BGMもSEもレベル高いです

曲はsteamapp→common→super galaxy squadronのフォルダに入ってます
ogg形式ですがプレーヤーによっては再生できると思います
VLCプレーヤーでは再生できました
曲の制作者Random encounter bandのホームページ
randomencounterband.com
でも聴けます＆ＤＬできます
最後のアニソンのタイトルは友情の銀河（Galaxy of Friendship）です
歌詞カードがどこ探してもないんですが
聴いたかぎりでは

♪宇宙でザコ爆弾　心のままに　
君は美しい　永遠に離さないで
一緒に戦おう　バーニングロード　ピース　アンド　ラブ
協力者と逃亡しない　スーパーギャラクシースカッドロン
言葉にできずに　ＧＯ！
ぼうれせなーい（暴れさせない？）
For light. We will fight. We need The star light!

１番はたぶんこんな歌詞ｗ

author: {'steamid': '76561198128371609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1671779906}
review:
02/18/2016 EDIT: I came to be very surprised to see the huge EX update for this game, which added 3 difficulties + normal/hardcore selection, upgraded visuals, ship tweaks, and expanded features including voice acting for the story. Another big change is the update to the multiplier system, which only decreases your chain when the active chain meter hits 0 instead of flatout losing the entire thing. You can also go above x5 multiplier and keep chains more easily as it takes longer now before chaining becomes unforgiving in timing. Since there appears to be more of a legitimate scoring system with potential to carry it across entire stages, I can safely say that I would recommend this even at full price now.

This could be best described as a guilty pleasure SHMUP.  It is more laid back than a typical shmup due to the fact that you can't "lose" or "game over" in the arcade mode as you will simply restart the stage you died on with score intact if you die.  Normal uses health for your ship, while Hardcore is a one hit then restart the stage ordeal.  The local scores saved don't differentiate Normal and Hardcore, so there's no particular reason to try Hardcore unless you want a challenge.

It is fun to take all of the ships for a spin and see what they are capable of, but there isn't too much really keeping people on here for an extended period of time after that.  Endless Normal is the most fun in the long run because you'll compete with others on the steam leaderboard there and it just becomes funny to see how ridiculously stacked the odds become against you once you live longer than 15 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053102631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1488916395}
review:
This game has been updated and re-released several times now, so rather than attempting to outline every subpar aspect of this game in an objective and constructive manner (again), I'm simply going to vent my frustrations by listing everything about this game that I personally find distasteful.

[list]
[*] Severe lack of invincibility frames after taking damage.
[*] Screen doesn't clear after taking damage, even projectiles right next to your ship are uninterrupted.
[*] Power-ups are lost when taking damage, wouldn't be a problem if they didn't spawn directly on top of the projectiles surrounding your ship.
[*] Entire player sprite flashes invisible multiple times for a duration of several seconds after taking damage, making the scramble to recover lost power-ups even more of a confusing mess.
[*] Scoring system is poorly implemented and doesn't complement the gameplay.
[*] Losing a life means restarting the level from the beginning.
[*] At least 95% of all attacks are aimed in some way.
[*] Boring stages that all play exactly the same.
[*] Said boring stages drag on for 10 minutes sometimes, repeating the same waves of enemies at staggered intervals.
[*] Visual clarity isn't that great; sometimes it's difficult to differentiate objects in the foreground from objects in the background.
[*] Colors used are all cold, matte colors. Sprites, backgrounds, bullets, everything. It's alright most of the time, but with too many sprites near each other on the wrong background things get a little mushy.
[*] Poorly designed bosses with generic attack patterns and too much HP.
[*] Final boss literally spams the same exact attack for several minutes, with only slight variations to dissuade the player from sitting in the most obvious safe spot I've ever seen. Some ships probably break this boss completely.
[*] Final boss will take at least 8 minutes or so, assuming you haven't lost any power-ups and are dealing damage efficiently.
[*] Power-ups affect the game to a ridiculous degree. If you get hit even once you will be underpowered and forced to leave half of the enemies untouched until the game decides to give you another one.
[*] Bombs do nothing other than deal damage.
[*] Too many ships with too many gimmicks, impossible to balance.
[*] Controls aren't rebindable.
[*] Shift is bound to pause.
[*] Analog movement.
[*] Digital movement with stick, d-pad or arrow keys is too sensitive for precise movement in certain situations.
[*] Input is oddly unresponsive and inconsistent. Sometimes the game just doesn't do what you tell it to, almost like the inputs are being queued and delayed at random somehow. This happens on every keyboard, gamepad and stick that I've tried, on multiple computers.
[*] No DirectInput support.
[*] No TATE mode.
[*] Music is lame.
[*] Said lame music gets re-used for multiple stages.
[*] Shoehorned story that couldn't be any less interesting.
[*] Cutscenes.
[*] Voice acting that manages to feel more forced and out of place than the cutscenes themselves.
[*] Much more that I'm forgetting.
[/list]

Since the game has improved overall after the couple big updates, I'll give the developers the benefit of the doubt and assume they actually care about the game they put out and weren't simply cheesing the system to get SGS listed under the new releases tab several times over a 2-3 year span. Either way, shoot-em-ups clearly aren't their strong suit and I absolutely do not recommend this game to anyone.

I'm sure this review will be buried soon enough, but I hope this was at least a little informative for any potential buyers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006395100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1489205072}
review:
Pretty much everything I loved about 90s arcade shoot'em ups is in this game... plus a tiny bit of bullet hell to top it off (which I'm also a fan of). Yes I know the trailer says "Not bullet hell", but just watch a video of the final boss and you'll get what I mean by "a tiny bit of bullet hell".

Keep in mind there's no control rebinding, so if you're someone who hates arrow keys, then you might need to take that into consideration. Personally I'd like to rebind the super to X, but it's no big deal. Arrow keys, Z, and spacebar is a sensible enough control scheme for me.

In any case, I love the music, the graphical style, and the sound design. Plus I appreciate the selection of 14 ships each with its own set of stats and weapons.

The game is a lot more forgiving than most games of its type in that when you die you just restart the stage you're on, and if you quit the game you can actually come back and pick up from the start of the stage you were on. Also, your ship can take more than one hit (on normal mode). It can actually take quite a few hits, and enemies (and their missiles) can drop health when destroyed. 

When you get hit you'll drop one of your acquired firepower power ups, which after a couple of seconds will be available for you to pick up again. This actually adds an interesting dynamic, in that you probably want to pick up that power up, but you're probably going to have to weave through a shower of bullets to get to it... and if you get hit then you're just going to drop more power on top of taking more damage. Of course, none of this matters in hardcore mode because getting shot will just kill you then.

Honestly, I don't have a whole lot of cohesive thoughts to give about the game (as you can likely see above).  All I can say is that I really like it.

review:
STG初心者にもおすすめの弾幕STGゲーム。

ハードコアモードだと普通のSTGみたいに一発食らうとゲームオーバー
全6ステージ。エンドレスモードあり

敵を倒して落としたアイテムを集め続けるとゲージが溜まりボムが撃てる
バグでラスボス戦で撃破されるとエラーが起きてしまいコンティニューできなくなるので要注意！セーブデータ消すと一応修復できる
ボスの名前にいちいち日本語が表記されてるあたり某弾幕STGを意識していると思いますｗ
