author: {'steamid': '76561197972060127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1649521231}
review:
EDIT: Haven't played the new EX version yet, this review was based on the original.

Super Galaxy Squadron is a great little "flow" shmup: you fall into a pattern of sweeping the screen left to right and back, blowing stuff up and picking up power ups.  It's a _little_ repetitive and the enemy attack patterns/level design don't vary enough to seriously knock you out of your zone, but this serves to create a pleasant state of zen-like focus and flow while playing. (Note: I'm a long-time player of shmups, so your state of zen, boredom, or extreme panic may vary depending on your experience with the genre and taste for difficulty...)

There's a simple combo/multiplier system, but it doesn't force me play the game strategically because the level design and enemy waves don't seem distinct enough to make strategies for maintaining your combo apparent to me.

The key source of variety comes from strong collection of different kinds of ships.  I haven't had a chance to try them all yet, but each requires a slightly different play style to pilot successfully.  The ships seem to range from standard shmup tropes to more creative and unique attack types.  The different ships provide a good source of replay value, outside of leaderboard climbing.

Graphics and audio are excellent, couldn't ask for more from a retro-inspired shmup!

The game's normal mode is pretty forgiving (a shmup beginner might not think so), and hardcore is of course hardcore. (one hit you're dead)

All in all a pretty good, well executed shmup at a good price!  Veterans might not find much meat on the bone, but this would be a good start for beginners to learn the basic skills required for the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993984084', 'num_games_owned': 2968, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1519220366}
review:
After playing the updated Super Galaxy Squadron EX, I am changing my review to a positive.

The updated art and the little cutscenes between stages have brought this game a long way forward. A lot of my previous concerns like the music not looping cleanly appears to have been fixed as well. Same goes for the tweaked bosses, the overall difficulty of the game with the new difficulty settings, as well as the improved hardcore mode. The fact that it is a free major update is great of the developer to do as well. It's exactly what the game needed.

It has become an enjoyable game. Looking forward to checking out the new modes that are still on the way. I will get the sequel too whenever that comes out.


Old review for Super Galaxing Squadron classic:

Super Galaxy Squadron is not bad, but it's less than what I expected it to be.

Normal Mode is not a big challenge as it feels like the life bar lasts forever (I reached the stage 6 boss second form on the first try and cleared the game on the 2nd attempt), while in Hardcore mode from what I could tell if you get hit once you have to start the level over. I think my skill level is probably more at a middle ground between the two, but the game doesn't offer this.

The art is nice but I only noticed 1 enemy ship (pink one) which was actually animated. The music was decent but not very memorable. Only the title screen music and the stage 6 music stood out for me, although some of the music did not loop naturally.

The power up system wasn't fun for me. The power ups dropped by enemies don't fall down to you, they just kind of sit there and move a small amount before fading away. If you get hit you will also usually lose one of your powerups, which fly upwards and can't be picked up again for a couple of seconds. The tried and true hyper system is fine though and the ships do feel a bit different from each other, although I only tried a handful of them.

However, the worst part about the game is the bosses. The boss patterns are boring. Aside from the stage 5 and 6 bosses, the rest just repeat the one pattern over and over. The stage 6 boss was the best out of all, and although I did feel like I had seen the patterns before in other games, I liked it and wished the same attention had been given to the other bosses as well.

I found the most enjoyment in endless mode, since I was able to zone out and fly around shooting things and dodging bullets, without having to face any of the bosses.

In all, I would say that the game is worth a try. You may like it more than I did. But it's not something I can see myself coming back to or getting friends to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039572306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1507951974}
review:
Very bad! 5/10

As a shmup fan, I got teased by that trailer and it does not, even close, deliver the same experience which it presents. 

Pros:
- art styles
- music

Cons:
- Huge flaw: it does not support arcade sticks (mine is a mad catz TE2).

- Unbalanced difficulty (normal mode seems very easy mode by stage 3 and becomes hell on stage 4).

- Bosses are boring, a big box with no animation. Takes forever to be defeated.

- Lack of lives, you die in some point close to the end of stage, you restart at the beginning, even on normal mode. 

- By mid stage 3 you get hit by enemy and right away you get a heath item, you dont feel to be hit anytime actually, looks like you are invincible up to this point. And then, the screen gets horribly filled with enemy ships taking forever hits to be destroyed, just like the bosses, 

I wont play it again, Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124052050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1610095461}
review:
Данную игру можно порекомендовать тем, кто только начинает знакомство с подобным жанром (шмапы, буллетхеллы). Есть два уровня сложности: normal и hardcore. На normal'е у кораблика есть лайф бар, который можно восстанавливать, подбирая лечилки. На хардкоре у коробля всего 1хп (умираешь - начинаешь уровень заново). На выбор доступно много разных кораблей, которые отличаются по характеристикам и набору оружия (какой-то сильнее, какой-то быстрее, какой-то более сбалансирован и т д). Есть прокачка оружия, которая иногда выпадает из врагов. При этом если получить повреждение, прокачка понижается и из нашего корабля выпадает этот паверап. Таким образом прокачку можно мгновенно вернуть. Пули летят с нормальной скоростью и уклониться не составляет труда. Какие-либо серьезные проблемы могут доставить только боссы, да и то не все. Графически игра выглядит довольно стильно по меркам ретро, музыка хороша.
Итог: неплохая игра для начала ознакомления с жанром. Но тем, кто уже сыграл во множество игр подобного жанра, ее бы не стал рекомендовать, ибо тут нет ничего особо интересного или нового.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992098252', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1455942709}
review:
Overall a great little shmup game.  Most games in this genre devote very little effort to storytelling, and while I wouldn't exactly call SGS a story-heavy game, I found myself getting into the world/story far more than I do with typical shmups.  My favorite touch was the couple sentences of backstory provided for each of the 14 playable ships on the ship select screen; amazing how much depth that adds to the game's world.

The soundtrack, created by Random Encounter, is fantasic, though it would've benefited from a couple more tracks. (Finish the game for an extra special version of the title theme~)

The game plays very tight and is filled with beautfiul, crisp 16-bit sprites. The difficulty curve feels just about perfect although veteran shmup players will probably be bored for the first few stages.

This is a symptom of the one real problem I had with the game: the lack of a deep scoring system. Typically shmups feature some sort of complex scoring dynamic that calls for some specific strategy to maximize your scoring (for example the spectacular "Vaunt" scoring system in Jamestown); this gives higher skill players something to go for on easier stages where survival isn't really a concern. SGS sports a very simple combo system that rewards you for killing enemies in quick succession (before your combo meter resets).  Unfortunately, the player really has very little control over maintaining a combo due to the way the enemies spawn and ultimately most players will end up ignoring the combo meter entirely. Even something as simple as being able to slow down or freeze your combo meter by letting go of the fire button would make going for high scores much more interesting.

Despite the lack of scoring depth, I'd still highly recommend this to anyone remotely interested in a good arcadey experience.  This game's difficulty makes more accessible than the average shmup a is great bridge to more difficult games like Ikaruga and Gradius.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973238869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1920, 'last_played': 1493277182}
review:
First off, this game is dope as shit.  If you're not convinced by that statement alone, keep reading.

You start off, and it's like, "oh shit, some aliens are fucking up our planet!  What's going to happen to Earth?!"  I'll tell you what's going to happen, 14 of the best god damned pilots are going to fuck their shit up, and you're one of them!  Choose your ship, pop the cockpit, strap in, and get ready for mayhem, it's Super Galaxy Squadron!

"Where do I begin?"  You might be wondering.  Check those options, son.  You can toggle the rumble of the gamepad (if applicable), the shake of the screen whenever there's an explosion (which are awesomely frequent) and adjust the volume.  Check the controls if you need to, regardless you're reminded of them at the start of each mission incase the slaughter of thousands of angry aliens from Tau Ceti has melted your mind.  Scoreboards?  Yeah, check them in the options or on Steam.

Outside of the options, there's a button aptly labeled, "start."  Hit that and choose your mode.  Normal mode provides you with a health bar, and when that shit hits zero, you've added one last explosion into the mix, and start the level over.  Continues?  Plenty of them!  Want to stop playing and pick it back up later?  You sure as hell can!  Collect your power-ups for your main spread, secondary weapon, and a boost to your rate of fire.  Check the status of each by pausing, it'll tell you.  So you've noticed the, "Hyper," bar in the lower left?  Good.  That's your special weapon, and each ship has a different one.  Think Normal is too easy?  Shift into Hardcore and get blasted in the face!  One hit, you're done, son, back to the beginning of the level.  This time, you can't continue forever, so make it count!

"Endless mode?  What's that?"  It's exactly what you think it is, an endless wave of those ET fuckers coming for you, and only you, since their buddies were ripped apart on your last excursion in the twilight.  The lower right of the screen has a number, that's what wave you're on, and it caps out at 30 when shit gets downright bananas.  Survive as long as you can, rack up that score, and brag about it after seeing your name on the global leaderboards, if you're good enough that is.  Oh yeah, there's a hardcore mode for this shit, too.

"Can there be any more to this already amazing game?!"  Yes.  That music you hear?  That's done by the fantastic band, Random Encounter.  Check those guys out.

Are you prepared to battle the Ceti forces?  Do you want to rock out to some killer tracks while doing so?  Do you love shmups and explosions?  Check the store page and toss it in your cart.  All proceeds go to the Child's Play Charity as well,  so you can't really lose!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1422973586}
review:
SUPER GALAXY SQUADRON
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

Super Galaxy Squadron is one of the best retro Arcade Shoot’Em up games I have had the pleasure to play for quite a while. 

Lovers of retro games will be fond of this one and if you are of a certain age (like Yoda and me), you will experience a trip back to memory lane where all good games were setup like a booth with an old television set right in front of you, a stick on the left hand side of the panel with a fairly large red ball for a good and stable grip. And 2 buttons on the right side which were usually red and yellow. Too bad if you were right handed, impossible to play with your back facing the television set!

Coming back to the game, you can choose to play a new, endless or continue a game in normal or hardcore mode. Then, you have to make the tough decision as to which spaceship you are going to fight with. Fourteen to choose from; some have more power than others and so on and so forth. All spaceships have their own Hyper strike if you want to call it that, again some more effective than others.

After that it’s all about avoiding the onslaught of your enemies’ fire power like some sort of illusionist and at the same time destroying them with your powerful arsenal! I FUN FUN FUN! Mind you, the hardcore mode is fairly challenging.

In term of the controls, I find the gamepad the way to go rather than your keyboard. It is just my preference. 

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

-	Great Shoot’Em Up
-	Challenging
-	Achievements
-	Trading cards

Negative:
~~~~~~~ 

-	I feel older now

Good game.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995017726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1422695428}
review:
[h1]Quick Fixes[/h1]
- Please fix the shift pause menu situation, trying to respond to steam chat messages is impossible with the game constantly pausing unpausing

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
- You've done a really good job of making interesting stages
- Your art style is great for making the projectiles pop into the foreground
- The forgiving health / quicksaves is really nice on a first playthrough

[h1]First 4 Bosses[/h1]
- This is the weakest part of the game, there's not enough variety in the bullet patterns of the early bosses
- Players qucikly figure the pattern from there its feels like labor working though that gargantuan health bar while the boss sits there not moving
- You need make destroying health bar more exciting with explosions and the boss shaking violently or give them more variety of bullet patterns to switch iterate through

[h1]Finally[/h1]
- Solid sound track
- I loved the radio chatter between stages
- Overall: Very Positive

[b] Thank you for making this game! [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017475979', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1422308730}
review:
Super Galaxy Squadron è un indie che merita di essere acquistato non solo dagli sfegatati del genere nonché nostalgici dei vecchi tempi in cui regnavano i titoli ad 8-bit, ma anche dai neofiti che vogliono provare un'esperienza molto gradevole sebbene si tratti di un gioco realizzato in puro stile retrò. La presenza di elementi moderni rivoluziona leggermente la formula di gioco, rendendola valida anche per i più giovani. Il prezzo, oltretutto, è accessibile a tutti: 9,99€ per accaparrarsi questa piccola chicca che non può mancare assolutamente se siete amanti del retrogaming.

Recensione completa: [url=http://www.4news.it/21838-recensione-super-galaxy-squadron.html] Recensione Super Galaxy Squadron [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198051439281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1422159364}
review:
当たり判定の小ささと敵機との接触判定がないことで、プレイし易い難易度の弾幕ＳＴＧ
機体のバリエーションも豊富
敵機が他の弾幕ＳＴＧに比べて若干硬めで、攻撃を喰らうと自機がパワーダウンするシステムなので、回避よりも敵機の処理が重要になってくる
初期の攻撃力が低い機体は劣勢に回ると挽回しにくいので、常に攻めのプレイスタイルが必要
BGMは盛り上がりに欠けるけど、懐かしい雰囲気になる


EDはある意味衝撃的

author: {'steamid': '76561198037740951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1428157882}
review:
全6面の弾幕STG。
各ステージの長さは、道中3分、ボス2分ほど。
難易度はノーマルとハードコアの二つ。弾幕難易度は易しめ。
自機の当たり判定がかなり小さく、かつ敵機体とは衝突しない。

12色から選ぶ自機にはそれぞれ特徴があり、難易度やプレイスタイルが変化するので、意外と遊びの横幅は広い。

ボムはなく、敵を倒してゲージを溜めて自機固有のスペシャルショットを放つスタイル。
敵弾を消せるスペシャルショットを持つ自機も何種類かいるので、緊急回避的な運用も可能。

ライフ制で、被弾するとパワーアップアイテムを落としてしまう。
一度被弾しリカバリーに失敗すると、ずるずると敗北するハメに。

オススメの機体は、Vermilion。レーザー最強説。
次点で、AmberとCobalt。
クセはあるものの、慣れてくるとGreenやOrangeも面白い。

必聴！のエンディングも含め、ボス登場演出など、
制作者たちのリスペクトと愛が詰まった良いSTGだと思う。

エンドレスモードはスコアが保存されないので、自機の性能確認＆修行用と割り切ろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993869948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1490108404}
review:
I'm afraid to say that this game has many faults that creates a frustrating experience for many shmup veterans. I think the main problem i find with the game is that it is "lifeless" more or less.

Lets have a checklist to follow:

[b]- Very poor level design.[/b]

This is one of the biggest flaws in the game,. Stages in shmup's need to have a sense of flow about them. Waves, attack formations, enemy tactics, etc. SGS way of doing things is simply to stack as many things as it can that can shoot and spawn in from the top of the screen. The enemies that come towards you feel completely random despite being preset and there is little that breaks this monoity in all of the stages and it creates a frustrating event where 8 to 12 large enemies come at you with little connectivity to each other, some even stacking on top of each other.

It also doesn't help that each stage is set in space. Space is as entertaining in shmup's as what's placed around it and what is placed is either dull single planets or lots of rocks. There is a nice transistion of the background on stage 5 but it's very fleeting.

[b] - Bland boss design [/b]

This is a MAJOR flaw in any game of this genre. All of the bosses in the game are dull, boring boxes that do little to stop you. Most of the bosses have stupid amounts of health and take ages to grind down to dust. They rarely change their attack tactics in response to damage and most of the attack pattens are stupidly easy to dodge out of the way (the 2nd boss is laughable in this respect, as it has no response to the destruction of it's side guns.)

[b] - Spite design is lifeless. [/b]

Other than the player ship and one of the enemy ships, no other spite in the game has any real animations. They just fly at you and shoot. They are shaded colours and some of them are shaped nicely (The 5th stage boss has a nice look to it), but are as lifeless as a cardboard box. Bosses catch fire when low on health (random fire spites drawn over the body) and a few animated lasers but other than that the artwork is as flat as a ironing board.

[b]- Power up system is stupid [/b]

The power up system is wild, untamed and at the same time restrictive and in-organic. In each stage you can collect 1 of each of the power-ups (bullet power-up, sub-weapon power-up dependent on the ship you play as and rate of fire power-up), because of this you can't organicly collect more power ups than the stage number allows (You can collect more if you lost some, but you can't pass the limit set by the stage number). In addition, when you get hit there is a random chance that you will drop a power-up. You can recollect it after a delay but all of these power-ups fly upwards, but because every enemy ship in the game is constantly spawning (outside of bosses) you WILL get hit again by another enemy if you attempt to collect it. Btw.. it is possible to get hit multible times in quick sucession, with the possiability of dropping more than 1 power up.

The biggest problem with this is when fighting bosses. Some bosses are very large and will cover the screen.. and if you get hit that power-up will fly up into the boss's body. During boss battles, there is no way to gain new power-ups so if you lose any of your power-ups you started the boss with you then it will take a even longer grind to kill the boss.

[b] - Poor ship balance [/b]

Yea.. this is often a reason why in many shmup's they keep the playable number of ships to a low number. Some of the ships in this game are pretty useless. The one with the flamethrower for example has terrible usability outside of machoists. Some of the other ships will rip stages and bosses apart like there is no tomorrow. The mutli-sweaping laser ship is pretty much a I-win button in stages 90% of the time while the ship "gold" is pretty much overpowered to the extreme compared to the other ships.

[b] Final Thoughts [/b]

In all due repect, there are some things i like about the game. The life system is a nice conversion over the traditional lives system in most shmups, including the ability to slowly regain life by grazing enemy shots. The soundtrack was above average in most regards and hardcore mode brings true terror to the the audience that desires a good challenge.



In final, there is little i can recommend to a vet of the genre here that you can't find elsewhere on steam at roughly the same price (Reflex, Kamui, Crimson Clover). I do respect the devs making the game for chaity, it's just that the majority of the design is something from a run of the mill game from MS-DOS days.. and not the good ones sadly.
developer_response:
We've rebuilt and rebooted the game TWICE in the last 3 years since your original review of the original version. 

Maybe it's time to give the game another look? :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993615278', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1492226384}
review:
Fantastic game so far! Galaxy Squadron gets extremely intense at times, and is very challenging right from the beginning. The amount of JUICE in this game in incredible. The way the screen shakes when destroying an enemy, the responsive controlls and the satisfying sound effects all combine into a big ball of enjoyable, satisfying, shmuppy goodness. 

I'd say if you enjoy games like Jamestown, Raiden, or Crimzon Clover (just to name a few off the top of my head) you will really enjoy this. 

One suggestion I'd like to see implimented however is a 9:16 mode for vertical monitor play. I didn't see an option for it at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970727734', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1489140179}
review:
良かった：
自機残数を廃し、パワーアップ/ダウン＝生命線とするシステム
初級～中級者に向けた難易度調整
アートワーク。爆発エフェクトも◎
操作性や適切な効果音で快適にプレイできる

良くなかった：
BGMがイマイチ。ラストも盛り上がらない。エンディングはある意味盛り上がる
機体の性能が極端に違うわりに、実際に使ってみないと強さがわからない

インフレしていく敵戦力を、インフレしていく自機火力で黙らせるタイプの弾幕シューティング。
残機制でなく体力制を採用したことで、戦力に押されていくジリジリした感じと、火力で上回るヒャッハー感が楽しめるようになっている。
見た目は派手で難しそうだけど、火力さえ用意できればクリア到達しやすい。とりあえずAmber、Magentaなどの強機体を選ぼう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086134406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1460901683}
review:
Excellent gameplay and very good pixel graphics, kind of a head-nod to older early 90s vertical shooters, as opposed to the Donpachi/Psyvariar/Ikaruga school, which is ironically quite refreshing. Worth mentioning as a bullet hell vet I did miss the speed of movement but once you adjust, you don't even notice. Fantastic tunes to go along with the action, and as would befit a early 90s throwback shooter, cranks out a fair challenge on the later stages.

It is in it's current state a bit buggy, with some awkward sprite issues at times and a crash I experienced where the game just carried on without me once I died, but I would still FIRMLY recommend this game even in it's current state, the gameplay, graphics and music make a seriously solid package, and I'm sure the game will be patched soon.

Plus it's for charity and all. Win win win.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981691323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1457909353}
review: This ams game! It has graphics and sounds. Fun to play. Very tough even on normal modes. No easy difficulty. Lots of ships! Strange screen rez, maybe vertical 4k, not compatible with horizontal screens (but still works). Better than Birds of Flappiness. 8/10 would play again.
